title: 2.0 out of 5 starsAlmost amazing
body: These were the best headphones I had ever bought! They are super comfortable and actually block out noise! They are durable and have a fantastic battery life! The hinges on these are wonderful and sturdy! Built to last!! However, I’ve had these for 8 months now and they are not functioning like they were. I am an adult and the only user of these headphones. I take great care of them. The battery life is much less now. I have to recharge them often and the battery dies faster. They will stop connecting in the middle of use. I sometimes have to turn them off and back on for them to connect again. That is very frustrating. The noise cancelling is hit and miss now. I’ve only had these for 8 months and they are already showing significant issues. I am very disappointed.

author: Mackenzie Finley
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsLoud, Stylish, and Long-Lasting — But a Bit Tight
body: I’ve had the Beats Solo3 Wireless for a while now, and they definitely stand out in a few key areas. The sound is super punchy, especially the bass — perfect for hip-hop, R&B, or anything with a beat. They really bring music to life if you like your audio bold. The battery life is crazy good. I can go days without charging, and when I do need to, that Fast Fuel feature actually works — I can get hours of use from just a few minutes of charging. They’re also really sleek and clean-looking. I love the way they fold up, and they feel pretty durable. Pairing with my phone was super easy — instant with Apple, a little slower with Android but still smooth. Now the only downside: they’re tight on the ears. After a while, especially if I’m wearing glasses or earrings, I start feeling the pressure. I wish they were a little more comfortable for longer listening sessions. Still, if you’re into style, bass-heavy music, and need something that won’t die on you mid-day — these are a solid pick. Not for hardcore audiophiles, but perfect for everyday use.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsUse cotton balls instead!
body: I bought these based on reviews on Amazon. I really needed the ANC function to cancel out outside noise so I can get work done while in crowded places. Well, I can hear my cat meow, cars passing by etc. Absolutely dysfunctional ANC though set up was super easy. I might as well stick in foam earplugs or cotton balls. Very disappointed!

author: Cole
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat feel, good sound
body: I've had one pair of the white and gold for 4 years and a matte black for 2-3. Beats are comfortable and they have held up very well. I use them at the gym and for doing basic music mixes and they're great. They are not the high end sound quality of some others, but they're 90% of it. They fit fantastic and are adjustable. Can be worn for long periods sitting comfortably on your head and they won't feel heavy. The white and gold have minor cracks rom wear and tear over the years but are still in great shape and clean because I respect them and clean them. They will hold up if you treat them well.

author: B@heart
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBeats 4.5 stars, Amazon 1 star
body: Good product, good noise cancelling, on/off switch not reliable.  I bought refurbished and after initially trying it, thought the headset was a really good product that allowed me to concentrate on my music.  But the unreliability of the on/off switch was a concern and I wanted to return them and think about buying brand new or a Bose product instead.  Amazon no longer offered return via UPS and required me to go to an Amazon Fresh Store to return.  Being disabled, I requested to be able to do it at UPS but this was flat out denied.  I wrote Customer Service and explained the difficulty and even offered to pay for the return myself.  I never received a reply.  In all of the times I have bought from Amazon with very few returns, I've never thought twice about buying there.  I will now.

author: Buster
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for Sensitive Ears and All-Day Wear
body: I’ve been using these for about 4 months for work and running, and they’ve held up great. They’re super cute, really comfortable (even with sensitive ears), and don’t make me itchy or sore like most headphones do. They stay in place while running but can get a bit sweaty, so I usually wipe them off after. I can’t wear earrings with them, which is pretty normal for over-ear styles. Bluetooth is mostly reliable but occasionally gets confused if multiple devices are nearby. I also wish the controls—like turning them off—were a little more intuitive. Sound and noise cancelling are solid, battery lasts all day, and they’re easily the most comfortable pair I’ve found.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSound, Comfort, Quality … Beats does not disappoint!
body: Love these Beats headphones!!!! They are very comfortable over the head and on the ears. They provide great sound with long play time and the outside noise canceling is excellent. Charging is quick and blue tooth connection to iPhone & Apple Mac takes less than 30 seconds. They come with a nice storage case and they fold up to make travel with them convenient and safe. Sound, comfort, efficiency and oh, the price - very affordable for the quality!  These Beats are more bang for your buck!  If ear buds aren’t for you, I highly recommend, give these Beats headphones a try!

author: Rock N Roll!!!
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsThe Microphone Sucks!
body: I have used the head phones for about a month now. I wanted to give them a fair chance before leaving a review.  Two most important features of the headphones to me someone who is considered an Audiophile. 1:sound quality 2: The Microphone. 1:Sound quality. Sound quality in these headphones are acceptable.  At first I thought they were horrible. I had previously owned a pair of JBL’s. The sound quality JBL’s were slightly better.  For some reason with the beats I had to really play w the EQ once connected in order to tweak the sound to what i enjoy.  There was a huge muffled sound w the music I generally listen to (Rock/Metal).  Even after playing w the EQ and getting a better sound I can still hear a Muffled quality sadly.  2:The Microphone. It just plainly SUCKS!  I usually talk to my Wife while at at work but ever since I have had these headphones the conversations are short due to her being unable to understand me.  I usually have to almost yell in order for her to hear me. Which I don’t like to do when others are around me.  I shouldn’t have to raise my voice so others can hear my conversation around me.  The other thing I have noticed is although while listening to music the Noise canceling.  The minute you get a phone call or make a phone call the Noise canceling stops and you can now hear everything outside the headphones. Which at times can make it difficult to hear the person on the phone w you. What I do like about the head phones is they do cover the ears and are very comfortable to wear. They do not/have not fallen off my head when i bend over to do something.  They also look nice.  But for amount paid for them not really worth the money.  I wish I had waited and bought a pair of Bose but I was desperate for a new pair of headphones considering my old ones were over 5yrs old and weren’t doing it for me any longer.  I hate long reviews but this had to be said.  If you are not big into music and sound quality and Mic are no big deal to you then the headphones will most likely be good for you.  Beats need to really improve on the mic situation!!!

author: Kelsey
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBetter With Upgrades
body: I bought these headphones because I couldn’t find a pair of earbuds that felt comfortable to me and still wanted a similar connectivity to AirPods without spending $500 on the Maxs. Beats offered that while still being the nicest looking in my opinion. The Studio 3s offered nearly everything I was looking for in terms of connectivity, sound quality, and battery life. Where these fell short for me was comfort. Though they definitely were an improvement over earbuds, these still left something to be desired. The earpads were okay, but the band was very uncomfortable to me after around 30 minutes of wear. I was able to rectify this by purchasing aftermarket pads and a headband sleeve that added a significant amount of comfort, as well as enhanced the color. This definitely made my beats something I reach for frequently again, but ideally, they should have been perfect out of the box for the price tag.

author: Mr. Review
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat product again from Apple
body: Block the Noise, Boost the Vibe — Pure Sound, Zero Distractions 🎧🔥🤍 The Beats Studio3 Wireless Headphones are straight-up audio luxury. Powered by the Apple W1 chip, they deliver seamless Bluetooth connectivity, crystal-clear sound, and that signature deep Beats bass that hits just right. With Active Noise Cancelling (ANC), you can tune out the world and lock in on your playlist, podcast, or Zoom call — whether you're in a busy office, loud gym, or trying to ignore your roommate's terrible taste in TV. You get 22 hours of battery life (yup, you read that right), and Fast Fuel tech gives you 3 hours of playback from just a 10-minute charge. Comfort-wise? These over-ear cushions are soft, snug, and built for all-day wear — perfect for work, travel, or just vibing solo. And that clean white finish? Sleek, modern, and goes with everything. Add in the built-in mic and on-ear controls, and this is everything you want in a premium pair of wireless headphones. If you’re ready to level up your sound and shut the noise out in style — Studio3 doesn’t miss.

author: CBas
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAMAZING

author: Donald Carlson
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsQuality in Almost Every Piece
body: Had these headphones for about 4 years now. Sound is still the same quality you can expect from beats. And it’s still pretty comfortable over all for over ear headphones. They also get the type of loud you’d want from a pair of headphones when you want your music to get ya amped up for something. These definitely hit the right spot. Bluetooth is still amongst the best quality throughout the years when compared to other headphones. Since my head is a little larger, I’ve had to replace the head band that connects at the folding points twice, which is no big deal. It’s mainly because some of the points are small and thin enough to break. Replacement parts are easy to buy which is nice. I’ve also found that the ear muffs might need to be replaced as they end up “melting” (only way I can think to describe it) so I might need to replace those as well, but we will see. Overall the function of these headphones are solid for sure. Battery takes little time to charge and can run for a couple days without needing another charge which is nice. The design I feel could use a little work to have some thickening to specific structural pieces or the band could come in different sizes. Regardless this product is some of the better quality you’ll find for headphones.

body: These are very quality for 20 bucks. The charge on these last 65 hrs. A 5 minute charge will give you 3 hrs. 2 hour charge will give you 65 hrs. The sound quality is super good. They fold nicely. I found an old case of a cheaper pair that I once owned. The case was actually better than those earphones. I'm glad I kept it. Because it fits these new ones perfectly.  So I use it to house these while I'm at work. As soon as I heard the sound quality on these. I ordered and a second pair and Amazon delivered it to my son who lives in Vegas. I sent him some earbuds that I loved like 3 months ago. I told him that he would ditch them after trying these. Needless to say my son is spoiled. He's 26 and I still send him cool gifts. But I KNOW he loves these. He usually doesn't say much because he's not materialistic. I guarantee he's using them. I'll have to call him later

I pretty go to bed wearing them to help cope with my tinnitus. I've had Soundcore A-20 Sleep headset (2 pair a $100 buck a pop first pair last one and the second burned and with a replacement burning weeks after replaced) I've had pair of Sony's and JBL both broke on me. that's when got the Beribes which charge up quick and pretty last me three days... I know when the ones give up the ghost I will be buying Beribes again.!

author: Honey Badger
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSeems amazing so far :)
body: When I say so far, I mean I only got it today so I haven't been able to test the longevity of the charge or its durability over time. But for this price, what I have experienced so far is impressive. It was charged fully in 2.5 hours. Probably before that but I didn't check. They are very light and comfortable over the ears. My ears are very sensitive to any kind of prolonged pressure and some headphones like airpods are just impossible for me to wear. Even ones I do consider bearable start to hurt after a short period of time. These felt almost like nothing. Despite their comfort, even without music playing they provided a quiet experience. I had the TV on and could barely hear it with the headphones on. It was very easy to pair (it took a few seconds but did so effortlessly) and the controls are fairly intuitive. The cord may come in handy in the future, so it was a nice bonus.  I also liked the left/right labelling, as it does make a difference and it's usually indicated in the tiniest letters possible, if at all.  This made it simple and straightforward to don. I found there is a definite difference in sound using the equalizer presets, though for my taste the Pop equalizer sounded the best for pretty much all genres of music, ranging from opera to punk and a lot of stuff in between. Sound quality was far better than I anticipated from a $20 headset, certainly on par with those I have spent a lot more money on. If you are looking for inexpensive and GOOD headphones that don't hurt your head and effectively block out noise without the label and price of "noise-cancelling" this is your huckleberry.

author: Emily Williams
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsDecent. You get what you pay for 💅🏼
body: Truly you get what you pay for. Don't come expecting 300 dollar Bose quality. But they work well enough for a basic listening experience. Not noise canceling at all. In fact, they seem to amplify background noise when I have them on sans music. But they get pretty loud, so that can work well enough haha. The fit of the headphones leaves the smallest gap over my left ear, no matter which way I adjust them. So the right side always sounds the slightest bit louder than the left. It is so slight, that probably wouldn't bother most people. But it can really bug me sometimes. The right side fits seamlessly, so I'm sure this is just the way they are made. The ear support is ok, and they stay on my head fine unless I bend all the way over... Then they slide right off. If you are wanting these for the gym, I would say to use them for mild workouts, otherwise you will be frustrated 😵 The set up is easy. A quick pairing connection. One button to change the EQ presets. The bass is average on these. Definitely not the worst I've had, but I'm a bass head, so they do lack a bit. The charging is pretty quick. They fully charge in about 20-25 min and can last a while. I only really use these in the evenings when I clean before bed, so one charge lasts me quite some time. Overall, if you are just needing a cheap pair of headphones that look decent and don't sound horrible, these will do you right 👍🏼

author: Carlos Manuel Montero Tejada
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLa mejor opcion si no quieres gastar una fortuna
body: 🔊 Si buscas comodidad, batería duradera y buen sonido sin gastar una fortuna, estos audífonos BERIBES son una joya. La batería es una locura: horas de reproducción sin preocuparte por cargarlos a cada rato. Además, los 3 modos de ecualizador son un plus brutal, porque puedes personalizar el sonido según lo que estés escuchando: música, películas o podcasts. Son ligeros, no aprietan y los graves se sienten potentes pero limpios. Perfectos para estar en casa, la oficina o incluso conectarlos a la TV sin cables molestos. Por el precio, son una compra muy sólida y práctica. 👌

author: Amazon Customer

I’m going to try this for a week and possibly upgrade to a better model if I continue to be unimpressed with the microphone performance..

author: Faith Miller-Hines
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood buy.
body: The media could not be loaded. They are nice. Exactly what the description says. They are not the bright green like in the picture. They are more of an olive green. They get loud. Love the EQ settings. Pairing to Bluetooth is really easy. The buttons are nice and simple. Fit perfect around my ears. They do feel a LITTLE cheaply made but All in all good product for price.

author: GP
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove bluetooth earbuds!
body: For years I have used headphones while on my very noisy treadmill. This is my first set of earbuds and I am thrilled with the difference they have made; and with the ANC on, the treadmill noise is well muted.

author: Amazon2Detroit
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWOW! ….. YES BUY THEM!!!!
body: Got them and they were fully charged and ready to go. I used them to see if it ran on my PS5 which I was able to do amazing!!! Then I connected to my phone and downloaded the app and played music podcasting and action scenes and my mind is blown. I have AirPods and I read someone’s review when they said they replaced their AirPods I’m like wtf but now I understand. The songs hit different with these. It really pulls out the background vocals and adlibs in songs. Then it has a “where’s my” app where it records the last place you had them so you never have to worry about losing them. Then you have the app where you can tune and change the EQ download community EQs. I got the red color and they are bussin!! They set up easily and connected with no issues l. I have not tried the waterproofing but I believe it as everything else has been on point or surpassed my expectations. Now I love my head tracking with the AirPods and overall build but I can easily see me swapping to tozo when listening to music or on my ps5. I haven’t tested the phone quality as I don’t plan on using them for those purposes. If I do test I will come and update the review. Touch siding for volume control and they are a perfect fit with many options for different sized ears. Man talk about socks blown off. Unsure what some reviews were thumbing this down for but I guess to each is own but the majority of the world will appreciate these earbuds. I’ll probably be back for another pair. I saw a different style I wanna try and now I trust this brand so we will see . Color is so amazing

author: mike
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsQuality sucks
body: NOT EVEN WATER RESISTANT, much less water proof. Water barely splashed the earbud and it stopped working.  You get what you pay for, DO NOT BUY THESE EARBUDS!!

author: Donna C.
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsThese have changed. Not as good as older version.
body: 3 stars based on the size. I bought a pair of the NC9 about a year ago to use for work. They fit so good I decided to get a pair for home use to replace another Tozo product. However, the new ones looked different at first. I wore them for a while and they weren't as comfortable. I then placed then side by side from the older pair and you can see the difference. The older ones were bigger. They've obviously changed the design and to me, they went backwards. The older style was much more comfortable to wear for hours at a time. The sound quality is fine. The new ones also have a 2-3 second delay before connecting too which is slightly frustrating.

author: lars
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVer Nice.
body: These work well for what I need them for, listening to podcasts, phone calls, and light music listening.  I am not an audiophile so these work well for me.

author: Chris J
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Quality
body: Make sure you get the app, great sound for the price. And great customer service.

author: David Bradford
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBuy these.

author: ELVIS
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFANTASTIC SOUND.

author: dks716
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsdefective.
body: ordered first pair. Left speaker cut out and dropped 95% volume for no cause two weeks into ownership. sent back and asked for a replacement pair. received replacement pair, Left speaker cut out and dropped 95% volume for no cause two hours into ownership.  Obviously a batch defect or design flaw. Poor quality for a cheap price, but that’s the Chinese way.

author: Yodie
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThese are tiny but mighty!
body: So far so good! I ordered two of these- one for my sister and one for myself. I was put in charge of researching and getting us both a pair of earbuds that were cheap, yet reliable. They fit nicely in my ears, and come with different sized ear bits. They were easy enough to connect to Bluetooth, although instructions were not clear. They seem to work great, with good sound quality. They get pretty loud and the volume control is easy to use. I have yet to try the noise canceling feature. The charge immediately started going down, but I hope it’s just bc it’s straight out of the box. These are sleek looking and truly a dark black color. I’ll be using these for work while my sister uses them to go running. If anything goes wrong, I’ll be sure to update.

author: William Heimann
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat value and sturdy
body: Great value for these buds. They sound decent and have many ANC settings and options. The app is easy to use. The best part is these buds stay out. Used to run 13 miles last night and not once did I have to adjust them or push them back in my ears.

So if you EVER thing you will need to talk on the phone, do not buy these. Don't think you can "get away" with occasional calls, the mic makes these UNUSABLE

The charge also lasts longer than my other wireless earbuds, including my more expensive ones. No issues with Bluetooth connection. I’m happy with my purchase.

author: Ballmomof 5
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent sound quality!!

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSatisfecho
body: Exelente producto.  Buen  precio

author: Diplomat
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsCrap App, Finicky Touch Controls
body: Equalizer for the earbuds can be (in theory) adjusted through the Tozo app.  The app requires you submit email address and then enter authorization code sent to that address.  However despite repeated requests for the code, not even one was ever sent, even hours after the initial request.  Thus the app is not usable, and hence no way to adjust the EQ settings other than what the connected device (phone, whatever) has available. The touch controls are also erratic.  Sometimes it will advance a track as requested, other times there is no response.  And it is difficult to insert/adjust them without engaging the touch control and thus pausing or advancing or something. The sound quality is ok, but not exceptional.  Battery life seems good, multiple hours before they need to go back into the case. Outside the return window, and at this point regretting I purchased them.

author: VC Alabama
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExceptional Value
body: I have been more pleased with this purchase.  I could not see paying $50 or more for ear buds that are so easily lost.  These exceed my expectations after reading some negative reviews.  I have used them for approximately 40 hours and only lost connection a couple of times and all I had to do was place the buds back in the car and take them back out and they reconnected immediately.

author: CafeMartin
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsFrustrating design, unreadable user guide
body: These earbuds are an example of the sort of design that engineers believe elegant and users find frustrating, if not impossible: a single button or surface is meant to provide the means for many - or all - functions. There are NO buttons; the user is meant to learn from the user guide where on the ear bud surfaces to press. They call it "Smart Touch." As for the user guide, the font is so small it cannot be read without magnification, and I don't mean just reading glasses; one needs a magnifying glass or to take photos of the booklet and make the images larger on one's screen. There is no reason for this font size, because there is ample white space for a slightly larger font. The clearances between function areas are so close that merely adjusting the bud position in one's ear sets off multiple functions and warning sounds and shifts the location of the controls. I need my phone to control volume, and generally just swat at the earbuds to start/restart noise cancelling or media play, and this doesn't always work. The charging is fast, but there is just one specific way to place the earbuds so the lid can be closed, and this takes some trial and error. These earbuds are poorly designed. They are seemingly basic earbuds, and yet, there's a learning curve, courtesy of an inadequate user guide that cannot be read without some kind of magnification. I'm using them for sleep, but nothing really keeps them inside - or even on - the ear. So the noise one has blocked out before sleep might still wake the user once the buds have fallen out. My verdict: for the price, they are adequate, but it's worth spending a bit more for a design that makes sense to someone other than the designer.

author: Paul Ritter
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsYou get what you paid for.
body: Meh. was looking for an affordable option to Apple AirPod's. While these certainly meet the affordable aspect, I wouldn’t call them a good alternative to AirPods. Functionality seems good and were easy to pair. Sound quality is ok but for a real audiophile they’re a bit of a let down. The construction seems about what I expected for $30ish…lightweight & cheap. There is an optional app that can be downloaded that has an equalizer feature that, when used in a trial mode, seems to have the ability to dial the sound in to your liking. However, to get full functionality of this feature costs $40/year. This seems to give access to more music, but I’m not looking for more music, I just want to listen to what I have. Clearly these buds are designed just to get you to sign up for a subscription. Maybe this is a plus for some but not me. Overall I’d say they’re worth what I paid which isn’t much.

author: Gerard
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery comfortable to wear.
body: Very comfortable to wear. They sound great to me.

author: Se lo instale a mis audífonos pero no cubre bien la parte de arriba, me toca cada nada estar ajustándose para que quede bien.

body: El producto llegó acorde a la descripción y ha funcionado bien hasta el momento.

author: noneya
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWoohoo, these Are great!
body: 1st pair of wireless earbuds, all I can say is YAY!  Unboxed today.  Very easy to work and awesome sound.  Love the app too, customize the earbud sound and more🤟

author: jz1
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAwesome for a fraction of the cost
body: Had (2) sets of Samsung noise cancelling earbuds. Both sets failed. Got these for a fraction of the cost and they are far superior in sound and functionality. Don't waste your money on just a name, these are awesome!

author: Francesca
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsTOZO's customer service line will take care you!
body: I received this as a replacement from TOZO when I noticed one earbud of the T6 stopped working. TOZO was efficient in helping me figure whether or not troubleshooting could fix the issue, and when it did not, they were happy to replace it. The NC9 is not something I'd pick for myself usually as I have smaller ears and the shape didn't fit as well as I'd like, but they connect quickly to my Bluetooth, the sound quality is great, and I enjoy that I can use a USB-C for charging easily rather than a micro-USB. The ANC works well, but I don't love that I have to skip through the transparency mode to get to it, and only being able to use one side to pause/play. Regardless, it does what it says, with high quality and an affordable price, which is why it still gets 5 stars from me even if it isn't my perfect fit!

author: Luisa H.
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsSound quality is OK
body: I had high hopes for such inexpensive earbuds. I only wanted to be able to make phone calls and use the noise cancelling feature, but the truth is the sound is not good for phone calls or music. It sounds like I am listening to AM radio inside a box. The charge lasts a long time and it's comfortable in the ear.

author: Greidy Velasquez
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsNo se quedan en la oreja se caen

author: Christopher Mulloy
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat

author: Amazon Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNo noise canceling without location
body: Active noise canceling is pretty much useless considering you have to have your location on all the time. The battery drain is ridiculous. There's no reason to need location to use noise canceling. Makes these perfectly good earbuds garbage.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsDon't sign to user agreement to access the app.
body: I have only been using it few days, but so far it is good. I HAVE ONE BIG ISSUE IT CONNECTS DIRECTLY THRU YOUR PHONE VIA BLUETOOTH EASY. TO GET ALL OF THE FEATURES THAT YOU WANT YOU HAVE TO INSTALL THERE APP. DURING THE INSTALL YOU HAVE TO AGREE TO USER AGREEMENT. IF YOU TAKE THE TIME TO ACTUALLY READ IT, IT GIVES THEM RIGHT TO MONITOR YOUR HEALTH INFO AND A LONG LIST OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA. CAN SOMEONE PLEASE EXPLAIN TO ME WHAT THIS HAS TO WITH EAR BUDS. NO! IT IS CHINESE SPYWARE! I NOW HAVE TO DECIDE ON KEEP THEM WITH BACIC FEATURES OR SENDING THEM BACK. WE ALL NEED TO USER AGREEMENTS AND ACCEPT TO PLAY WITH OUR SHINEY NEW TOP.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsHorrible Sound
body: It sounds pretty horrible.

author: Preston
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsSound leakage and Poor Washed Out Sound Quality
body: These earbuds are packaged very nicely. The charging prongs protrude a lot so getting the earbuds to reliably charge in their case doesn't seem to be an issue. THE BAD: I bought these since they seemed similar to my Losei earbuds (but I think Losei went out of business or something). I thought these would give me a similar experience. However, the sound seems a lot more washed out or drained; like I'm listening through an echo chamber. Also, these had a slight amount of sound leakage, which I think can be a problem if I was listening to loud music in a car next to others. I can hear my music if I hold the earbuds a few inches from my ears, which I don't like.

I was always skeptical about cheap earbuds because of their microphone quality. And this one wasn’t an exception. It’s not an average but a complete failure with mediocre and almost non-existent ability to catch any voice.

body: These headphones have good sound quality, but they frequently toggle noise cancelling while I wear them. They fit better than most, but there's room for improvement.

author: Kevin Cooper
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing
body: These are actually amazing. I returned a $100 3m headset thinking they were the best and I couldn’t even hear the music while mowing grass. I saw someone mention these and I returned the 3m and tried these for the first time yesterday cutting grass and wow they are amazing. I’m still learning what all it does but when you open the app and press on noise cancelling the sound of my mower disappeared. All I could do was feel the vibrations from it. That’s exactly what I wanted. These things are amazing.

author: Joeltrain

author: Jonosubucks
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsWorse fit; better sound quality
body: The fit is not as good as the NC9.  They just aren't large enough to form a tight fit in my male ears.  At least they got rid of that annoying woman's voice every time you changed modes though.

author: Old Man Rage
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing. Again.
body: Unbelievable. I bought the NC3s and was blown away. So much so I grabbed these and two sets of the crystal line to have on hand and use for different devices/purposes. I did all of this for 1/3 of the cost of one set of some brands and have sacrificed nothing in quality of sound, probably even gained in some cases. These are ridiculous. I listen to a very wide range of music and it all sounds incredible. You will hear new things in songs you have heard thousands of times. The range is excellent as well. The warranty is excellent, the features are incredible, the app works very well and is a quality app. It has even updated both these and the NC3s. Getting software updates on the buds at this price was a big surprise. I will never think twice about buying anything Tozo makes as a result of my experiences so far. In a world of so much garbage and poor quality it is an absolute treasure to find something so good at any price, let alone in this range.

My only gripe is that they are so small that they keep slipping out of my fingers when I handle them in or out of their case. Not disappointed at all with the sound and NC. Fits nicely in my ears.

Now if they would integrate the functions into the BT connection like my Beats, that would make all the difference not having to download an app.  Still a great buy!

My nc9 earbuds show I have 95% charge on the case however even after leaving the buds in the case for hours they show at less than 10% and keep shutting off. This is the second time already! Unfortunately I threw away the box and can't return them. I also have the t6 earbuds and love them. A couple years and not one problem

author: SuperBee
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis is better than most of the earbuds in this price range.
body: This is by far the best earbuds you can buy for the price range. I bought this specially for the battery life, this thing lasts you more than you can imagine. I used this earbuds for 4 hours phone call session, and it still got 50% battery life. I'll say if you want to get the earbuds purely for its battery life, this is the one you wanna go for.  However, this does not detract from the sound quality; the platform on their app displays people's different tuning, and it becomes really impressive with a small tweak to its equalizer. Overall, this is very impressive for what it costs. I have already stopped using my Sennheiser Momentum and now use the Tozo NC9 as my daily device, which I don't have to worry about.

author: Rick

body: While price was very affordable, these earbuds were horrible when used while jogging. They created their own noise when jogging or while running on a treadmill. They also induced a “ringing” in my ears after just one time use. Noise cancellation was average, touch control was ultra sensitive. Overall I would not recommend.

author: Kathryn Oliver
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsTozo NC9

author: Kayden Jones
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorthwhile purchase.
body: Honestly I've bought these a couple times since I lost a pair, but they're are really durable I've dropped them while going 20 miles per hour and the worked perfectly fine with barely any scratches on the case and through a dirt bike crash and they still lasted. They're good quality for their price. This is a great brand overall and the touch controls work good. The app it comes with allows for several modes for how sound from outside comes through or the lack of it and if you like your music the app has a equalizer for you that you can customize. They fit well in the ears and stay in well. Overall really good product.

author: michael a nicolosi
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsExtremely hard to operate, but comfortable 😌! Don't buy!!!
body: Very comfortable eatbuds but extremely hard to operate.  Still unable to turn volume up or down. It constantly shuts down while playing and moving around with cellphone in pocket. One speaker shuts down all the time. Customer service is terrible.  Unbelievable how they just don't give a damn about customers and their problems.  Do not buy these earbuds, you'll be very upset at the junk made by this company and terrible customer service

author: no name needed
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsI wanted to give it five stars but…
body: Not the best sound but good value. Better “ear fit” than an Air Pod but lacking the dynamic range. The EQ on the app was very limited.

author: Adam
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVALUE!!!!

author: Prova
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsamazing battery life
body: last during a full 10 hour shift! and the charging case last for like a week and a half or more (i didnt want it getting lower than 30%) i use these strictly for work so i can focus a little better. last from clock in to clock out, probably even longer cause i'll switch ears every now and then. comes with a bunch of different options to best fit your ear too. the color is bland, but its super functional so thats all i really care about. i will never buy any of those expensive brands ever again cause these are just that good. sound quality is great too. the app settings are a little strange and complicated though.

author: Bilja Savo
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest value!
body: There are great. Probably best bang for your buck out there.

author: Aaron
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat fit and really good sound!
body: Stop waiting money on insanely overpriced earbuds. You’re not going to get better all around buds then these for close to what they cost. I’m not a reviewer of things, but these are easy to setup and the Tozo app is awesome. Just buy them and thank you Tozo for making nice stuff at an affordable price.

author: Triston
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent!
body: Fit and work great. I got mine on the prime day deals, but I can honestly say they are well worth their regular list price.

author: Kelly
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIt won't allow you to input your info for the warranty
body: I like the product but can't speak to the long life expectancy. The first message I got from them was an invitation to register for their warranty, except that it wouldn't actually let me enter info. After multiple attempts I determined they didn't really want that to happen. I left the internet window open over night and it looked like it had accepted the page one info, but then did the same thing with the next page. A real WTF situation. I can't say why since Amazon gave me a strike for profanity when I said what I think happened but whatever. I do like the product but don't look for any legit warranty  since it doesn't allow you to input your info. Good luck

author: Marty
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat noise canceling earbuds
body: Excellent sound for the price. I also bought the Soundcore A40 earbuds and the Tozo has better noise canceling. I also like the custom EQ settings.

author: Derek Scranta
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing
body: Great headphones for price

author: Crowley
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThey're better than before!

author: Jordan

body: Excelente

author: susan
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDid not last!
body: Purchased in March and now they won’t charge. I would expect them to last longer then a few months.

author: Robert Ponichtera
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsQuality Product
body: This is the second time I bought this product. My last one broke at the ear curve on the same day. Of course, this is after 5 year of use and running in the Florida sun I think 5 years is a great longevity for this product and if they are still being made I will repurchase when this one breaks many years from now.

author: David
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBad durability, already don't work in one ear.
body: This product does not last long. I don't use it very often to exercise, typically just doing chores around the house, and it's already failed after a little over a year. The durability of this product seems to be low quality. I can only hear on the right ear with the power button unless I juggle the connecting cord, it's clearly sub-par wiring between the two earbuds. If the random, weird company WISHTIME could provide a free replacement that worked with any staying power I could assume this was just a one-off faulty unit.

author: n
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood for sweaty workouts
body: Good for sweaty outdoor runs. I've been using for about 3 months and no problems but they are so cheap even if they died I wouldn't mind replacing them. The sound is a little bit quiet - maybe I'm just used to noise cancelling but in my gym they blast music on the speakers and it's a bit hard to hear if I am trying to watch a show on my iPad. However, this is an advantage for outdoor runs because it enables me to listen to music while still being aware of my surroundings. It's a bit challenging to pair to a new device but I figured it out eventually.

author: Alejandro
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest bang for the buck. impressed about the durability after many years.
body: I was having a hesitation about the product due to its affordable price, didn't have high hopes, but it turn out to be a very good product that still work despite I bought it many years ago. the battery still works very well. impressed

author: Milo
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsDifferent Headphones Every Time
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: This is my 4th time buying this listing and each time the headphones are different. The pair I bought before this one did not last a year and the volume buttons never worked. This volume on this current pair works, but there are a lot of connectivity issues which means I have to go into the settings on my device to hook up with the headphones frequently since the headphones don't automatically link up after paired. It's fine enough for the price if they last two years like my first two purchases of these did, but also be warned you might get a completely different type of headphone from the one I ordered.

author: TraceyB
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood product
body: This is so convenient. I use it for both exercise and just when I'm out walking or mowing the yard. The battery life is great. The Bluetooth connection is really strong as I've been 50 ft or more away from my phone and I still had Bluetooth.

author: APNW
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood Headphones For Most Uses
body: This is my second set. First set lasted over 7 years of pretty regular use. I like them overall. They were reliable and sound good enough that I bought a new pair recently. Definitely not as good as my Bose but they are good for things like calls and working out, especially for the price. Hope this second pair lasts as long. The one thing I wish they would change is the low battery warning coming up sooner. When it comes up you might have 15 to 20 min left before it dies. Too short. Should be more like an hour.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsStill good quality even after 2 years of heavy use
body: Bought these 2 years ago. Easy to pair, sound quality great, holds charge for 15+ hours as advertised. Even after 2 years of nearly everyday use in the hot sun. Highly recommend.

body: Works great for exercise, sweat proof and connects easily to bluetooth. Had some trouble with the charger, but the manufacturer made it easy to get the product replaced under warranty. Thanks!

Great sound a good quality but had to buy another pair recently because I lost all of the ear buds. The quality of the pair I recently bought is horrible. The sound is so much worse and the earbuds are different and so much more uncomfortable too

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNot worth your money if you intend to use for 40hr work weeks.
body: If you plan on using this every day working 40 hour weeks doing light physical labor be aware it will likely only last a few months before you'll need to replace it. The name of the manufacturer will probably also change after 6 months to a year. This exact item with a slightly different logo was previously sold by "Treblab". At least then it lasted about 8 months before failing.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEar buds

author: Dennis Lantigua
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsStopped working

author: Null
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsPoor quality, stopped working very quickly.
body: Won't turn on after a month and a half of use,l. Rather, they turn on, then immediately off with a fully charged battery.

title: 3.0 out of 5 starsVolume is too for newer headset version.
body: I've pressed two sets of there's headphones.. the first was the better of the two by a long shot.  The newest set is very low volume when everything on my phone or laptop and the headset are turned all the way up.  Kicking myself that I lost the older pair that used a micro USB charging cable ..( the new set used USB-C cable)

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsThis pair went bad after 4 months.
body: Can someone say how to claim warranty on these? Amazon just says return window closed. Troubleshooting steps don’t apply. These simply went bad after 4 months.  No way to claim warranty support that I can find even tho they claim it has one year warranty… thanks for any help offered.

author: Eric Padilla
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsMala inversión

author: Kasra
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsUnreliable Connection
body: I ended up returning these after several tries. While it looks nice and feel comfortable, I had repeated issues with the connection dropping—especially when running with my phone in my pocket. It also wouldn’t pair with my laptop at all, despite multiple attempts and resets. On top of that, the controls are oddly configured—double-tapping redials your last call instead of skipping the tracks, which led to awkward moments.

author: Rolando Saldana
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe quality is really good
body: The sound and bass sound good. Comfort is it good and for the ear it’s really gripped on. Highly recommend. This may be the best cheap version on beats to be honest.

author: KathrynJoestar
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBroke right after return window.
body: Broken right after refund window just stopped working and powered off with a full battery. don’t waste your hard earned cash. Had a fun chest day with no tunes.

author: RVGeek
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsAwful product poor quality.
body: Where to begin… the wire shorted out and only the right side worked. The power button rattles around making an annoying sound. There is a buzzing noise all the time. Last but not least they won’t Stan in place when laying down.

author: Tess McCormick
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBreak After Less Than Ten Uses
body: The quality of these headphones has completely dropped off. For ~$20 these used to be reliable little headphones that had a long battery life and worked for at least a year or two well (blue blinking light aside). I’ve repurchased them twice recently because of defects, the sound just stopped working altogether suddenly and the earbud broke off within a couple of uses on both recent pairs. I’m done buying from this supplier. They are no longer worth even the $20 when they only work for a couple of uses.

author: karolee gardiner
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest Bluetooth Headphones
body: Great headphones. I purchased them for my fiance who's a garbage man, plays softball and do his side jobs while listening to muaic and these headphones are awesome. Hes had them since christmas 2023 and they still keep a full charge for 2 days for him and when they do get low it only takes 30 minutes to charge. Awesome headphones 10/10 would buy them again. A nice big plus is that they have a type C Charger

author: Amazon Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDisappointed
body: I think these are the ones I got a few times before so I got another pair . But this time they weren’t good . They’re extremely low . People could hear me talking but it was extremely hard for me to hear them . They also didn’t come with a case like the other pairs I purchased before . Highly disappointed. Won’t buy again

author: W. Benjamin Myers
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsFine-Until it wasn't
body: Stopped working out of nowhere. One morning it worked fine, the next day stopped after about 3 months.

author: Prime User E
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsReviewing 3 years after purchase
body: I’m writing this 3 years after the fact. These are cheap headphones but you get a bang for your buck. I bought these in the summer of 2022. I’ve also bought headphones from a competitor that looks exactly the same. The competitors on Amazon fell apart within a year, however I’m still using these ones 3 years after purchase. I only use these for the gym, EVERY DAY, through sweat and abuse yet the base and sound in both buds are just as good as when i bought them. In no way am I really taking care of these things so it’s just a testament to the quality of these “cheap” headphones. It’s $20, take the dive. I’m sure you’ll like them. Currently in process of buying my second one as a backup.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsQuality
body: For listening music it’s OK, not a device of talking on the phone.

author: Ian Lipson
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsStopped working after 2 months!
body: I had a pair before which lasted for well over a year. When they stopped working, I bought another pair. they worked well for two months and then stopped working completely. They are inexpensive headphones, but 2 months is a very short time.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsOnly ones still kicking since Dec 2023

author: Amazon Customer

body: So I bought these hoping that they would connect to my laptop's bluetooth. They do not, iPhone connects, but my laptop it doesnt at all. Even reset it, turned bluetooth on and off, nada. Sound, look, comfort all are great but the fact it's not connecting to my laptop makes it so I will not be buying from this brand again.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Price

author: BigSport
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsEarbuds sound good
body: Sound great, just don't like having to charge it with a USB-C cord.  This is not a common charging USB for most small items, so you have an odd ball charging card always laying around.

author: 2cortenfour
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsThese changed?? Would have returned but didn’t use them right away
body: I have purchased these a few times. Usually they’re fine. The sound is pretty good and they’re affordable. When they wear out I just get a new pair. But these blue ones are garbage. 1. They randomly connect and disconnect, or shut off completely 2. The caller ID is screwed up It will say the number once - then some lady comes on speaking another language yelling “LI KYEN!! LI KYEN!! LI KYEN!! LI KYEN!! LI KYEN!!” until I reject the call or answer it These issues need to be dealt with

author: Emily
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsQuality Dropped
body: When I bought these a year ago, they were fantastic for the price and I loved them. I'm not very gentle with them, so I needed a new pair recently. But now these feel like they were made by Dollar Tree! The plastic feels nasty and both earbuds rattle, even the one that doesn't have the battery and button inside it. They changed the voice for the "power on, pairing, connected" for some reason and it now also sounds like a Dollar Tree knock off voice of the original pair's voice. Very frustrated and disappointed with the massive drop in quality

author: Medardo E. Sanchez
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcelente
body: Muy bien estado ,y buen sonido muchas gracias

author: Bradly Y
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsGreat with music can't hear calls
body: I have owned 10 sets of these.  They were all great. Except this pair and the ones I got just before them.  Ordered them a month apart.  Music sounds great.  The calls however you can't hear people talk hardly.  I hope they change back to whatever they were doing before.

author: KM
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNot very Comfortable
body: Hello, these are a good idea, but they hurt my ears. I tried to change the earbud speakers and one I put a smaller one on and that works well but I couldn't get the other bigger one off and didn't have the patience to put another small one on.

author: Kate
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsIf I could give these a 0 I would
body: These are the only thing I have bought of Amazon in years and not had them work, despite reading the instructions, following them, trying to figure it out on my own, and going to Internet resources like YouTube and Reddit. I ended up e-wasting mine.

author: Anonimo
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsexplode
body: I bought these in October and today after 2 months of use I had them on the floor and I was woken up by a loud noise and immediately a strong smell of smoke and I saw that the battery had exploded, luckily I wasn't using them.

author: Tiffany Petri
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsLow quality
body: I've had these for a few months now, and have had issues since day 1. The sound quality is no where near that of the U9 Model I had before. It only warns you about a low battery like 5 minutes before it dies. And recently, no one can hear me if I have them on, which is half the reason I have/need them. Stay away, it's cheap, but you get a cheap experience, and I already need to buy a new set because of all the issues

author: Macgirl, Inc.
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsIt’s December - 1 month after purchase- broken!
body: Cheap,  broke after a month.  Now useless.

author: Serena
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Value
body: I've had these for over a year.  I use them while running.  I run about 15-20 miles per week.  They stay in perfectly and hold a charge for a long time (I don't charge them after every run).  I love that they are inexpensive and work well.  I'm not stressed out about losing them.

author: LisaG.

body: They work great , sound is amazing, just like my old pair of Beets . They don’t make the corded ones anymore so I got these to try and they work just as good if not better !

author: S

body: Comfortable and stays in when running. Now has universal charging port so I can throw away some old cords. We have purchased this several times in different colors at our house - 4 of us have them. Durable - have never had these break. A couple have been lost or forgotten places over the years and we buy it again right away.

author: deesno
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHad for 6 years and still using them
body: I am happy to report that I have had these earbuds for 6 years and I am still using them! Worth the money.😊

author: BenAtFLA
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsDisappointing sound
body: I've had an identical version of these buds by made Let's Fit that I've used for biking for several years, this pair looks identical, but the sound output doesn't compare. I had to turn the volume to 80 on these to equal 30% on the old pair and then it just sounds like a toy speaker. No fidelity at all. Returning them.

author: Bradford Caslon
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsMade in China
body: You do not have to worry about these earbuds falling out of your ears.

author: Pat Nolden
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood sound
body: Very good sound and last.  Will work until you lose them, lol. Price very good.....quality

author: festus
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWaste of $20
body: These headphones are really hit or miss. It seems like every other pair we purchase we have problems with from this company, and the return window is pretty small.  We’ve owned several pairs over the years, my last pair worked great but my daughter accidentally cut through the cord so I bought a new pair. The new pair was terrible from the start. The volume and skip buttons didn’t function, the microphone was horrible and I had a hard time connecting it. Now it’s only been 4 months since I’ve purchased the headphones and the sound is now going out too. Waste of $20. It’s sad because I really like the overall design of these, and when you get a good pair they are great.

author: R. Gable
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsLightweight, but hard to keep onears
body: When trying to adjust on ears, I kept accidentally pressing the main button which turns the phones off.

author: William F.
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNot worth it
body: These headphones were “fine” when I first got them. They had subpar audio quality, but I expected that for headphones that were advertised to be waterproof. The issue is that they arent just not waterproof, they’re not even water resistant. After using them during one single shower, they now won’t charge or turn on at all. Very disappointing. Also very uncomfortable. The fit and size never seemed to work well with any ear.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNo sirve
body: No prenden, lleva 24 horas cargando y nunca prendieron. No sirve y no gaste su dinero.

author: Michelle M
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat Ear Buds

author: Indigo Jack
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsWorks But Volume Is So Low,,,,Older Ones Had Better Volume!
body: Ive Bought These Many Times Before For Myself And Friends, Very Unhappy With The Sound Level,,,,Terrible So Low! Used Some Older Ones To make Sure, They Where Way Better Much Louder Its easy To Turn Them Down, But When They Are Too Low Its Terrible! WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN, AND MY HEARING IS GREAT!

author: DyreWulf
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsThese aren't lasting like they used to
body: This is, I believe, my third pair, and each pair has lasted less and less time before eventually failing. I still give them four stars because the low price plus what use you get out of them is OK for that price point, but if you're looking for longevity in a product, this isn't it.  I wish they had a model 30-40% more expensive that would last 2-3 years, because that would be the one I would buy, I prefer the corded, over-the-ear version of ear buds to the individual ones.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsI really love these.
body: I purchased these a few years ago and I still use them all the time.

author: macdiehl
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat value
body: These are awesome. I use them at the gym and doing yard work, excellent sound quality. The charger port cover closes securely every single time, they pair quickly -  little things like that matter. This is a great product!

author: Joe Mama
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsStopped working in less than 3 months
body: These will no longer connect to my phone. I knew I didn't have them long, but 3 months? Seems like they should last longer than that.

author: brian hernandez
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsGreat earphones for the price
body: You get what you pay for with these. Cheap price for a decent product, second pair in about two years. Fit great sound good, use them for work. Update This recent pair lasted a whole 4 months before the sound in the left earbud went out and the battery life is garbage.

author: Joseph Moniz
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsInexpensive and "waterproof" -- You get what you pay for and not remotely water proof
body: I figured at the price point there was nothing to lose. I didn't expect anything other than for them to work and not die when I went to the gym and got sweaty. These let me down despite having realistic standards for such a low-priced product.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBroken within a few months

author: Dustye
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAvid Biker
body: I bought these three years ago to use when I ride my Harley. They are amazing, I can answer calls if need be without distraction, and the sound quality never changes. I mow the lawn with them, I fly weekly for work and it drowns out all the "noise". I have since had to buy a new pair, but I am completely satisfied with this product, zero complaints. Highly recommended.

author: Placeholder
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsRepeat Buyer
body: I have had a few. I am tough on them, lose them and give them away. The newer ones are USB-C. Best of all, when they fall out of my ear which is not frequent, the strap that connects them keeps me from losing them. The microphone is susceptible to background noise and I  might downgrade them a star if ever find a pair that are not.

author: RedBeard
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsProduct Has Gone Down Hill
body: So, I've bought three headsets over the course of a couple of years. All the same product. The first one I bought, worked GREAT! I used it for my phone, and everyone said it was clear and didn't sound garbled when I talked to them, and I could hear pretty good, with good bass. So, I bought a second pair for my computer, so I could video chat and play video games with friends. This second pair wasn't bad, but wasn't nearly as good as the first pair I bought. Unfortunately, my cat got to the first pair and destroyed the cord, so I decided to just buy a third pair. I bought this pair on July 29th, and as of October 9th, they have basically stopped working, and the sound is garbled and distorted. I would love to give them a better review, because they used to be great, but the last couple of years, the product has really gone down hill. Find something else.

author: Miguel de Faria e Castro
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsnot waterproof
body: Going on long runs, the headphones shut off when I start getting sweaty. The only way to turn them back on is by letting them dry for a long time after the run. Just had to run a half marathon in complete silence thanks to this...

author: Peter S.
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsPowers off after about 2 minutes
body: When fully charged these power themselves off after about 2 minutes, just as I’m settling in for a run or walk or something.  Pretty frustrating But hey at this price point I guess they are disposable

author: Manny
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWorst headphones ever
body: Within a month they stop working. Was never able to use them for phone calls

author: gregory hughes
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNice design but fragile and don't last long
body: I've gone through several pairs of these because they fit well. But honestly they just don't last, and at this point I'm just going to have to find something else. I bought this last pair on May 31. Today is September 26. So these didn't even last four months

author: Cynthia
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsAlmost perfect, expect for the fit.
body: Fit is the only negative. They are really loose on my head and slide around a lot. There is no way to make them tighter. The noise cancellation is awesome though. Music sounds amazing and the app that’s available lets me play with the sounds. They paired with my iPhone easily. The charge lasts for days for me.

author: Riley Post
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWould Buy Again
body: Great deal for the price. The audio quality is not “professional,” but I think it sounds nice. The battery life is solid — I only charge these every week or so. I would definitely purchase these again.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsUncomfortable
body: Was uncomfortable on the head

author: Debborah Richmond
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsLoose, not durable
body: Comparing to the old Bluetooth set in replacing, these are poor quality and way too loose.  I do not have a small head, but these are loose - don't plan on activity or nodding your head along with the music. I didn't even bother connecting to it, sorry, I can't speak to ease of use or sound quality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWARNING - Advertencia - Avertissement
body: WARNING. These headphones are only the outer shell of Soundcore Q20i headphones. The inner components are those of a lesser model with only the Normal and Noise Canceling settings. True Q20i headphones have a third setting called Transparency mode and these have no Transparency mode. My family and I have purchased from this seller to our regret. Either the Amazon seller or the San Diego Amazon Warehouse is swapping the inner parts of the headphones for profit which is super illegal. Either that or the seller is knowingly selling misrepresented merchandise which is also illegal.

author: Dagothur
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsI would give it an overall 3.5 out of 5.
body: I bought these for a long flight so haven't really used them much. My main reason for this choice was price and noise canceling. The noise canceling is pretty meh and the different modes dont really change much. Sound was fine not really looking for high fi audio from this type of product. Build quality seems ok but only time will tell. Bluetooth tech worked as it should, I would give it an overall 3.5 out of 5.

author: juliem
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat for noisy environments
body: I bought these for a recent trip with several flights. I had used Sennier over ear headphones and Bose in ear ANC headphones in the past but hadn’t flown in five years. It was time for an upgrade. This hit a sweet spot. The first flight had Bluetooth for the entertainment and the headphones connected without a problem. Being able to hear some of my surroundings was more comfortable for me that the sensory deprivation tank effect that some noise cancellation feels like to me. I am also glad I switched back to over the ear headphones. They are more comfortable on long flights. The charge duration was perfect. The only downside is it’s not clear how much of a charge is left. Anyway, I am glad I bought these. Even happier that they were far less expensive than my last headphones!

Fit decent, the app allows to customize the sound (had my son dial in the sound). I went with the blue color so not to get mixed up with the black ones in our house.  Holds a charge very good. by em

body: Love the isolation of sound. Helps me relax & very in special, when I use the “white noise “ sounds before going to sleep. They are comfortable on the ears. Look nice, modern and elegant. But most of all, the sound fidelity

author: ItFitzwell
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest ANC functionality out of all brands I've ever owned
body: This is the best for automatic noise cancellation (ANC) I've ever experienced.  I used Bose ANC over-ear headphones for over a decade, and 2 other brands in the last year.  All were much more expensive than the Anker Q20i, but even though the Q20i cost much less, I wouldn't have liked them so much were it not for the fantastic ANC functionality. I liked the Q20i so much I bought a 2nd pair, so when I forget one pair at work or in the car, I can grab the 2nd pair.  By the way, the quality of the ANC was so striking that I couldn't resist doing a simple experiment and compairing with a pair of my Bose ANC headphones that cost 6x more.  I realize this isn't like a real anechoic-chamber frequency range test ... but I got a metal pan and large metal spoon ... turned the ANC on / off and banged on the pan several times, with both the Q20i vs my Bose headphones.  The elimination of external noise really is dramatic with the Q20i.  That is the most important to me because I get distracted easily with extraneous noises.  Moreover, although over-ear headphones aren't the most comfortable with the head on a pillow at night ... my partner occassionally snores and I found my Q20i's completely eliminate me having to nudge her to get her to roll over. I did see in other reviews some folks are upset over ANC not working in AUX mode with wired connections ... I don't use wired connections so for my bluetooth needs, I'm extremely happy. Finally, one tiny irritant (but too small to drop below 5 stars):  I bought my first pair in July while Prime-Week savings claimed the Q20i's were "30% Off" for the Prime sale.  When I bought the 2nd pair a few days later, Prime Week was over, but the 2nd pair was only $1.50 more than the 1st pair.  So perhaps the size of the Prime discount was a bit exaggerated.  Nonethtless, best ANC headphones I've ever owned.

title: 4.0 out of 5 starsMy only complaint is the fit
body: I got these for the noise cancelling while flying. But I've used them to block out the sound of trucks while walking the dog and to block the sound of the TV when I'm reading in the same room. This is without anything playing on the headphones. With the audio on and full noise cancelling I am blissfully unaware of my surroundings. I had noise cancelling earbuds but they really didn't work well so I was skeptical that these budget headphones would be much different. But these work great for me. I had to take off a star because I don't find them comfortable for longer than about an hour. They hurt my ears and the top of my head. But I have fibromyalgia so anything pressing on my skin can be uncomfortable. They are also a little too big even on the smallest setting.

The noise cancellation works surprisingly well fir what I paid. Its almost like I was in my own little world. Bluetooth connects seemingly. The fit very well with plenty of adjustment. author: Jennifer Lake

These really work well for that purpose. I dont have to turn the volume way up to drown out the outside noise.  The ear cups are soft and comfortable to wear for extended periods of time. The sound quality is really good and comparable to more expensive brands. They charge fast and more importantly hold a charge for a long time. I charge mine about once a week because I use them alot. author: Megan
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing NC headphones!
body: I bought two sets of NC headphones and the more expensive $80 ones offered none even in NC mode. These are eons better! I also love the color! Even though it says white, it is more like an oatmeal white, very pretty. Next time these go on sale, I plan on buying a back up pair. Pros: Super comfortable from the fit of the ear pieces to the headband. I prefer on ear headphones so over ear, like these, usually aren't comfortable for me, so I was pleasantly surprised. The NC mode works extremely well! As soon as they are on I think it blocks out like 90% of sound before I even play any sound. I have noisy upstairs neighbors who stay between 60-90 decibels loud. So think of a busy, loud restaurant kitchen, that's the base for them above my head. Can't speak to their peak loudness (90 db), but their normal low end (60 db), I didn't hear them thankfully. The volume/loudness is impressive. I have used Jlab neons (they are on ear vs over ear like these) for 5+ years and always had to have my laptop volume up in the high 70 range, usually 77. With these, I majorly had to turn it down to about 44. The sound is really great. I played around with the different modes on the app to get the sound I am used too. So I am thankful for that. I do like the three modes you can easily switch between NC, Normal, and Awareness. I had my mother who has hearing aids try these on and the Awareness mode majorly boosted my voice for her which my vocal range is in the range she has a hard time hearing. I really like that this uses a type C charger. Everything I use requires that so I can just use my phone charger (10ft) if I need to vs searching for a micro usb (I believe) that my old ones used. And these also come with a cord to turn these into a wired version as well. I don't know if you can do that and be able to listen while they charge or not. But if so, even better! My biggest pro is that I can pair these to my laptop (main use) and phone at the same time! This allowed me to keep watching my show while I played with the app on my phone to customize the sound. I just want to mention the color again. A beautiful oatmeal white which makes it more unique. I tend to go for purples and pinks so I went with white just because it was the cheaper option and I am so glad I did! Cons: It automatically reverts to NC mode when you power them on. Not a big deal, but I wish it stayed how I left them when powered off. Button positions. I'm used to buttons on the left earpiece so I am having to relearn/get used to having them on the right. The NC button (which cycles the three modes) is on the opposite side of the same earpiece and is hard to find blindly. I like that it is out of the way so I don't accidentally hit it when powering on/off or volume controls. But I wish it were placed a bit higher so where your finger naturally goes to search for it, it'd find it. My biggest issue, but not enough to knock a star off, are the cues. I'm used to a voice telling me which mode I'm in, power on/off, etc. These ones use a chime that sounds the same for everything, so I have no clue what each chime is telling me until I cycle through enough times or use the app.

author: Zachariah Toutloff
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest headphones for my wife
body: These headphones are extremely durable and comfortable! They are adjustable. They work very well. The noise cancelling is fantastic! My wife wears them while mowing and can’t hear the mower over the music and the noise cancellation.

author: William A. Gray
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood product for the price - let's see what the longevity is.
body: It is a good product for what I paid for it. Headphone comfort : fits well on the ears but not over pressured The headset itself is sized too large for smaller heads like mine, I have seen this in other reviews for this product. it fits ok as long as you don't shake your head at all. Sound Quality : Let's face it, if I was after that I would have splurged for the Sony's or Sanhizre"s. The sound quality is good for the price, use the customised eq in the app for the best results. Noise Cancellation : ok tier, not great but it works if you have something on. Fit and Finish : Plastic parts on the ear cups, plastic head rest but metal supports when pulled apart. Its ok. Connectivity : Connects to two devices at a time and switches between them seamlessly, however, if the headphones are turned off, they might have to be re-paired, not a deal breaker but annoying. Overall : A good product for what you pay. Now let's see how long they last.

author: R. Chambers
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Sound.  Long Lasting Charge.
body: These head phones are fantastic. Great sound.  Hours of music/voice content. Reasonably easy to figure out how to use them.  I have to say, I wish most devices gave better instructions.  Pictures don’t do it for some of us.  Still I’m very happy with these.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFound no problems!

There’s semi-noise cancellations which works well for me and theres also a translucent mode or whatever it’s called so you can hear even yourself speak. When i use it to speak with others they say that I sound clear and they can’t hear anything else around me, but also quiet. The sound is great in them though. There’s no lag when watching a video that sets the audio back a second. The headphones are a great size and weight. Quite comfortable for long hours of wearing headphones. If you’re on a budget these are a great option for you.

body: I’ve had several other headphones over the years including wired and wireless. This one is among the best I’ve used. Wonderful tonality, crisp and clear notes. And the ability to adjust the sound output is a major plus.

author: Hoaxster
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsHearing Aid function is NOT READY FOR PRIMETIME!
body: Great for Bluetooth streaming! Worthless as hearing aids! Below is only about usage as hearing aids. 1) Disconnects every time a phone call comes inbound. You have to completely connect the AirPods once call is completed or rejected. 2) Volume goes down to ~20% everytime a noise is made close to iPhone. 3) Some times the ‘Connect Hearing’ is disabled.  It will be available later with no alert and you have to look at widget and manually adjust volume from zero to use as a hearing aid.

author: Teach Me Something Good
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest headphones I’ve ever owned! Worth every penny!
body: Best headphones I’ve ever owned! The noise cancellation is incredible—it blocks out everything from chatter to background hum without that weird pressure feeling. The adaptive feature that pauses ANC when I start talking is a total game-changer, especially during quick conversations or work calls. On top of that, the sound quality is amazing—clear, rich, and immersive. I love that I can tweak the EQ to match what I’m listening to. Worth every penny!

author: Gail
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove the hearing aid feature
body: Fits in the ear great.  Love that it is compatible with the "find my" app.  Easy to use.  Great sound quality.  Good battery life. And the hearing aid function works wonderfully for those that need to mute out extraneous sounds.  If the words get lost in the back ground noise....try these.  They made a world of difference.  This was the reason I bought these specific ones and they did not disappoint.

author: BoJack
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsReal World Battery Test - Passed
body: Forget lab tests. My AirPods Pro 2 are currently surviving the ultimate battery test — a 2+ week, cross-country adventure courtesy of the USPS. I had left them at an event about a 100 miles away and my coworker mailed them to me. That's when everything went crazy and USPS lost their marbles, and my AirPods. The post office at times had no idea where they were, but I did through the "Find My" app. From South Carolina to Illinois, California, Texas,  Alabama, Georgia, and back again to Alabama, and everywhere in between, these little guys have been bouncing coast-to-coast in a mail truck (or plane, or who-knows-what) and still have battery life left to complain about being lost. They’ve powered through warehouses, sorting centers, and enough zip codes to qualify for frequent flyer status. 22 states and counting. I haven’t seen them in person in over 2 weeks… but they’re still pinging their location. If you’re wondering about real-world battery life and tracking reliability: ... Find My still works ... The case is holding its charge (so far) ... The AirPods themselves? They work great. Just hope I get these back so I don't have to buy another set. Verdict: 5/5 stars — durable, dependable, and apparently well-traveled. Now let’s just hope they decide to settle down and come home.  I recommend!

author: W.
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsJunk
body: Junk! I have had three pairs of AirPods in the past, all worked well. They all paired easily with my iPhone and iPad, sounded good and the battery lasted for a long time. I went with these because my old pair of AirPods (Pro2) had a battery that would drain pretty quickly. This was from heavy use and no fault of the design. Also this newer versions has a USB-C charging port, so fewer cords. This pair will not hold a charge. If I leave them for a day or two on their own the battery is dead. They also need to constantly be paired to my phone over and over again. Something I should only have to do once. They sound fine, but if you don’t want noise cancellation you have to go into an almost hidden menu to turn it off. They’re junk.

author: Jeremy
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSmooth experience with great ANC and sound quality
body: The AirPods Pro 2nd Gen have been a fantastic upgrade. The active noise cancellation is excellent, blocking out most of the street noise and background distractions during work or travel. Transparency mode is equally impressive, allowing me to hear my surroundings clearly when needed. The sound quality is balanced, with clear mids and sharp highs that make podcasts, calls, and music all sound great. I use them daily and haven’t experienced any discomfort even during longer listening sessions. The pairing process with my iPhone was instant, and switching between devices is seamless. I also like that the case now has precision finding and a built-in speaker, which helps when I misplace it. While battery life could be a little longer, they recharge quickly and last long enough for my needs. Overall, they’re a reliable and well-integrated part of my everyday routine.
