author: Leticia Harbin
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for Winter — Music, Calls & Hearing Help All in One
body: Picked these up heading into winter and wow — they’ve replaced both my old earbuds and my hearing assist device. After doing the built-in hearing test (easy once you find it), they now automatically adjust sounds so I can hear conversations clearly, even in noisy places. Noise cancellation is excellent for blocking out snow blowers or loud rooms, and transparency mode works great when I need to hear without taking them out. They're super comfortable and discreet — no one even realizes I’m using them for hearing help. Sound quality is top-tier, connection is seamless, and the USB-C charging case is a nice bonus. If you want one device that does it all this winter, these are 100% worth it.

author: CFortC
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsHard to fit, workaday audio quality, ANC MIA
body: I've used three generations of the Bose in-ear monitors over the last 20 years. Their audio quality is flawless and certainly at the audiophile level. However, with the removal of headphone jacks from my last two iPhones, I decided it was finally time to try out wireless earbuds. I did check out what was available in the market and determined that Apple AirPod was the way to go for known quality and integration with the iPhone. Since I also wanted active noise cancellation, the AirPod Pro 2 was the logical and acceptably priced choice. Why the stars rating downgrade? I have not been able to achieve a fit that passes the Apple fit test running on the iPhone. I tried all four sizes of the inserts and struggled with placement in my ears. No joy. I might look into third-party silicone inserts. The second issue might be related to the lack of good fit, but in any case I would judge the audio quality of these Apple AirPods as merely workaday. There is a rough and boomy aspect to the sound. Keep in mind that my decades of listening to the Bose IEM's have spoiled me for their flawless audio quality. I almost forget the third issue: I can hear no active noise cancellation. The background sound is the same regardless of the ANC setting (off, aware, transparent, on). This issue may be related to the poor ear seal. UPDATE for third-party eartips: "Secure-Fit Premium Eartips for AirPods Pro" - These are very similar to the Apple originals but feature an additional "flange". Substituting these eartips, I find the AirPod Pro sounds smoother and leans more toward an audiophile impression. The iPhone's fit test refuses to run because it fails to detect that the AirPods are inserted in my ears. There is no noticeable improvement in the noise cancellation.

The charging case is compact and charges the earbuds really fast. Overall, this is a high-quality product and definitely worth the price. Totally recommended!

author: Dani C
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsVolume doesn't work with Samsung phone
body: First let me start by saying, I have a Samsung phone but I use airpods. I brought these as a replacement/ upgrade to an earlier version that battery life is failing. The first day I used them only to listen to music on Spotify. They worked well and did what they needed to do. I listened to music for about 2-1/2 hours and they started to beep. I don't know if that meant the battery was getting low. I thought they had a6 hour battery life... I would say i like the sound better on my soundcore liberty pro earphones better plus it tells you the percentage of battery left which i can't see on the airpods since i am not using an iphone The 2nd time I used them was outside. I was in a mall area, I usually only use one pod at the time when I am in public. I called my mother and I could barely hear her. My volume on my phone was turned to the max and her voice was muffled. I put the 2nd pod in my ear and it did block out the noise around me but her voice was still really low. I looked online to see if there was anything I could do to fix the volume. I get that I am using a Samsung versus Apple but my old airpods don't act like this. I decided to return them. I will try the newer regular airpods to see if I have the same issue.

title: 4.0 out of 5 starsnot hearing aids
body: nice air pods, a little better than my old set. however, hearing aid test would not be completed. tried multiple times. always, toward the end of the right ear test (left is first), test is stopped for background noise. i tried test in closed room, even with ear protection. bottom line, if you are looking for a little hearing aid with air buds, try something else

author: John
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFantastic for travel, music, and live shows
body: shows I’ve been using the AirPods Pro for a while now, and they’ve quickly become a must-have in my daily routine. They’re excellent for all the usual things like music, podcasts, calls (and the noise cancellation is especially clutch on airplanes). I’ve traveled with them a lot, and they make a noticeable difference in reducing plane engine noise … and nearby conversations. What’s maybe a little less common, but really impressive, is using them at live music concerts. I like to protect my ears without sacrificing the sound, and these do a great job. The transparency mode still lets the music breathe, but I can dial the volume back just enough to stay comfortable. They don’t muffle or distort what I’m hearing like regular earplugs do. All in all, they’re versatile, sound great, and are surprisingly useful in ways I didn’t expect. Highly recommend.

author: Cindy
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest overall performance and comfortable
body: This stays in my ears (as opposed to others) and is easily set up w iPhone or iPad. They even help with small hearing loss if you set them up with your iPhone. They will not take the place of expensive hearing aids though. The mic quality is superb with great musical clarity. The battery life is pretty good considering I wear them 16 hours at a time. They’re small and easy to put in your pocket.

author: Shivani
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest wireless earbuds for Apple users
body: The AirPods Pro 2 offer amazing noise cancellation, great sound, and a super comfortable fit. The transparency mode and swipe volume control are a big upgrade. Battery life is solid, and they pair instantly with Apple devices. Worth it if you’re in the Apple ecosystem!

author: Huggins
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe best
body: I first spent 300+ dollars on some ear buds other than these and they were absolutely terrible. Got these after I returned the premium ear buds and I’m so freaking satisfied! They work with the iPhone so well I don’t understand why anyone would buy something else. The clarity is outstanding and the noise cancellation is out of this world. I don’t understand how the heck they’re able to block out sound so well! I mow on a riding mower that’s fairly loud, but with these in I can’t hear anything but my music! Music doesn’t have to be loud when all the other sounds are muted !! Fantastic product. But it now!!

author: Rodolfo Camargo de Oliveira
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest earphones i have ever had.
body: The best earphones I’ve ever had. The noise cancellation is excellent — it blocks out almost everything. For very loud sounds like construction, I can still hear a bit, but aside from that, the noise canceling works really well. Totally worth the $190 I paid. The battery life is also great: it lasts me at least 3 days with normal use. If you use them non-stop, I think they would last around a day.

author: Marley Mentzer
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAirPod Pro 2 is the best
body: The AirPods Pro 2 are pretty sweet! The noise cancellation is a major step up – it's like the world just melts away when I put them in. The sound quality is noticeably better too, with richer bass and clearer highs. I also love that they added touch control for adjusting the volume, super handy. The battery life is solid, and the new case with the built-in speaker is a nice touch, especially for Find My. They were a big purchase but sooo worth it especially for school. I used them on my plane ride and they were the best!

author: Mateo
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNoise cancelling is superb.
body: As an owner of AirPods 3 and Sony WH-1000XM headphones (chosen for their superb noise cancellation), I can confidently say my AirPods Pro 2 have made my Sony's obsolete! I'm absolutely blown away by the amazing sound these deliver when connected to my iPhone or Apple TV. And I simply can't overstate how great the noise cancellation is on this new model.

author: Barry Toms
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove it!
body: I typically don’t like ear buds because my ears are pretty small so it causes pressure and pain after a prolonged period of wearing it. I have had other ear buds where I can’t stand to wear it for more than 30 minutes. I am blown away by how comfortable these are. I am able to wear this for hours at a time with no problem at all. If you have multiple Apple devices, the connection is seamless. If I am using my phone and I transition to my laptop or iPad, it’ll automatically connect on the new devices I am using. The sound quality and clarity is amazing. It does a very good job filtering out background noise when you’re in calls. If you have Apple devices, this is must buy!

author: D. Martin
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsClose To Perfection!
body: The AirPods Pro 2.0 earbuds are very close to perfection. I have four pairs. Two with the lightning connectors, and two with the now standard USB-C connectors. My USB-C pairs have the Mag-Lock charging as well. The sound is awesome! There are earbuds with more bass and higher volumes. But I believe for recreating quality live sound the Airpods produce clear sound that rivals listening to live music. They put out a reasonable amount of bass. I don’t honestly think that folks will be satisfied if you want ear shattering bass. The vocals are crisp. The battery life is pretty darn good too! Even the first pair that I purchased in 2023 still runs for at least 4.5 hours playing music. If the Airpods are totally dead, they’re recharged in about an hour. With the different sized silicone eartips, they will comfortably fit in most ears. Plus when they wear out, you can purchase replacements on Apple’s store, or right here on Amazon. I think one of the best features is the sound dampening ability. I usually have this feature on. I believe that even with no music playing the Airpods cut noise down by at least 50%-70%. You can have the microphones set to when you start talking, they let sounds through. I think the microphones are of wonderful quality. The clarity is really good. It is very rare that someone says they’re having a hard time hearing me. About the only negative is they are susceptible to interference from other devices every once in awhile. This is more prevalent in the summer than in the cooler months. They are discounted now to $169.00! This is much better than paying $249 or even $199. These are the best cordless earbuds I have ever purchased. I would definitely recommend these Airpods Pro 2.0 for the value they are. As I can’t afford $300+ for Seinheiser or Bose products.

author: becca
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsgood product
body: love love love this product!! I used to only use my BOSE headphones, except they kept falling off during workouts. I wanted something a little less bulkier and decided on the airpods (2nd gen). I didn't love those airpods, but when I bought these. I ended up using my airpods more than my headphones. The battery life is good for earbuds. Noise cancellation and sound quality are good, however my bose headphones were far superior in that aspect. if you wanr something portable, and don't want to spend 400+ on headphones, this is a great option.

author: M
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsMid quality, decent value.
body: They aren't anything special quality-wise, but I do like the functions these earbuds have. The main reason that I bought this pair is because they're over-the-ear to avoid constant readjusting and have physical buttons to avoid accidentally activating the touch control when I do adjust them, but the arm over the earlobe doesn't even fit my ears, they just hover over the top of my ear with a lot of clearance. They're still loose on my husband, but the arm's loop is so narrow and the curve so steep that I imagine someone with larger ears might feel uncomfortable pressure on the back of the antihelix after a while. They just seem designed for a very particular ear shape. The replacement tips are a good range of sizes, at least, and I'm very fond of the dedicated volume buttons on each earbud. The sound quality is just... okay. I wouldn't describe it as low-quality, but it's definitely not impressive or particularly crisp. The connection seems stable and I haven't had any random cutout when walking to the next room or putting my phone in my pocket, but if the earbud fairies don't claim this pair, I'll try to update this on how they age. Initial pairing and general use was no trouble, and I'm glad they have the long press for shutoff in case I do run into any. I would recommend these if they're on sale and you are also particular about over-the-ear Bluetooth buds with physical buttons, unless the G17/19s return or someone else with promising reviews steps in to fill the niche. If you're not picky about the combination of shape and controls, I'd probably look for a different brand.

author: "melatto"
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsDon't you dare spend full price for these mediocre sound buds
body: These things sound barely okay, and there are some other problems, including serious design flaws / physical connection issues --They distinctly sound underwater, no matter which eartips are used (I need to buy custom eartips) --They are a pain in the _____ to take out of the charger (serious design flaw....how did this problem escape the testers?) --When using custom eartips, the case barely closes (one earbud can't charge fully, unless the case is literally held closed / eartips removed...who the hell wants to take off their ear tips every time they put their earbuds away?) These cost $80?  This a serious lack of value for my money.  I got them for half off, and I still spend too much. I was never a big JBL fan, I always thought they produced mediocre output all around.  This company has probably lost me as a customer moving forward, desperation and time-crunch notwithstanding.

author: igwend
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsStopped working 6 months in, customer service is trash.

I have tried cleaning the product multiple times, factory resetting it, and disconnecting and reconnecting to my device's bluetooth to no avail. Customer service has not been helpful. I've had headphones that were half the price last longer. Don't waste your money.

author: Handygirl
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPretty sturdy
body: Came for the price, stayed for the performance. I've been using plug in, line type ear plugs when doing yard work for years. I live in the south and have 2.5 acres of hilly land that requires weekly maintenance in the summer. The non-wifi plugs aren't affected by sweat but the sound is awful and I was constantly ripping the chord out of my ear. Ouch! For the price I  figured that if I drowned these at least I'd have tried. Been using them for months. The sound is better than the old fashioned line plugs. The length of time they hold a charge is unreal. I have yet to sweat through them so maybe it can't be done. They're so soft, well fit and comfortable that I can wear them all day. Is the sound equivalent to buds that cost 10 times more? No. But it's certainly better than the cost of these buds. There's a tool for every job and this one works well for me.

author: Luis Jaime
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBetter than my old Airpods
body: The sound quality on this is amazing! I have never bough Airpods but both times I owned a pair it was a gift. With a small adjustment to the EQ, songs I've had on my phone for years sound refreshed and new. I feel like I'm hearing things that my Airpods could never pick up. Also, one of my airpods always fell out of my ear. It could be too early to tell, but so far I don't have this issue with the JBLs. Great product at a fantastic price point. My only issue is that my package was missing the charging cable. Lucky for me I have tons but that is what's keeping me from giving it a full 5 stars. Other than that, this thing sounds and feels amazing.

author: startagl
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsDon't hold a charge. Sound good.
body: I've had a cheap knock off Bluetooth over ear bud for 3 years. They still work perfectly. Unfortunately the over the ear part just broke. So I needed a new pair. I saw these JBL for a good price and picked them up. They paired easily and repair as soon as they are removed from the case. They sound good. Navigation is a little tricky but works. I gave them 3 stars because they do not hold a charge for very long. At least compared to the knock off brand. I used to charge the knock off and use them on and off for months. The JBL needed a recharge after only 30 days of extreme casual usage. If I didn't get a good deal I would return them.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsWhat did you do JBL?

The only positive I can give these are the battery life and quick charge. Other than that the sound quality on these are horrible with absolutely no bass. They do not fit in the ear no matter how you angle them or which tip replacement you use. They are difficult to remove from the charging base due to the shape and orientation so if you have larger than Toddler fingers good luck. All in all the battery and charging is the only reason these have two stars. I wish I could return but unfortunately they are past the date.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsThese are TRASH
body: If I could rate at 0 stars I would. Charge doesn't hold for longer than 1 hour. The sound quality is atrocious, like listening to music from a phone shoved in a cup to make it louder. the ambient noise controls are garbage, you hear all the light breeze around you and nothing else. No point in taking calls with these, the other end only hears whatever noise is in your background. The 3 size of ear tips only fit people with giant ears, had to use tips from another set i have so they stay in my ear. The app doesn't recognize the ear buds frequently, when if it does it won't allow you to change settings because it says you're in a call when you're not. Don't waste your money, I'm upset I'm outside of the return window.

author: D. Hesselbarth
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSolid, comfortable, clear microphone. No one notices I'm using a bluetooth headset.
body: I have happily used this headset almost daily for four years, paired to an Iphone. Phone calls whether driving or elsewhere: everyone says my voice is strong and clear, compared to many bluetooth headsets that annoyingly pick up and amplify other sounds. Only strong winds have been bothersome. I use the side button to easily activate siri. I listen to podcasts as I walk - again, clear. The volume buttons, though tiny, easily adjust volume. I have worn this all day without discomfort and without the battery running down. Music in one ear? Nothing to shout about. It sounds ok, but I wouldn't buy this primarily to listen to music. The plastic case protects it well. I wouldn't have a headset without a solid case to protect it. The only reason I bought a new one is that the curved rubber earpiece finally cracked apart. That's the end! (though the electronics and battery are still going strong.)

author: wife life
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat device for the price!
body: This headset is fantastic! I would give it 10 stars if I could! I bought this little thing in 2023 and it’s still going strong! The battery life lasts through a 10 hour work day, making multiple calls with my virtual phone system and taking Teams meetings. The call quality is clear for the most part. I have had a few negative remarks over the years about the call quality but nothing consistent. The battery has died in the middle of my workday maybe 3 times and it seems to be from being in Teams meetings all day. It does stay connected on my laptop through Bluetooth and I have yet to experience connectivity issues. I will say I only use this for work and it is only connected to one device, so I can’t speak to connectivity between multiple devices. It takes about 30 minutes to reach a “full” charge, however I plug it in at the end of my day and leave it until I’m ready to use again the next day or my next shift. So I’m not entirely sure if that contributes to the longevity of the battery throughout the day or not. There is volume control on the device but I seem to have better luck controlling the volume on my laptop. Overall, this device is worth the money and it has definitely lasted. It’s comfortable and lightweight to wear all day.

author: Shannon Henning
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsStopped working after 3 months!!
body: So I purchased this in March 2025 and they worked completely amazing until literally July 2, 2025 and I no longer could hear the customer on the other end. Crazy thing is, I could hear the phone ringing but still could not hear anybody on the other end. Hopefully if you decide to purchase this, it will work for you longer than they did for me literally, I’m out almost $40.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat for the affordable price!
body: The video showcases the product in use. The video guides you through product setup. The video compares multiple products. The video shows the product being unpacked. Video Player is loading. Click to play video Play Mute Current Time 0:00 / Duration 0:39 Loaded : 15.40% 0:00 Stream Type LIVE Seek to live, currently behind live LIVE Remaining Time - 0:39 1x Playback Rate Chapters Chapters Descriptions descriptions off , selected Captions captions off , selected English (Automated) Audio Track default , selected Fullscreen This is a modal window. 5 Stars – The Ultimate Bluetooth Headset for Professionals on the Go! I couldn’t be more impressed with the ICOMTOFIT Bluetooth Headset. From the moment I unboxed it, I could tell it was built with quality in mind. The sleek black finish looks modern and professional, making it the perfect accessory for business calls or long drives. The Bluetooth 5.0 connection is rock-solid, pairing instantly with my iPhone and staying connected without a hitch. I’ve used it with Android devices too, and it’s just as seamless. The sound quality is crystal clear, both on my end and for the person on the other side of the call. The built-in microphone picks up my voice perfectly—even when I’m in a noisy car or walking outside. One of my favorite features is how comfortable and lightweight it is. I can wear it for hours without any discomfort, and the adjustable ear hook ensures it stays in place no matter what I’m doing. The battery life is phenomenal, easily lasting me through a full day of use on a single charge. Whether I’m taking business calls, using it for hands-free driving, or hopping on quick virtual meetings, the ICOMTOFIT headset has become an essential part of my daily routine. For anyone looking for a reliable, high-performance Bluetooth earpiece that doesn’t compromise on style or function, this is it!

author: Brian
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWould definitely buy again!
body: This microphone is amazing!  The ambient noise reduction works well in moderately noisy areas and the interface is super simple. I got almost 2 full days out of the battery not listening to anything in the background.  I love the fact that it easily transfers from one ear to the other. I've never been a fan of ear buds mics, but this device seems to work well for my listeners as well as me.  I love the fact that it hooks over my ear comfortably and works on either ear with one device without having to change for each ear.

Battery seems to last all day and the sound from using my spotify is also amazing. Would defineatlry recommend especially for the price.

author: Sean
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat BT Heaset

author: Latasha
title: 5.0 out of 5 stars5 Stars – Clear Sound, Long Battery, and Super Comfortable!
body: I’ve been using the Icomtofit Bluetooth Headset for a few weeks now, and I’m really impressed. It paired effortlessly with both my iPhone and Android devices, and the connection has been rock solid with no dropouts. The sound quality is excellent—calls are clear on both ends, even when I’m driving or walking outside. The noise cancellation works better than I expected for a headset at this price point. People can hear me clearly without any background noise. Battery life is another win. I can go all day on a single charge, which is great for long workdays or road trips. It’s also super lightweight and fits comfortably in my ear without slipping or causing discomfort after hours of wear. I mainly use it for business calls and hands-free driving, and it performs like a much more expensive headset. If you’re looking for a reliable, budget-friendly Bluetooth earpiece that does what it promises, this one’s worth it.

author: Jess
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat headset better value.
body: This headset is really nice. The calls are crisp and clear. The battery has been good. I havent charged it and ive had it for a week already. That 180 hour standby time is a good enough reason to get it. Its comfortable enough to wear all day and thats great for my job. Volume up and downright on the headset. Can mute and hang up with it as well. Mute button can bring up siri but i dont have an iphone(im smart) so its left untested. It comes in a nice little box and it uses a c charger which is awesome cause my other one uses the outdated one. Great value as well.

author: Carlos Terry
title: 2.0 out of 5 stars6 Mos Review
body: There have been a few quality issues with this headset that has been exposed over-time. Initially this headset worked great but the Bluetooth distance has been reduced which causes you, the user to sound far-off or muffled if you step 6-8 ft away from PC. The mute button quit working. That battery storage has reduced which causes you to charge more often and sometimes not last a full 8 hour day. This could be managed by shutting the headset off and turning it back on before scheduled usage but for the pop-up calls the headset will not come online within 3-4 rings. You would have miss the call and have to return the call.

The battery life is great I walked through Universal Studios using the device the entire day and the battery stayed strong and didn't have an issues. I have a Samsung S24 and this is my new Bluetooth device. I highly recommend it and have ordered one for my 17 year old son that has the same phone as me because he tried it and was so impressed with it capabilities and performance.

author: Scott N.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat price feature packed, great sound, useful buttons, and good design.
body: I’m very impressed with this headset. I have worked in Human Resources and as a consultant for 9.5 years now using wireless headsets most of the day daily. I have gone through several high and low end headsets in this time. This one is very competitively priced for the quality delivered. The unit is fully ambidextrous and adjustable so you can swivel the ear hook, mic boom, AND the ear bud (which is marvelous) so you can fine tune it to the perfect comfort. The speaker is so loud it initially shocked me and I had to turn down the volume. Sound clarity was as expected for a device made to be a headset rather than headphones, but was clear and not scratchy or distorted at all like I have experienced with much more expensive units. Pairing was a breeze, and apparently it can even be paired to two different devices and switch between them seamlessly!!! Volume buttons are easy to find and intuitive, as is the power button. The mute button is on the bottom (when worn on the right ear) which keeps it perfectly out of the way. The mute button mutes the device solely, and does not activate the mute function on a pc, which is fine but something to be aware of. Microphone tests came back loud and clear and my colleagues reported they could hear me loudly and clearly. The device came in an attractive case which looks like black brushed metal, but is lightweight plastic. In the box was included comprehensive instructions and a short usb-c charging cord. Overall I cannot recommend this product enough. If you are in need of a good business headset, this one is priced far below much higher end models with comparable performance. Fit and finish if the device is noticeably cheaper than say a $200 plantronics headset, but this is expected for the price point, and the device feels sturdy and professional, with tactile and solid buttons and is very comfortable and lightweight. I wore it all day yesterday and forgot I had it on, panicking when I couldn’t find it for a meeting until a notification came through my computer and reminded me I had it on haha. If this is what you’re looking for, then you cant go wrong.

author: Stephen
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFinally!!
body: I've had my earpiece for about a week now and I love it! I have had a hard time finding one that will stay in my ear while working. Since I am active at work, these types of earpiece's fall out fairly easy until now. On top of that, the sound quality and comfort match or surpass any I've tried. including ones that are upwards of three times the price!! Only wish I would have found  this before buying and returning multiple similar items. I highly recommend this for anyone who wants a quality item without the overpricing of similar items.

The USB-C charging port is very convenient due to the fact that I only use USB-C devices. Battery life is great and I charge it about once every other day or so. They include a nice clamshell type of case for storage when you're not using it . Overall I am VERY satisfied with this headset. For the price, it can't be beat!

author: David Heywood Wilkinson
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsCracked - Plastic frame is cheap and brittle
body: I was so excited to get these, but the recent cracks in the frame are really disappointing. Sound-wise, these are great. Full, rich sound, and the noise cancelling works really well. They are lightweight and comfortable. I really like the notification features it offers on iPhones. And they look cool. The battery life is ok. They will last maybe a day, more or less, so I recharge often. They do recharge quickly, which is nice. I've been spoiled by my JBL Tune 660s - I use those for work and go days without charging. I don't think those even have a battery - they just run on good music and cosmic positivity. A few weeks ago I noticed a big crack and a missing bit of plastic above the right ear piece. Pulling the headphones open to place on my head exposes the insides. And no, I'm not prying these open like some creaky, old barn doors. You can see that the plastic is very thin. Yesterday I noticed that the left side is also cracked and chipping. At least Beats is consistent from the right to the left. I don't use them in any sort of extreme way that would put extra strain or abuse on the phones (my MMA fighting and bull riding days are a distant memory). This is the first pair of headphones I've owned that are literally falling apart from simple everyday use. I wish I could give these a 5 star, but this sort of failure after one year, for an item this expensive, is unacceptable. Shame.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat headphones!
body: I've seen a lot of reviews on YouTube and I don't get why most of the people are hating on this one. Since the day I got my Beats Studio Pro, I'm using it on a daily basis and I'm loving my beats so far. Sound quality is very good for everyday use, battery lasts for days, and the build quality feels great. One downside is that when I want to switch from my iPhone to my Mac, I have to do it manually, but really, it's not the end of the world. So far so good! I can definitely recommend this one.

However, I did not like the fit. I have never had over-the-ear headphones before, and the top pressed against my head and gave me a headache. It may be user error, but I returned them. They were great, and it was quick and easy to return!

author: Kevin H.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Modern Replacement!
body: I purchased these headphones to replace an older pair from 2019. I had a great experience with the first pair, so I decided to purchase an updated pair since they were on sale. They are nearly the same size as my previous pair and now features a USB-C port for charging. I am very picky when it comes to headphones as I have large ears and wear glasses. The ear cups cover my ears perfectly and do not press against my ears. They are very durable and seem to be up to par to my previous pair. I'm no audiophile, but I have enjoyed the audio quality these provide using bluetooth with my Apple devices. I read that these headphones have a built-in DAC and can be activated by connecting a USB-C cable to a computer. I did try using the USB-C cable with my Macbook to test lossless and Dolby Atmos with my Apple Music subscription. I can hear subtle differences in quality for some songs, but did not blow me away. I personally think audio quality comes down to encoding, file size, mastering, and the listener's preference. I find myself resorting back to using bluetooth so I am not tied down with a cable. I also tested the noise cancellation feature. I am honestly not a fan of noise cancellation unless I am traveling by plane and want to tune out crying children. It works as advertised- you can turn it on, off, or use a transparent mode to hear your environment. I do recommend these headphones if you are in the market for a good quality, over the ear headphones. I highly advise that you purchase these when they are on sale as I don't think they are worth their normal $300 price tag.

author: Ron Hutchinson
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat headphones
body: They sound great but when I try to use them to talk on the phone everyone says it sounds muffled or either they can’t hear me. I’ve contacted tech support and they tell me they can hear me just fine. Just about everyone else that I talk to throughout the day says just the opposite.

author: Brenda Alcala
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLightweight for ALL DAY use!!
body: I bought this during prime day (a steal!!). It is lightweight and comfortable, I can have them on ALL DAY! I also own the Apple AirPod Max headphones and in terms of noise cancellation, I will say the AirPods Max wins but they’re 2 or 3 times more expensive then these beats so not something everyone can afford. These are still a great alternative. They paired easily with my iPhone and I LOVE the fact that I can connect the beats to my phone EITHER via Bluetooth OR with a chord, so if the battery dies, not all is lost :)  all in all, they are worth it!

author: Gabriel Olmos Padilla
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfecto
body: Perfecto

author: Jenn
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsNot for everyone
body: These are beautiful and the packaging is beautiful, however they pull my hair constantly.  The part that folds catches your hair while wearing them.  Also I have a smallish head and they are so big and hurt my ears after short use.  Bummer because the look and the noise cancellation is great.

author: Eric armenta
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsSpend money elsewhere
body: I bought these a couple of years ago, now the anc creates a white noise kind of sound on the left ear. It seems many other people have this issue. I am still trying to figure out how to fix it. If I could do it over again, I would invest this money in a different headphone.

author: Richard
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsExcellent sound quality, but they are fragile
body: For sound quality, these are superb, and they are very comfortable to wear for extended periods. However, they are extremely fragile. I have my 4th replacement coming in about 6 months. The original pair charged one time, and then they would not charge at all. The second pair had a failed firmware upgrade, and they would not turn on or charge. The third pair developed an intermittent problem with the power button and when noise cancellation was active there was static in the right ear cup. Those problems might be related because the power button also toggles noise cancellation on and off. I highly recommend that if you purchase these, you also purchase the extended Apple Care. Problems aside, the sound quality is phenomenal.

author: Jeremy Paton

author: JV
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove these!
body: Bought these to use while editing videos on MacBook Pro. They connect seamlessly, and provide excellent sound quality. They are also very comfortable to wear on your ears. Noise cancellation works well too.

author: KMP
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsZero durability
body: The sound is good and the noise cancellation is pretty good too. The reason it gets two stars is because these things have not lasted for me. I've had to tape the spot where the headband connects to the ear muffs because the plastic just breaks apart. The microphone quality has gone downhill when talking on discord. Used to be great now everyone has to turn me way up with no settings changed. I have had these headphones for LESS than two years. The design also doesn't allow you to share sound. So if you are say watching Apple TV and you want someone else to be able to share the sound on their airpods or any other device it won't work. Heard it is very stereotypical for beats to break where they are breaking. Will not buy again. You've been warned.

author: Diana Krams
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsexcellent
body: excellent

author: LAWRENCE BROWN
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsSturdy, amazing sound, call quality is lacking.
body: The music quality is good the headphone itself is sturdy; however, my device is malfunctioning when making calls. The quality of the call is distorted, and at times I can't be heard. I am attempting to get this sorted out with Beats since I've only owned them for three months.

author: Richard Davis
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHeadphones
body: Fantastic product!

author: TMM
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsMaybe it’s just me but…..
body: These things suck period. Every single time I put them on my hair manages to get wrapped around the earpiece and me not paying attention rips out a crazy amount of hair!!! These are going back asap

author: Amy
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsDecent sound but poorly designed
body: I feel like this was released without ANY testing on human subjects. The headband is extremely tight, enough to trigger a migraine.  And my head is not big.  I was able to fix this by clamping them around the box they came in and blasting the plastic band with a hairdryer until it got hot, then I let them stay on the box until the plastic cooled again. Now they fit nicely. Unfortunately I don't know what to do about the second design failure.  Every time I take these off, I lose a CLUMP of hair.  The seam around the entire ear cushion where it meets the plastic is just wide enough to capture any loose hair and pull it out by the roots.  I will be snatched bald if I continue to wear these. I was also told over a Teams meeting that I sounded like I was underwater, so the mic is apparently sub-par as well. I bought this during Prime Day, so at least I didn't pay full price, but they were still expensive for having such glaring design flaws.  These should have never made it to the shelves.  Unless you are a child or a VERY small woman with a buzz cut, I do not recommend them.

author: Susty
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBeats Studio Pros almost worthless
body: Although the audio and rating on the Beats Studio Pros was good that was all. They don't fit well, are too wide, ear cups do not pivot, not enough pressure on the ear cups to form a seal to block out noise so you absolutely have to use the noise cancelation which is also practically worthless. If you're running a mower and want to listen to some music you'll have to turn the music up excessively loud just to hear it. Definitely NOT worth the money. They're fine for sitting in your living room and listening to music or the TV but no good in high noise level areas

author: Lana
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHeadphones great
body: They have good sound

author: Jmc1989
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsThe left speaker had static after less than one month.
body: The sound quality was great. The problem was after having it for 3 weeks and using it only 10x, not at max volume and the left speaker started cackling. I was super disappointed because my old beats lasted years and were the best headphones I've ever had.

author: FireFly
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove my headphones!
body: Love these!  I was indecisive on which headphones among different brands. I was going to purchase.  So glad I went with these.  Very satisfied with the sounds the comfort and everything about them.

author: christy schultheis
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsDisappointing sound quality
body: Whatever they did to this new version of Studio Pro’s needs undone. Max volume still isn’t loud enough and the bass is hardly noticeable.

author: Belphie

body: Very good. Comfortable, easy to travel with and amazing noise canceling. I enjoy wearing them while doing my hobbies cause they lock out all the daily noise of the world. Foam is very soft so I forget they're on me at times.

body: I find these to be very uncomfortable on my ears. Painful if I wear for longer than 1 hour. No quality of sound can make up for the fact that they're uncomfortable. I would not recommend it at all, and I regret the purchase.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNot good

author: Amazon Customer
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNo way Dr. Dre is using these.
body: They don't sound that great. The JBL Live 770NC are better with more bass. The Soundcore Q30 by Anker are even better although with the Ankers you can't use ANC when listening through the 3.5mm cable on the plane.

author: Rodo008
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsJust Amazing Sound
body: No se puede decir mas que ....Asombrosos!, Antes de comprarlos hice una revision y comparacion contra otros del mercado tales como JBL, Monster, Senheiser. Pros y Contras ACCENTUM Plus Pros: mayor autonomía, ANC muy eficaz, EQ de 5 bandas, recarga ultrarrápida, precio más bajo. Contras: sin modo USB-C digital (pierdes audio lossless + mic en ese modo), construcción plástica sin repuestos. Studio Pro Pros: USB-C digital (audio + mic + ANC + carga), bisagras metálicas y pads reemplazables, ANC/Transparencia top, mejor para conferencias. Contras: batería algo menor, precio ligeramente superior. ¿Cuál te conviene? Si valoras sobre todo la batería y una experiencia de sonido “puede todo” por debajo de $150, el ACCENTUM Plus es una compra excelente. Si tu prioridad es la robustez, la conectividad más versátil (audio digital + mic + ANC por USB-C) y un soporte a largo plazo (almohadillas/bisagras reemplazables), quédate con los Beats Studio Pro. De este modo, eliges según tu uso: más horas y EQ fina (Sennheiser) o máxima durabilidad y versatilidad (Beats). Recomendación de compra inmediata: Añade al carrito los Beats Studio Pro (oferta Prime Day o el vendedor oficial). Completa con el cable UGREEN Uno USB-C 100 W 6.6 ft. Con esa dupla tendrás: Micrófono y ANC siempre activos en digital. Audio de máxima fidelidad por USB-C o Bluetooth. Durabilidad probada para años de uso intensivo. ¡Listo para disfrutar sin preocupaciones y con la certeza de haber hecho la elección perfecta de una sola vez!

author: B D Nelson
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood headphones
body: Works as advertised. Noise canceling could be a little better but overall a great product. Syncs up to my apple devices super easy.

author: Phillip Garcia
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWatch OUT!!!
body: Worst headphones Beats ever made. Sound quality is HORRIBLE!!! Don’t buy. Also, Amazon returned item and issued a Gift card credit instead of crediting my debit card. Just saying

author: James E Hildebrant
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsUsed Item sold as NEW
body: The original Beats box was obviously previously opened. It was re-secured with masking tape. Upon opening it the wires were not banded and loose in the container.

author: Michael
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAlmost Perfect, Just One Little Quirk
body: These Beats are amazing! Super comfortable on my ears—I wore them for 6 hours a day, 3 days straight, and didn’t feel any pressure or fatigue. The sound quality is excellent (and I’m a bit of an audiophile), though I did notice something slightly off in the right ear. Can’t quite pinpoint it, even after adjusting my Apple Music settings—but it’s subtle. The microphone? Powerful. I was speaking softly (since I couldn’t hear myself well with the noise isolation), and it still picked up everything crystal clear. The battery life is also impressive—feels like it lasts forever. Overall, really happy with them—just wish I could figure out that tiny sound imbalance.

author: Olivia
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsDon’t get AirPod Max get this!
body: So far so good! Connection went smooth, power is long lasting, also really light and easy to carry around.

author: Pedro J. Castillo L.
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsError comun de audifonos, poca durabilidad
body: Son unos buenos audífonos pero para el precio no tienen buena resistencia, soy muy cuidadoso con ellos y nunca los he dejado caer ni se han maltratado y al parecer es un problema común que tienen estos audífonos ya que a dos personas que conozco les ha pasado lo mismo con estos audífonos  y es que se quiebran y se rompen en los lados. Y fue tan normal como sacarlos de su estuche, ponérmelos y que se cayera un pedazo de plástico desde las orejas. De calidad de sonido y funciones es bastante bueno, tiene buena cancelacion de sonido, calidad de sonido y buen volumen, pero durabilidad le falta y mas con su precio.

author: Kindle Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsStatic issue
body: They were working fine, the audio quality wasn't as good as I was expecting and the noise canceling was acceptable but they were fine. But after about a year there has been a static ringing in the right ear anytime I attempt to use noise canceling. Apparently a lot of others have this issue within the first one to two years as well

Now, when it comes to sound, these are not good. The bass is not the usual Beats sound; its actually weak. If your try to find a cheaper version of the Airpod max, like I was, these are not them. I wouldnt pay over 100 for these. Sad cause I recently bought the new Beats pill and its great.

If not in either of those modes they sound like normal $25 headphones. After researching the issue it seems it is a common defect in this model. Luckily Amazon is issuing me a refund. Hate to say it but I will be staying with Apple AirPods

author: Old Ranger
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect in every way.
body: It's hard to say which aspect of the Beats Studio Pro impressed me more, the sound quality or the comfort...however, since the sound is the primary reason behind the headphones I'll go with that.  Just spectacular sound from the start, whether corded or bluetooth connected.  And the bluetooth connectivity was a snap, to my iPhone, iPod, and MacBook.  That's about as far as my limited tech know-how needs to carry me.  As to the second point, the comfort?  Astounding.  Over-the-ear is the way to go and I barely noticed the headband over my dome.  Pleased beyond words.  Great product.

author: zina
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON BEATS/APPLE PRODUCTS!
body: Warranty practices at apple are awful and predatory. I spent $300 on headphones that broke within 2 years from regular wear and tear and i am expected to pay $250 for them to be looked at by a technician. This has to be a joke. I loved the staff I talked to she was amazing but Apple will never gain a single cent of my money ever again. If I knew beats was owned by apple from the start I'd never buy from the brand knowing apple's track record of cartoon villian levels of tomfoolery. Save your money and go spend it on a brand that actually has good products. Highly recommend samsung [for everyday wear] and Sony [for high end audio work]

author: Em Te Ess
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsProduces good sound and definition

I recently moved to an apartment & found that when I listened to music off of Alexa, the neighbor below was distracted while she was working at home.  Ergo a purchase of wireless headphones was the neighborly thing to do, & I settled on Sony.  As I implied already, the sound is great.  Occasionally my ears become sore, but I just readjust the earcups a trifle lower . . . I'm hoping that over time this becomes a non-issue as I use the headset more often.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsGreat, until they weren't.

They would not turn back on even though I know they had plenty of charge left. "Charged" it all night, still won't turn on next day. Reading reviews, I was apparently lucky to get a complete year out of them. Come on, Sony.

author: John N Vadala
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBuyer beware, from a two time loser.
body: In mid-December 2024, I purchased my first Sony WH-CH520 headphones. Unfortunately, they stopped working, and I would describe it as a catastrophic failure. To replace the non-functional headphones, I bought a second pair of CH-520s. I am writing this review in mid-July 2025 as a warning because today my second pair of Sony CH-520 headphones also stopped working—completely dead, just like the first pair. The first pair lasted only five months, but my second pair was even less reliable, working for just two months. I don’t believe this is just bad luck; I think it's indicative of a larger issue. For this reason, I will never buy another CH-520 again. While it might not be a fair assessment, I am now skeptical about the quality of Sony's electronic products.

I like the way the ears parts flip out when I put them around my neck. You won’t be disappointed if you’re looking for quality headphones at a very fair price.

author: Dave
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood Product
body: The sound quality is superb, and they are comfortable to wear. Sony makes a good product. The only thing that bothers me is that it is very difficult to feel/locate with the hand the three buttons on the right side of the headset. Each button performs a different function. The on/off button in the middle should be bigger or raised to distinguish it from the other two buttons that increase or decrease volume (which are the same buttons that either replays the song or advances to the next song.)

author: Amazon Customer
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat headphones
body: A bit more passive noise cancellation than I expected, which is good for most people!  Sound is incredible, lots of bass. The charging cable is incredibly short, so if you don’t already have a USB-C cable, you’ll probably want a longer one.  Microphone seems to work well when I tested it, planning to use these for conference calls so I’ll report back if it doesn’t work out.

The fit on the ear was also awkward, could have gotten over it had the sound been better. Was not worth $30 I had paid. Maybe I just got a dud pair but doubt.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAwesome earbuds!
body: I love these ear buds.  They work well, they stay put with the ear loops and they are a fraction of the cost of the over priced name brands.  In addition, the company stands behind their product.  After about 20 months of use one of the ear loops came apart so the company sent be a brand new set of ear buds no questions asked.  I was blown away when they actually arrived at the house.  I was prepared to pay for another set, but they went above and beyond to take care of me.  Highly recommend!!!

Sweat and rain haven’t been a problem either and the waterproof is legit. I love that I can use just one bud at a time if I want to keep an ear open. author: Richard Gilbert
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsNice Quality, Flawed Design
body: I listen to music at work 7 hours a day, and was looking to replace my cheaper earbuds of the same style. I will say that the build quality of these are surprisingly good. The case is heavy and built solid and the headphones feel very nice. The major downside for me is getting the full audio quality out of them perhaps it is just the shape of my ears but though they are loud I was barely getting any bass from them. I then pushed them up and tight agaiant my ear and suddenly heard the fill range. But they are not going to sit that snug with normal use so I think it is simply a design flaw around the location of the base output. My previous, cheaper earbuds fit into your upper ear as well and were more effective at delivering the full bass. So despite these feeling very nice for the price, I will most likely be returning them.

body: I want to start on a positive note which is it had a great price and connection to my device was very easy. Unfortunately, the sound quality was extremely poor. It was low and tinny. No base at all. Listening to music was like listening through a tin cup. I returned after trying to mess w it for 30 minutes.

author: Brian Watkins
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSurprisingly durable
body: I bought these to use one at a time while biking. I love that it switches to mono automatically when I only have one out of the case. Within a week of getting them I spaced out and left them sitting on the phone mount on my bike, and by the time I was a block away I looked down and saw only one of them there. I went back to look for it, and I could tell when I got close because the other earbud would say the word "connected" when I got within range of it. When I found it, it had been run over by a car. However, it only received minor scratches and still works as if it never happened. I was hoping the bass would be a little more present in the sound, but it's comparable to other headphones in the price range for sure.

author: NM
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsAffordable, good battery, but cant wear for too long
body: Ive had these for 7 months now and one full charge lasts almost my entire work shift. The part that wraps around the ear itself is flexible and super comfortable, theyve never slipped out! But my one issue is that the thick bulbous plastic part right under the earbud part will hurt the inner part of my ear if worn for several hours. It happens often that i'll have to switch sides because one side starts to pulse and i can physically feel the inside being slightly inflamed for a few days. This also has nothing to do with the volume either. Not sure if I'm wearing them at a wrong angle, but it feels like I've tried several angles and the issue persists. Other than that, these would be perfect. Its also not an earbud cover size issue either. That said I would recomend these for those who want an affordable alternative to annoying airpod style earbuds that fall out all the time. They also are small enough that my work allows me to wear them during my shift opposed to my big over the ear headphones.

author: Kate D
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat mic
body: Great headset for the price. The mic works well for phone calls, and the speakers are great for audiobooks and phonecalls. I am not picky about sound quality for music, so they work great for me. Everyone has a different idea of music quality. The battery life is as advertised, and they have a physical button rather than a touch sensitive operation. They stay put on your ears, are comfortable, and block at least 50% of outside sounds with a snug fit.  I would buy them again if I needed another pair.

author: Albnas
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsGood for a couple of months, then gone
body: I bought these earbuds about two months ago and was very happy with them until early this week: the right side simply stopped working and nothing that I did solved the issue. Furthermore, it wouldn't recharge, although the metal contacts were clean. It would begin to charge for a few seconds and then it would stop. Going thru its 1-star reviews I noticed several other customers with the exact same issue, one of them actually posted a short video showing what happens - same as mine. Because two months had passed since I got it, I didn't have the option to return/refund but, being persistent, I chatted with Amazon's customer service and, ta-da!, they accepted my return request and I already got my refund. Looking for a new pair of earbuds in the same price range ($25-$30) I found many unhappy customer reviews complaining about the same issue from other brands. My guess is that the parts for these devices are probably made by the same company in China that sell them to different brands. When you purchase something at this price you can't expect high quality - some will be defective. I already got a new one, same good sound quality, fits well in my ears and I'm happy again. To be seen is how long they are going to last...

body: ! I am beyond impressed with these earbuds! The sound quality is crystal clear with deep bass, and the noise cancellation works surprisingly well. I also love the waterproof feature, which gives me peace of mind when I’m running or caught in the rain. The LED display on the case is super handy for checking the battery level at a glance. Definitely the best wireless earbuds I’ve purchased — highly recommend!

author: carol thomas
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsThe Problem: I Believed The Pitch! SAVE YOUR MONEY!
body: The 3:00 AM Original Review: The WORST earbuds I have EVER bought! If I got them for free, I would still be disappointed! It is 2:48 AM. I battle insomnia. My other earbud’s battery unexpectedly died after a few hours. I tried these again. HORRIBLE! No noise reduction. Volume control AND levels are HORRIFIC. Bass is null! Maybe I am missing a button on this device to make them work correctly. However, the reality is THEY DO NOT have a make them better button. Above all, I ONLY use them to listen to documentaries and speaking podcasts and the sound is beyond HORRIBLE! They even exaggerate background sounds because they pick up background ambient sounds to the extent that those sounds are louder than the podcast volume UNLESS the volume on my iPhone is nearly on the highest volume level. What does this mean? It means one word describes this product best: CRAP! Sadly, I purchased them as a birthday gift. So, here I am WIDE AWAKE at 3:00 AM trying to fall back to sleep with a headband wrapped around my head, in the summer, TRYING to make these earbuds block out ambient noises. How I am going to work later this morning will be a challenge! I cannot hate these earbuds any more than I do, especially right now! And this is maybe the third time I used them since purchasing them just under a month ago. And, yes, that means during the past three weeks I AVOID using them unless I absolutely have to use this crappy product! Absolutely pathetic! UPDATE: Tried smaller ear tips, hours later during the day, while reading a Kindle book with a Brown Noise app playing ocean sounds. After twenty minutes of using them, and the volume on MAX to silence the sound of a small fan in my room, the earbuds will be counted as a LOSS! They are going in the trash! Any person qualifying this product as a five star version of earbuds is seriously deprived. This product’s sound is equivalent to the 1980s Walkman headphones; the ones on sale at the “5 & 10” store. Sorry. If this product did not advertise “noise canceling” and “extra bass,” I would NOT be so perturbed. However, since they did, I qualify such claims as NONSENSE! It is a LIE and false advertisement!

author: Ron Gagne
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsVolume jumps to full !
body: I almost smashed these. Luckily I didn't have a sledge hammer. For some odd reason with this pair of buds they switch to FULL VOLUME when a call comes in. I was listening to a podcast, got a call and almost blew out an ear drum. I thought I had done something wrong but it happened twice. Truth be told, I have several pairs I use for work and pleasure. I was looking for a pair with a better mic than the Back Bay pair that I use outdoors. While this pair seemed ok to those on the other end, the noise cancellation isn't that good and the lack of controls is annoying. You can control the volume for a phone call with the buds and the absurd high volume on the switch over from a listening to a phone call is really bad and can be dangerous. I currently use a set of Back Bay buds and a pair of Raycons.  My best pair were Bose Sound Sports Buds, which recently quit. I turned to multiple pairs because the thought of wearing a  $200 of buds digging in the dirt just doesn't seem like a great idea. Anyway, Ill get another pair of Bose and keep using the Raycons and Back Bays but this pair was disappointing.

author: Dr. Stefan Th. Gries
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsConnectivity and longevity issues
body: These earbuds are often very annoying: They do NOT turn off when you it them in the case if you try to use another Bluetooth device. I have some headphones and these earbuds payed with my phone. Whenever I 'turn off' the earbuds by putting them into the case to charge but continue to use my headphones, the earbuds do not turn off and reconnect with the headphones from within the closed case (!), which makes the headphone transmission stop. I often have this happen every 5-10 minutes: the Bluetooth manager of the phone lists my headphones as connected, the sounds goes off, and the Bluetooth manager of the phone lists my headphones AND the earbuds as connected as well. Apparently, the earbuds wait for connections even when supposedly off, which also means they often don't last as long. I do not recommend those even though I haven't yet found a good replacement.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsEar buds caused  infection

Battery seems to last a long time, though I just use for an hour or so at the gym each day. The digital display for power/battery is nice but a little hard to read in bright light. Happy with my purchase.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsBluetooth range is very poor
body: Fits well; however the Bluetooth range distorts after about a foot away.  Not worth having if I can't leave it on my retaining wall, while I'm gardening, and the bluetooth won't stay connected (literally 1 to 2 feet away.)  And, no, its not my wifi; my other headphones worked well even while mowing the grass.

author: mowsley711
title: 1.0 out of 5 stars99 out of 100 times this is a great Bluetooth.
body: I have purchased many of these for work. They usually last between 6 months and to a year and then the U shaped band snaps at the hinge from constant opening and closing . Not complaining…I get my moneys worth from being on the phone 40 hours a week and the hands free device is incredible. The one I received yesterday keeps disconnecting mid call or the caller cannot hear me. (Choppy or static) I am going to assume it’s defective and ask for a replacement.

author: misheleen y.
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsVoice assist prompt terrible.
body: The sound is good but when you step away from your phone 10 feet the range goes out. Also, the voice that says connected, disconnect, pairing, unpairing is soooooo annoying I would return it just for that. She literally sounds like a b!mbo/valley girl and sounds extra whiny in her voice and pronunciation.

author: MEH
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsToo bad
body: Loved the features and the fit but the sound is by far the worst. Like being in an auditorium and getting feedback. This I need to return.

author: SkyMo Borsman
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsPoor Bluetooth performance
body: The sound quality of this device is fine, and I like the foldability and the push-button retractability of the headphone cords. However, these features do fail to make up for the poor connectivity: these headphones cannot maintain a stable connection with my phone if my phone is in my back pocket. Given that I wear these for work and am quite active, it is annoying that I must keep my phone in my front pocket if I want to listen to anything without the headphones constantly breaking up and losing connection.

author: Chris Sandstrom
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSurprisingly good
body: I am a headset assassin due to wearing fall protection all the time but it just comes with the territory - therefore this is my second pair. I had previously snapped 2 different pair of $180 neckband headphones and I just wasn't going to spend that again. These headphones/earbuds have surprisingly good sound and a lot of bass - and also enough juice for good volume when you want it. Actually better than my previous LG's etc...  and for $30. can't beat that! Battery life is phenomenal, and the upgrade to USB-C charging was a welcome thing. Just try a set out. You may be surprised how much you DON'T have to spend for decent sound. :)

author: AG
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsSounds great - tad bulky though.
body: Works great, clear sound on calls. However it is a tad bulky. If you dont mind that, they are a great buy.

author: Patricia Brown
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsHinges are faulty

author: MKRD.info
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsMUCH WORSE THAN SX-991 !!!
body: Is this really an "improvement" of SX-991??? Why the lower part number then? Do they know the REAL and ONLY SERIOUS issue with the SX-991, that the plastic headband always snaps about three months of use??? Will this headband also snap after three months of use??? I HATE HATE HATE the SX-990 immediately upon first use! I hate the new voice prompts. Much worse accent, messages cut short, too loud, just very annoying voice after all! This is larger than the SX-991. I hate the color accent. I am using this at work and I do NOT want people to know I am even wearing this headset! The awful charging port cover rubber piece is as undersized and mis-positioned as it was on SX-991 since it switched to USBC from USB Micro. The reversed controls are copied over. The louder/plus/next track/power ON direction of buttons and slide switches should be AWAY from your head! The vibration and volume up/down tone is waaaaay too strong and too loud! The reception range of this headset is much, much shorter than the SX-991. You walk away 12 ft and it starts nagging you with voice prompt. The "out of range" and "low battery" voice prompts are SUPER SUPER ANNOYING. I DON'T WANT TO HEAR THIS EVERY SINGLE MINUTE! SHUT UP!!! Hate it hate it hate it! You have no idea what the problems were with the SX-991 to begin with!

Out of the two pair I've bought in the last few months they've each had a problem with the right side earbud dying.  One of them had the microphone die and no one could hear me on a call.  The previous pair from Amorno last about a year before they die and the battery life seems to be better.  I won't buy these again.

author: Michael Sample
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsUse to be a great headset
body: I have purchased several of these headset over the years and the worked well for my needs. However, lately the quality has dropped significantly, they want stay connected, they constantly connect and disconnect throughout the entire day, even while your phone is 5 feet away. So now I’m in the process of finding another headphone to meet my needs. The last two I purchased seem to have this issue, I don’t know what happened, but these has always been my go to headphones. I really prefer this headphones, they are much easier to maneuver while listening to music or clips on YouTube. Anyway hopefully I’ll find a replacement soon, not sure if I should try my luck with another one of these.

title: 4.0 out of 5 starsIt works but hlthe voice sounds odd
body: The video showcases the product in use. The video guides you through product setup. The video compares multiple products. The video shows the product being unpacked. Video Player is loading. Click to play video Play Mute Current Time 0:00 / Duration 0:13 Loaded : 46.20% 0:00 Stream Type LIVE Seek to live, currently behind live LIVE Remaining Time - 0:13 1x Playback Rate Chapters Chapters Descriptions descriptions off , selected Captions captions off , selected English (Automated) Audio Track default , selected Fullscreen This is a modal window. It seems to work on and the battery life is what I expected but....that voice!  Every time you turn it on or off or connect a device, the voice prompt sounds like 900-number operator from the 80's who had to get a job doing Bluetooth voiceovers to make ends meet.  It's not good.

author: Shaun
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsgreat fit, ease of use, quality is not music devoted
body: The media could not be loaded. I bought a pair back in 2018. I didn't know what it to expect. They turned out to be perfect for what I wanted and that's for phone conversations with some simple music. I lost the rubber ear piece of the original pair so I used it as an excuse to buy a new pair :)  I thought to see if this model or a newer model was available. Obviously, they do and it's the same model. I didn't hesitate and bought it. That's why I'm here writing the review. If you expect any sort of bass then you will be greatly disappointed. I love how it simply and comfortably around my neck. I also extend the cord a bit more than I need so if I turn my head it makes sure to not get caught on my hoodie or whatever. I listen to music on them but it's more like background music. I'm also able to hear things around me, which is useful because I can hear how loud I am speaking so my wife does't have to ask me to quiet down :)

author: Avid Book Reader
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsSX990 decline
body: This is third pair of this headset. Terrible value for money.  The first pair I purchased were fantastic, good quality, and lasted a long time. I purchased second pair and they were terrible with the changed design so went looking for a new pair. When I purchased these, I did not know it was the SX990. Unfortunately it was and the issues persist. Would not buy again and very disappointed. In the trash and will search for a new reliable headset that does not beep and disconnect every two seconds nor break at the fold. It is not the phone as I got a new one and issues persisted. Weight is a little heavy.

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsHead Phones Fell Apart and you cannot contact seller
body: Purchased July 24th.  Product fell apart on both sides on 12/6.  Should be under warranty but no way to contact Beartwo to get resolved. I have purchased 7 headsets from this seller for family and this will be the last.

author: Item was delivered and not stolen by usps! I'm not gonna jinx myself and say they did "good", but I am to Amazon, making sure usps does their job👍

author: Amazon Customer

body: Easy to pair. Quality sound and noise cancellation. I could not function without them. Been using this brand daily for more than a decade and may be on only the fourth set.

author: LT
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsBLUETOOTH DOESN'T CONNECT or WORK!!!
body: The headset doesn't work.  BearTwo sent me a replacement, but the replacement doesn't work either.  I messaged them directly several days ago, but have not heard one word from them.  The Bluetooth connects to my phone when I turn the set on, but once I start dialing the phone number, it disconnects.  The call never connects when the other party answers my call.  I've tried over and over and over, but nothing works.  Save your money!

author: Hellsbells
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsCould have better battery life
body: They work great.  Good design.  Not bad sound for the price point. The noise cancelation is great, which is great for my purposes. I'm not sure they're great for people using them for walking,  biking, or running outside v in a gym.. it would be difficult to be aware of your surroundings. My only complaint is that these do not have the same battery longevity of the last pair of these I purchased, and the battery percentage is obviously not accurate. They would last 4 or 5 days before needing a recharge using them all night (from 10 pm to 5 am) and would show the percentage accurately. These will show 70%, and then die within 3 hours in the middle of the night,  which walks need up. The other ones,  at 70% meant I had 2 to 3 more days before being a recharge. Not sure if I just got a bad pair this time or what happened, but definitely subpar compared to what i had before and they're the exact same ones.

I got these so my children could listen to audiobooks, but they’ve stopped using them because it’s so frustrating. I’m disappointed that they haven’t worked for us.

author: E. Travis
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGenerally good product, but!
body: This was my second pair of these.  The first pair broke due to my own fault.  The second pair had one of the earbuds stop working.  The reason I believe was because of the retractable wire.  I was letting the wires retract on their own and the spring mechanism is pretty strong.  So, it would SNAP back causing stress on the thin earbud wires.  After about a year or so of use one of the earbuds stopped working. If I get another pair I will not do that again and will hold on while they retract to prevent the stress on the wires. That said, the audio quality was very good, bluetooth range was very good, and overall build was good.  The headset came with extra end tips for different size ear openings

So is convenient as it is to have a c port instead of micro USB I still recommend keeping your eyes open for the old version because when those stopped working it would always be an earbud or something stopped working but it would be well after I've had them for a long time not just because they decided they didn't want to work anymore.

title: 3.0 out of 5 starsSounds Great - Can't talk on it
body: Music sounds great on these. I use them with my Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, and I love that they are retractable. However, I have tried for several months and tried several recommendations to connect to phone calls, but it just won't work.  I tell it to answer the call, and it picks up the call, but I cannot hear the caller, and the caller cannot hear me. As I said, I have been trying to get them to work with phone calls for months, and it just won't work. I have called people on a landline, VOiP, IPhone and other Samsung phones. I had hoped to connect it to my laptop and cell phone, but it doesn't do me any good since I can't have a conversation on them with any options (Zoom, Slack or phone).don't know how it can connect two divides at once when it can't connect fully to just one. (No,

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBattery that is on the mythic level.
body: Battery that is on the mythic level. I got these on 7/9 and charged them. Today 7/25 it needed a recharge. I used them every day for about 6-8+ hours a day. I didn't need a charge for so long it was getting weird. The ear muffs can get a bit warm but otherwise they are comfortable and were a little tight but I was able to open them a little and it was looser. Sound is decent not as deep bass as my Corwin 7's but still good. the build quality is good and have a nice feel to them. The pleather is easy to maintain and wipe off after each use to preserve it. author: ThirtyJaxSeven
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Pair Of Headphones! If You’re Second Guessing, Take My Advice & Just Pick Them Up!
body: I recently purchased these pair of Bluetooth/wired headphones specifically to pair with my Woojer Vest, since my iPhone doesn’t support dual Bluetooth connectivity. I was initially skeptical, but decided to take a chance and I’m really glad I did! These headphones turned out to be exactly what I needed. The bass is absolutely booming, which works perfectly with the haptic feedback from the vest, and the overall sound quality is crisp and powerful. The volume levels are just right, loud enough to feel immersive without any distortion. The wired connection option is a huge plus for my setup, and everything works seamlessly. I’d definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a solid set of headphones, especially if you’re into immersive gear like the Woojer. Great value and performance, I’m genuinely impressed!

author: Morty
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsdual wired inputs work, but do not have volume control
body: 1. Works reasonably well as bluetooth headphones.  Typical three button setup, with a multifunction button, a volume up button that when held acts as a "next" button, and a volume down button that when held doubles as a "previous" button. 2. There are two wired inputs, 1/4" and 3.5mm.  They work simultaneously.  This is the main feature I wanted. 3. But there is no onboard volume control for the wired inputs.  The volume up and down buttons only seem to work for the bluetooth.  This is not acceptable. 4. While it's possible to use the bluetooth and the 1/4" input simultaneously, the volume for the wired connection becomes a lot quieter.  And you can't turn it up.  This is basically unusable. 5. Plugging either of the provided cables into the 3.5mm input shuts off the bluetooth if it's on.  This is annoying. 6. The bluetooth works in a typical multipoint setup.  You can connect it to two devices.  But only one device can play at a time.

author: JK
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsMy favorite sounding headphones. Just wish they were built a little better.
body: I love the way these sound. I've had more expensive brands that sound much worse and flatter in comparison. If there's one complaint: It's the build quality. I had the left ear just sort of wear out, give way, and not rest against my ear correctly anymore. The company actually came through and replaced them just shy of two years later! They actually stood by the warranty and didn't even fight. Most companies would have tried to play the blame game especially given what happened and how close it was. Sometimes getting them to connect can be kind of finicky if you have them paired to more than a few devices. They seem to be able to change automatically depending on which source is outputting sound at any given time. I really like the fact that they're wired too. That means I can hook them into my amp sim pedal to play guitar. They charge relatively quick given you use a good enough cable. Cheap cables seem to not allow them to charge as quickly. Beware of this. Some people seem to think it's a defect, but changing which cable you're using can make all the difference. I experienced this myself. If it weren't for the left ear wearing out so easily, 5/5, especially given the price to sound quality ratio.

The audio is full, bass response is excellent and my music sounds great with these. Highly recommended ! The storage bag is a nice touch and the cables for plugged in use are very high quality. Its even good with phone for BT calls and computer gaming/video conferencing as it has a built in microphone. Oh, and the price was the best part!!!

body: These headphones are amazing! The sound is superb and clear. The bass is low and deep. The build quality is very good too.
