author: Julien
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat lightweight Bluetooth / Wired Headphones for Travel
body: Got these for long flights to leave in my luggage bags and not use my everyday headset. Really like the cushions on them and the sound is pretty good for the price. They worked well on the flight and are light weight. They do pretty good at decreasing the surrounding noise to hear music / sound clearly. I used them with a Bluetooth transmitter plugged into the movie screen on the plane and like that the cord can be completely disconnected to use the Bluetooth feature. The battery charge lasts a long time as I didn't have to recharge for several days. I would like them better if the frame was made of a little bit heavier material. Overall they are good enough for the use intended and definitely worth the price.

author: Randy
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWell, they work, but not as expected
body: The main reason I bought these was that they can be corded or Bluetooth. I first charged them overnight, in the morning the light should have gone from red to blue, it did not change. The only way I saw that they where fully charged is when I paired them with my phone. OneOdio does have an App, to bad it will not work with the A70. Description says they have a built in microphone, this is NOT TRUE. There is NO Mic in the headset. The only Mic you have is when you use the 3.5 mm to 3.5 mm lead. Another reason I got these was to Bluetooth to my PS5. They will NOT pair to a PS5. PS5 knows there are there, but comes back and says these are incompatible. But, the 3.5 mm to 3.5 mm lead does work when plugged into the controller. The volume was really load, I had to drop my chat volume in the PS5 to zero, then it was better. The other people I was talking to said the sound from me was much better and clearer then the other headset I was using. The + and - buttons for volume ONLY work while paired to a device in Bluetooth. If you use a cord, then the external device will need to control the volume. The volume level and sound quality was really good. They are very light on the head and ear muffs are comfortable.

body: I cannot stress to you more how much you shouldn’t waste your time purchasing these. I was looking for affordable headphones to use while streaming at home. so i’ll cover the main topics sound : ok(3.5/5) — maximum volume isn’t very high — I wouldn’t suggest it but not the end of the world durability/color: photo advertised and in person is sooooo drastically different. feels cheap when you touch it as well as when you place it on your head. if you have any type of sensitivity to like cheap sponge and fabric on eachother then that’s kinda what to imagine. idk how to describe it. i had high hopes tho because the pink seemed so cute. i’d rate it 1/5 — complete waste of time, resources to develop and money

author: Bryan
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWell built
body: I've had these headphones for nearly a year now and I really like them . The sound quality is decent , battery life is good , they're comfortable , bluetooth range is average , and the best thing is that they are still in one piece . I break a lot of headphones to be honest . I like to wear them to bed and I fall asleep on them all the time which is very hard on them . I've had expensive headphones and cheapos and neither will usually last a year , but these have . I would recommend them if you need some rough and tumble headphones at a good price .

Otherwise headphone is really on par with the Expensive ones $200 & Up range.

author: G-Man
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsThey failed the charging test.
body: These headphones simply are very challenging to charge.  You will plug them in and suddenly you check on them and the charging light is off.  You can reinsert the cable and the light will go back on only to go off when you walk away.  After several tries over a day or so they will finally charge.  I noticed that if I get a connection I can't move the cord at all or the light will go out.  This has happened since day one.  As far as design, I don't like the fact that you have to locate the center button to turn them on which is inbetween two other buttons. You find yourself "feeling around" like trying to read brail with your fingers.  It's hard to find it with the phones on your head.  Others that I owned had a dedicated power button by itself.  Other wise the headphones sound good, but the charging issue is getting a little old the longer I own these.

author: Imalay
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsLo mejor
body: Los llevo usando varios días y aquí va mi opinión sincera: ✅ Lo que me encantó: • El sonido es nítido y claro, no tan pesado en bajos como otros Beats, pero se escucha todo con buen balance. • La batería es OTRA COSA. Literal, los cargué el lunes y hoy jueves todavía siguen vivos 🔋🔥 • Me encanta que puedo usarlos con cable USB-C o 3.5mm si me quedo sin batería (que no ha pasado aún). • Se conectan rápido a mi iPhone y también a mi laptop sin problema. 🔁 Lo que mejoraría: • Después de un rato largo puestos, se sienten un poco apretados (no son los más cómodos para tener todo el día). • No tienen cancelación de ruido activa, pero si los usas en casa o en la oficina están perfectos. 🎶 Para música, llamadas, podcasts y hasta videos en Netflix, me han encantado. Si los ves en oferta (yo los conseguí por debajo de $150), valen totalmente la pena.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsMost uncomfortable headphones
body: These headphones are the most uncomfortable that I have ever had to wear. For Beats I would expect some good base but it’s lacking very much in that area. I don’t know if other types of beats are more comfortable to wear but the Solo 4 are. Can’t wear for too long as I get headaches and ears hurt from being pressed down too much. I bought these for my husband’s birthday but he didn’t like them so I got him some JBL and took these. Wish I could return and upgrade to something else even if I had to pay the difference though I don’t know if it would make much of a difference.

After the first day of longtime use, even despite trying to get creative with their positioning to lessen the pain, my ears ached all night and ached even into the next day.

author: Clayton Barnes
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsWhite / pink unconnecting Beats Solo 4
body: Between two people we’ve had 4 Beats Solo 3 headphones. That generation wasn’t available anymore and both of us had to get these Beats Solo 4 - one in black and the other in this color. This color looks like a concentrated matte pink but it’s actually just white with a tinge of soft pink. The sound quality is a little painful. It “scans your ears for optimal use” & becomes the equivalent of those ultra hd tvs. The sound is somehow deep and super distant. They are more comfortable and require less break in but the color isn’t as advertised albeit maybe more palatable & I just really miss my old ones. Charging is inconvenient and after a month it isn’t connecting

author: Michael G.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent for hearing impaired to watching TV for extended time.
body: Excellent Bluetooth headset for long term wear. My mother has difficulty hearing the TV, the TV has built in Bluetooth audio. She is able to wear these all day long while watching TV. Battery life is great and audio quality is crystal clear. The only feature that should get tweaked is the audio buttons. Moving them to the SIDE of the headphones would be more convenient than on the top. My mom needs to take off the headphones in order to press the volume buttons. A big plus is the ear pieces extend more than enough, making the headphones comfortable and light on the ears.

author: Shannon Shoop
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat quality, long long battery life and comfortable and easy to use!
body: My second set, it lasts forever, good depth of hearing. I have other kinds but this set is my go too for driving without using the car or phone. It’s easy to use, seems to last forever. My first set broke after trying to use it with a neck brace after surgery. Other buds batteries do not last as long as these do! Great quality, excellent price, comfortable enough to fall asleep with (usually happens during meditation videos)! Wish they were touch operated but the button is fine. Will always buy again when these wear out and it’s been over a year of constant use with these.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat for Everyday Use!
body: This headset is super convenient. The retractable earbuds are awesome—no tangles! It folds up easily, fits in my bag, and the sound quality is great for music and calls. Battery lasts all day, and it’s really comfortable to wear. Definitely recommend for anyone on the go!

Same exact model number only difference is Amorno has their name on the side. Spend a little more and find something else. I’ll be returning these

author: Catherine Theriot
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsvery satisfied
body: This blue tooth headset is very good.  This was my first experience using one, and it has been so simple to use.  It paired with my phone very easily.  My husband says my voice was clearer using it than when I use just my phone.  It was also very reasonably priced.  That was important because we are going to be getting a new car with built in blue tooth, so I didn't want to spend a lot.

author: Leonardyy93
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNot sturdy, worse than the previous model
body: I bought this type of product multiple times, as I really like the neckband and the retractable feature. However, this specific product has several problems: 1. The volume fluctuates a lot, sometimes I can barely hear things even though I tune the volume to maximum. But most of the time, it works at 30% for the same APP and song. 2. The battery is very confusing. It would show 70% (battery level medium) for days. However, when it goes to 30% (low), it only stays alive for ~30min. 3. The above are not huge problems. What's fatal is the fragile junction. I have used SX-990, a previous model, for 2 years without any problem. However, this upgraded version, SX-991, only lasts for six months under the same level of caution. I wish I had bought another SX-990 instead. It was ~$10 cheaper, too.

author: Mom of 11
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDoes not connect/pair with Lenovo/Acer Chromebooks
body: I bought this for my 14 year old son.  I searched reviews and read that it was compatible with Chromebooks.  It is not.  I have a Lenovo and an Acer Chromebook.  Neither of them recognize these Bluetooth headphones (doesn't even come up as an option).  Too bad we missed our return window.  My son just brought them to me to pair a couple days ago.  Don't buy them if you're looking at connecting them to your Chromebook.

author: JCB
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsAn older version (2024 ) Calls made or received can't be heard unless turning on/off device.
body: Update to review:  This has been used more for listening to A/V rather than phone calls.  Have noticed on phone calls after some trouble shooting to ensure it's not system settings that I can be heard but cannot hear the caller on the other end without first turning off the device and reconnecting which is obviously highly annoying and failure of the product.  It's also noticed when making a call.  When calling there is an unusual delay on if the call is actually going through.  It's not immediate then it will connect with same result of unable to hear the caller.  Again, turn off and on the device while in call and then it works correctly.  I purchased an identical style of headset yet different brand name and it works perfectly so it is this headset.  Unknown at this time if there is any warranty past the 30 days on this device.  Unless just using it to listen rather than for calls it works fine but may have to junk it in favor of the other reliable brand. This model is an older model purchased before purchasing the 2024 version as it is marketed but generally the overall quality and usage of the device is the same. Ear buds that can be easily lost are the least preferred so the neckband types are most suitable to preference.  Some smaller profile neckbands were purchased in the past and have worked well so this was an attempt to try a little bit different style since the earbuds retract rather than those that connect magnetically to the neckband also leaving wiring exposed. There are tradeoffs.  these are a bit cleaner and easier and wiring and given the retractable earbuds but they are a bit bulkier as a result and less forgiving in flexibility.  They do fold for easy storage which may make traveling with them a little easier as they do come with a nice zippered case that stores the headset and the charging cable.  I also like the fact that it can be used for other purposes if not for use with the headset. They are thicker to house the retractable feature so a little less forgiving in the flexibility as some of the other headsets with magnetic earbud storage.  The charging connector is on the bottom of the headset.  That could matter depending on your charging habits and how it may rest while being charged but not a factor here one way or the other.  There are different colors (and at different prices as a result).  Since I have other previous models similar in function getting used to these buttons took a little time but seems now natural to adjust to them.  I do like the actual on/off switch as opposed to the type that require holding a button for a few seconds to power on and off.  The latter sometimes makes it difficult to know when it's turned off or having to listen through the earbud whether it was turned on or off. The battery life seems way better than what I am accustomed to with some other models.  Charging is usually done overnight or when low and a second set is alternated so length of charge doesn't cause any concerns.  There are two buttons one on each side to retract each ear bud.  To use just pull on the ear bud the desired length and press the button to easily retract.  So far it has not failed to retract.  Sometimes listening to podcasts only one ear bud is used at a time so nice that one is retracted while the other is in use. Overall I do like the functionality of this headset but do wish it was just a little less bulkier.

title: 3.0 out of 5 starsSwivel fold breaks easily
body: As far as the sound and long life of the battery goes, it's wonderful. The only issue is the swivel part where you fold is plastic and not very sturdy, once it breaks you can't wear it around your neck unless you tape it, and if you tape it, you can't fold it. So, these lasted me 6+ months. I really thought I'd found the best. I really like these. But that is 2 sets broken at the swivel part in less than a year. Needs to be studier material.

author: Nicolette
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsVoice announcing the callers phone number
body: I actually really liked this headset. After trying out five headsets for my office desk phone. When I opened the package and began to use it, I thought I had finally found a headset that worked for me. Pairing it is simple, there are different earpads available, and a case is included for transporting everything. The headset was charged and very easy to sync with my desk phone. However, the sound quality was subpar. It sounded like the people were in a tunnel. The reason I returned them is that when receiving a call, the headset announces the number: 555-555-5555. When this occurred, the caller was unable to hear me until they read the phone number. I sent a message to the seller, who replied immediately. They said that if I wanted to replace it because of the sound quality, they would send a new headset. They said I would receive a full refund and did not need to return the headset, but I did. Unfortunately, the announcement could not be modified. I really thought this would work but the phone number being announced really did not work for me. I returned the headset.

The one large button on the right is very convenient. It does take a little time to get used to using the retraction buttons to retract the earbuds. To change the volume using the volume buttons you have to hold them vice just clicking them once which jumps what you are listening to forward or backward.

Eventually, one of these hinges breaks, rending the product useless. This time I wrapped the arms with electrical tape. They no longer are foldable, but hopefully they won't break. Time will tell.

author: VS
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsIneffective noise cancellation
body: I was sold on this product by a promotional review, but it was underwhelming. I could only connect it to my Android phone, but not to my Mac. Furthermore, the quality of noise cancellation is very poor, compared to say the Tozo NC9, which is in a similar price range and offers active noise cancellation. This particular pair of earbuds does not have ANC capabilities. That said, the weight, fit and comfort were all good. The volume control is very clunky and unreliable. I did not test the microphone capability. Pairing with the phone was easy, as noted above, pairing with the Mac did not work. The earbuds do not come with a companion app, and there is no obvious way to change the sound profiles. I had only considered this product because unlike the Tozo NC9 which does not have multi-device support, the Amazon AI (Rufus?) suggested that this product can be connected to more than one device. Overall, probably decent for exercising, walking, running, but not very impressive.  Your mileage may vary.

author: Jasmine
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNot the best and not the worst.
body: I just received my ear buds today. They did come fully charged and well packaged. Unfortunately, I've decided to return them after finding another pair this evening. The sound quality is nice, but I think I can find a little better. They don't have an on board EQ and the new one I found has that and an interactive case where you can choose options and even has a locator device if you lose them. Don't get me wrong, these are not bad headphones, but one side doesn't fit my ear real well. It's a problem i often have with certain headphones. They also didn't come with the 3 different size ear tips. They were all the same so I couldn't change it out for a better fit. They did hold a charge for several hours. At the price I paid they were worth it being on sale, but I wouldn't say they are much better that my $29 JBL's. If I had paid the original price for them, I'd definitely return them. I guess i was a little disappointed, but I'm pretty fussy about my ear buds since I listen to music and podcasts all day every day. For the sale price of $19.99 they're fine.

author: Chris A.
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNot noise cancelling, only noise cancelling mic
body: Disclaimer: The only reason this isn’t listed as a verified purchase for me is because my friend bought these A90 earbuds for me. I wanted these because at the time they had a limited time deal. The regular price was listed at $99.99 but the limited deal was for $19.99 so I snatched them up. After using them for a bit now, I think $19.99 should be the regular price. These are not $100 earbuds. Yes they have pretty good sound quality with good bass like others have mentioned but I thought these were actual noise canceling earbuds for music. I guess I misread the description at the top. Only the mic is noise canceling. It does not block out outside noise when listening to music. I will say one good thing about these. They come with a lifetime warranty. The email address is included in the tiny print on the manual that comes with it. But overall, these are average earbuds. Not amazing but not bad. Worth $19.99 but not $100 at all. Sad that you can’t actually turn noise cancelling on for real.

author: Guillermo Marconi
title: 1.0 out of 5 stars1.0 out of 5 stars A Recording Studio And Broadcast Audio Professional Gives A Detailed Review
body: I am both a recording studio and broadcast industry audio professional and I've mixed and used just about every kind of headphones over a period of decades. If I was to pick one word to describe these headphones, the word would be "garbage". While they are really cheap selling at $14.99, they are worth $14.99 less than that. Here are the reasons why. The bass on these headphones is unacceptably muddy. The mids and highs are also unacceptable. The eq button on these headphones is just ornamental and does nothing. These headphones are adequately comfortable to wear, but everything about the audio is really subpar. While I advocate not spending a lot of money on headphones, because they all will eventually fail, I will look elsewhere for inexpensive headphones because these headphones are junk.

author: Miss K
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsThey're nice headphones.
body: These headphones served me well. I've had them for a while now but they're starting to wear out. The most frustrating thing about these headphones is that I can't figure out how to remove the cushions to replace them since they started to flake and look kind of ugly. They don't take long to charge, even after years of use. They'll probably fit your head just fine since its got an adjustable headband. I wouldn't call these "noise cancelling" but if you're listening to something with a high enough volume, you might not hear a few things. I haven't used the wire/mic that comes with the product but it's probably your average microphone quality (you'd be better off finding a different one). The cord is fairly long though. The pink is super cute. I've dropped them a few times but it didn't fall apart. It has a couple of different modes you can cycle to but I've stuck to one pretty much ever since I've gotten them. They do change how the audio plays though, so find what's best for your needs. My only issue with the headphones is the cosmetic wear, otherwise they're still as good as when I first got it. I'd say, go for it! They were nice for the price I got it. They're a lot more comfortable than some other headphones I've used.

author: Steve
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEasily my go-to for budget bluetooth earbuds
body: This is actually my *third* pair of WI-C100s- the first pair lasted a good several months (if not over a year) but the cable from the battery to the earbud came loose on one side; the second I lost on the way to work after months of use, probably while having to run for a bus or snagged on my backpack strap and fell off (was...not a good morning hah) So....yes, since they're so light they are easy to slip off accidentally if you don't have one or both ears in-use to keep it from running off your neck (mostly when running or leaning/laying back, basic day-to-day activities don't usually knock em loose ime) that's really the only "big" downside I've found so far across these- and I've been using this same model for a few years now. And worst case scenario, if you do lose em they're cheap and easy to replace, widely available- sometimes even at local stores (though my nearby places didn't this time around) Because they're tethered together, I don't have to worry about losing one ear because it fell out mid-use or I forgot to put it back into the case when not in use. Sometimes you may need to be careful using these when wearing any "cross-chest strap" bags or otherwise (messenger/gym/duffel bags, purses, arm-slings, tools with a neck/shoulder strap, etc) to make sure the earbuds don't get caught under the strap- but for the tradeoff of reliability and peace-of-mind of having them semi-wired, I don't mind that occasional snag too much. Even when they do lightly catch on my backpack strap, they haven't seemed to wear down or come loose around the wire at either end (the pair I had that *did* break in that way came loose at the battery end, and wasn't caused by a shoulder strap- was also after several months of heavy use, even while sleeping) So build quality is reasonable, how do they sound? Honestly, for a $20-30 pair of *wireless* earbuds, pretty decent ^-^ sure it may not satisfy any audiophiles, but again....don't forget the price- even for that, they still sound great to me (of course, that could just be Sony and their reasonable consistency/quality with even budget headphones over the years heh) and the extra features from the Sound Connect app are a nice bonus. Of course it's not going to have extra-thumpy bass (try their "XB" line of products for that) or Sennheiser/Bose/what-have-you quality- but the equalizer and DSEE do give you some extra control over how they sound. Oh, and you can also enable/disable the voice msgs from the app, so it'll only speak up when turning on/off the headset, and when the battery is low The connection consistency and quality have been pretty good across all 3 pairs I've had. For reference, I not only use them with my phone daily (close proximity, but also connecting to Android over BT often works better than with Windows) but also with my PC just as often- and I've never had a problem with initial pairing or swapping between the two. When in use with my PC, even when in another room several ft away they still maintain a good connection, only *rarely* drops out from far away if I move my arm in the way of the line-of-sight (granted, that may also be another advantage of the "pair on the same wire" style of headset over individual or TWS [true wireless sound, or "airpod style" with the separate batteries/bt connections per ear] buds- ymmv with your device(s) of choice) The battery life....hoo boy, they're not kidding when they say upwards of 20-25 hrs. Not only do these have a larger battery thanks to the type of headset- but also since the battery is along the band instead of the buds themselves, the earbuds are much lower profile and work great for wearing during sleep without having to worry about them falling out or losing charge too soon (as long as you don't mind the wires- but even then, they're pretty lightweight and unobtrusive) especially with the right eartips to help keep em snug and secure. Personally, with my living situation having something playing in my ears to drown out outside noise while sleeping was....a necessity- with some memory foam eartips (the included ones would normally be ok, but my inner ear is a bit wide even for the included large tips to work ._.) you almost don't need active noise-cancelling with these ^-^ speaking of eartips, the posts on these are also decently long unlike most TWS buds, so they have a bit more flexibility with options for those (one of my major problems with several TWS pairs I've tried) Between the long battery life (and decently fast charging speed, even over a PC USB instead of 2A wall adapter), comfortable wear, decent sound quality for price, and extra features in the companion app, I'm pretty happy with these as a daily driver (As for the provided eartips, there's nothing wrong with em and will likely work for most, I'm just a bit of an odd case with ear shape hah)

author: Jeweling Rowes
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThey fall off easily! Buy a clip to avoid losing them.
body: I tried to give these 5 stars, but it wouldn't allow me to for some reason. (???) I've owned about 3 pair of these and am back buying another 2. I have my spare to my husband who lost his, and had now lost my spare! The problems have been that one stopped working, and the rest have fallen off and gotten lost. They do take awhile to charge, but the charge easily lasts for 20 hours. Great for listening to audiobooks or watching your favorite shows. For making phone calls...90-95% of the time...they do an excellent job. Price is reasonable, but has gotten progressively more and more expensive. Very annoy to lose them so easily. I'm going to buy a clip to attach them, so I won't lose them the next time they fall off. Be sure to buy a clip because they fall off constantly. I'm going to buy the cheaper white ones, and keep a spare in my car because when I charge them overnight, I sometimes forget them when I leave for work and I really do really on them.

author: Qetesh
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLongest Battery Life of any tethered earbuds
body: I am truly amazed by how long these earbuds last on a full charge. I listened to audiobooks for over 20 hours on one charge (and that didn’t include a few hours of standby time). The flip side is that they take a bit longer to charge (~1 hour); but it seems a fair trade off considering how long a single charge lasts. Additional Info: Pros: they are lightweight; the controls are easy to feel and operate; when turned on a voice informs you of how much change the battery has (in roughly 25% increments); sweat and dust resistant Cons: the sound quality isn’t Sony’s finest, but decent; not waterproof; If you’re looking for earbuds to listen to audio (especially spoken word) for hours on end- these are for you!

author: Scuds_Radio
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe best earbuds I know.
body: Good headphones that are not too expensive. I've bought many pairs for me and my family. Has the quickest and farthest Bluetooth connection I've seen, even compared to other headphones and speakers. Probably the best sound quality for ear buds that I've experienced. Very comfortable and light, with a battery that I've gotten to last over 20 hours, great for long work shifts. The controller is very basic. Pause/play, next, previous, volume up and down. Easy to lose, can fall into cracks and get lost in unkempt wires, but it is kinda hard to tangle. Not the best for extreme activity, I like to use them at work where I can lift, walk and sit. At the gym they will bounce around and become unmanageable, sometimes even yanking out the earbud if I want to run or jump.

I HATE that the buds aren't magnetic anymore. They're constantly slipping down and falling off when I don't have them in. But still, better than the other options I've tried. Sound quality is great. author: wali h
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat wireless neckband earphones with a couple shortcomings
body: I've used its cousin, the WI-C130, for the past two years and felt like it was about time to replace them given their waning battery life. I've used those out and about, listening to music and, most importantly, while lying in bed listening to audiobooks (including side-sleeping). Most earphones aren't comfortable for that; either they poke out too much, are generally uncomfortable, or too loose/unsecure. But these (both C100 and C130) are amazingly comfortable for that use-case. The WI-C100 is comparable to WI-C130. Given Sony's notoriously confusing naming scheme, its not clear which of the models is meant to be a step-up over the other. - In minor aspects of build quality, the WI-C130 seems better; slightly better quality plastic with magnets (at least weak ones) on the eartips for convenient attaching when not in use. - But otherwise, the WI-C100 seems better; the sound quality (from initial impressions) and the availability of software preferences. E.g., after initial connection with an android smartphone, it prompts you to install the Sony SoundConnect app which has a nice equalizer with a "clear bass" option. It also includes helpful guides on the button functionality and choosing the right sized eartips for your ears. It also includes (what seems like) a gimmick feature: a "360 live sound" app which simulates surround sound and adapts it to a model of your ear shape. I'm not sure whether this applies globally, or only in the small collection of paid bloatware apps it offers to install. The app could've been more polished, and if the 360 live sound thingy was better implemented, it would definitely outcompete other such branded apps. Two important shortcomings: - These should've had multipoint bluetooth connections so that at least two devices could be connected at a time. It seems they could've implemented that in this package, esp. at this price-point. - These don't automatically turn off after a timeout period when there's no sound. I suspect this needlessly shortens their battery health overtime, like it does for the WI-C130, especially when used during sleep time. Its a shame because an automatic-switch-off feature would've made these even more robust and long-lasting. TL;DR: In the relatively overlooked niche of wireless neckband earphones, this is a very decent, economical option, providing Sony-level sound quality and reliability. (Having said that, the WI-C130s were $18 two years ago, now these comparable WI-C100s are almost double the price. That's regrettable especially since the cheap plastic build quality is nothing to write home about, also with the two shortcomings above. There are other companies providing more features at this price-point (albeit without the Sony-level comfort). I hope Sony limits price-hikes for these and related models, or at least justifies them with tangible improvements in build quality, sound, IP rating, battery life, QoL features, etc). Bonus tip: cross the earphones around the neck for a more secure fit. This advice goes for most wireless earphones with neckbands.

author: Matt
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsApple just does it better
body: These are pretty unreal for the price. The wireless earbud market in current year is a mess, heaps of overpriced garbage offerings being released and nobody can release a pair of earbuds that are just perfect. I used these first on Android (moving to iPhone later this year because I'm tired of the AI crap being pushed in today's tech and I know right now I can rely on Apple intelligence to do barely anything meaningful and be too half baked to do anything with my data). I was unsure of myself because in most every instance these sounded better and more pleasant than anything else I have using higher resolution codecs (of which I have several THOUSAND dollars worth of wireless earbuds, yes it is a problem thank you for your concern, admitting is the first step.) Listening on an iOS device obviously sounded slightly better. Apple can produce more accurate bass on a pair of earbuds that don't seal using an AAC codec than Sony can on their flagship earbuds with their own LDAC codec. Mind you, Sony is incompetent and can't make a good audio product anymore even at 3x the price so that comparison might not have been fair. Yet it doesn't stop there, the more offerings you compare it to the sadder it gets. Companies have gotten lazy, bass takes a lot of power to drive so instead of optimizing the driver and power efficiency, bass algorithms are pushed instead to give the "feel" of more bass, but never an accurate representation of what bass sounds like, they're often terrible and distort the bass as a result leaving you with something that sounds and feels different. This left me puzzled, airpods are often critized for their lack of bass, yet these hum beautifully and more importantly, true to wired for a pair that again doesn't seal your ears. I've come to realize the deaf and those hard of hearing can post comments on the internet and they are also those that would look at a pair of skull candy crusher evo's and think "did they make these for me?" I am glad for once with Apples policy of not listening to people and continually just doing what they want because they have something killer here that should not be tainted by the unwashed masses incorrect opinion. Mids and treble? Airy but forward and clear with a little sparkle, a man cannot ask for more, because again these things don't actually seal your ears so they in turn sound more open, that's the point. "Thou shalt not sacrifice accuracy for feel and gimmicks sayeth Lord Tim. Thou shant EQ or really have any features either, taketh or leaveth." I taketh Tim, I taketh!!!

author: Lola’s Mom
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsComfy, durable, and sound really good too
body: If you need a headset that cancels a good amount of noise but can’t use the pods because they just won’t stay in your ears, then this is the headset for you. Even if you can use the pods, but you’re in need of a new pair, this headset is a great option. I was concerned about the quality, given the low price. But I’ve been using them for almost 8 months, almost on a daily basis, and they’re still working great. I like that I can be active and not worry about them falling out. I work from home, and these do a great job cancelling out the day to day noise distractions. The pod itself fits quite comfortably in my ear. They came with several different size covers to make for a more customized fit. The piece that goes around the back of the ear is comfortable. I can wear these for several hours without any discomfort. The sound quality is surprisingly good, given the low price point. The case is no bigger than other pod cases, it’s just a different shape. I do like the window on the case that lets you know how much charge the earphones have. The only issue I have is a very minor issue, not worth losing a star for. I wish that the R and L markings were a little easier to see.  If you’re putting in the pods right from the case, it’s not a problem, but if you’re like me and you’re working, and you throw the pods on the table, or when  you put them in your bag without the case, when it comes time to use them again, it’s a little difficult to identify, which is right in which is left. Again not a huge deal and it’s a great possibility you might not have an issue. I just felt like they could’ve been marked a little better. But overall, he’s a great pair of earbuds. They connected easily to the Bluetooth on my phone and my laptop, noise reduction is very good and sound quality is very good too. I am terrible when it comes to losing and breaking earbuds so the fact that I’ve been able to hold onto this pair for seven months is a small miracle. These pods are holding up to the torture that I put them through, while sounding quite good. I am Pleasantly surprised and very happy that I purchased these

I have put these earbuds to the test by showering with them in! And accidentally dropped one and road it over with my bicycle and no harm!!! They were accidentally left in my pants pocket and endured the washer and dryer!! The earbuds last forever on a charge, are so comfortable to wear, while never slipping off my sweaty soaked ears.  They magnetize in the case so they’ll never fall out.  I recommend these earbuds to anyone who is looking for long battery life, extreme durability and waterproof

author: Noni
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsCase Battery Drains After 8 Months of Use
body: I loved these earbuds because unlike the more expensive brands I've purchased, they actually keep a charge for the 8 hours it says it will. The sound quality is good, and the wrap around ear piece is helpful.  The issue is that after 8 months of ownership, the case battery can't keep a charge. Where it used to charge in 15% to 20% intervals, it now drains completely when charging my earbuds. The sad part is, it will use 100% battery to charge them, but the buds themselves will be at only 60%. This is a bit disappointing. I had purchased another pair in a different color before this happened in hopes that I could alternate between the two and never be without earbuds. Now, I'm not so sure.

body: When I received these I set them up on my phone. Used them that one time.  I broke my foot so I was not able to walk or ride my bike so they were not used till now.  They don't work.  They will not sync to my bluetooth.  They are charged 100% but when I plug them in to charge it looks like the earbuds are not charging.  Very unhappy I wasted my money on these that basically have never worked and its too late to return them.  I have ear buds I have used for  years and work fine.  I just wanted something with the ear clip so I don't loose them walking or riding my bike.  One star is too much for this product

For the price, I'm happy with the performance and features. Good value for those on a budget! Usually goes on sale battery life is also really good!

author: Reporter
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsThese will get you buy, until you get a premium set
body: For $99 bucks, you can not go wrong with them. Comfort is so so and over time will hurt your ears in all sorts of ways. The noice canceling will eventually fail and now does not work at all. Why did I give it 4 stars? Because they are 4 years old now and still carry a very long charge time and I've dropped them at least a hundred times on the hard floor. The functionality of the headset listening to music is mediocre, but if you like listening to the news or podcasts you'll enjoy them for many years I hope. I still talk to family over the phone with them and I have asked more than a few times if they can hear me ok, and the reply is always positive.

author: Ava
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThey are worth it
body: These are great, as soon as you turn them on it cancels out noise around you. The app has a great equalizer that you can customize. I've used these for days and the lowest it's has gotten to is like 60 or 70 percent battery. The headphones jack is great also for PC's that Bluetooth doesn't work on, you can just plug these in and turn them on and your equalizer settings turn on. If you turn them up loud enough you can feel the vibrations, which I like,  but that's a little too loud. The sound bleed isn't really bad, you can listen to your music comfortably and others will just be able to hear the beat and some bass. These also charge really quick, the pink is a little more of a purple though.

author: unhappy customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsSomething is very rotten at Sony's headphones business
body: This is the 2nd pair of sony headphones I've had and quite possibly might be the last unless they acknowledge and fix the reliability and durability issues with them all three pairs have had mechanical issues and I only handle and use them as gently as one can, this pair of the lower cost  WH-CH720N version of their noise cancelling headphones already have bits of the plastic cracking / breaking at the weakest point and I've only had these since January! WHAT is going on Sony?? Does this company realize selling products that break quickly, with rapid planned obsolescence is tantamount to simple theft? the other headphones that also mechanically broke after only owning for a little over a year were the WH-1000XM4 version cannot recommend these until sony 1. acknowledges the issues 2. fixes them

author: Patience
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Performance and Sound.
body: I purchased the WH-CH720N Noise Canceling Wireless Headphones Bluetooth Over The Ear Headset with Microphone (with Alexa built-in) approximately one month ago.  As such, I have had a decent amount of time to use it and develop an informed opinion on them.  I have been pleasantly surprised that it performs precisely as it boasts; clear, crisp sound with effective noise canceling.  I used it to listen to music, make phone calls, and perhaps uniquely-to plug into my electric drum set while practicing.  For all of these uses it performs very well, and has the added advantage of being easy to use. I bought these during the “Amazon Prime Days”, so I enjoyed the further benefit of a great deal.  In sum, these headphones were a good, economical purchase which has delivered the sound and utility I was hoping for.  I would recommend them to anyone searching for good, fairly inexpensive and highly functional headphones.

author: A
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsArrived brand new with scratches. Cheaply made.
body: These are really cheaply made. Cheap as in, arrived already scratched in a few places brand new out of the box without a single wear. The plastic feels thin and the pleather that covers the headband and pads is not very substantial. If the box scratches them and the overall unit feels this flimsy, I’m not confident it will hold up to even light use.

author: J. E. H.
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsVery Meh; Underwhelming; Overpriced
body: The video showcases the product in use. The video guides you through product setup. The video compares multiple products. The video shows the product being unpacked. Video Player is loading. Click to play video Play Mute Current Time 0:00 / Duration 0:41 Loaded : 14.65% 0:00 Stream Type LIVE Seek to live, currently behind live LIVE Remaining Time - 0:41 1x Playback Rate Chapters Chapters Descriptions descriptions off , selected Captions captions off , selected English (Automated) Audio Track default , selected Fullscreen This is a modal window. I got these to replace my Anker Soundcore over-the-ear headphones -- as you can see, the Souncore ones falling a part after a couple of years. But these Sony WH-CH720N headphones aren't the same quality. I paid for the brand name, thinking the sound quality, style, and design would be an upgrade. They are not. I'm not sure if these are considered lower-tier headphones for Sony, but I'm not satisfied with a more-than-$100 price tag for these compared to my existing headphones that cost way less. The sound quality is subpar with little bass. I like bass. These are very lightweight in size and apparently quality. They feel cheap. They're easy to use. The Bluetooth feature worked easily enough and connected to my devices. I didn't test the mic because I knew immediately these were not the headphones for me. Money NOT well spent. Nothing special about these headphones. I can't recommend. I'm disappointed in these headphones. Very meh. Underwhelming. Overpriced.

title: 2.0 out of 5 starsDecent Headphones, Far From Worth the Cost
body: Average sound quality and performance. The battery life is great so that’s a huge plus. I have three big issues with the product that knock it down from a 5 to a 2. First is the flimsiness of the product, as they fall off nearly every time I wear them laying down. Next, the noise canceling function goes in and out constantly and very frustratingly. Finally the mic aspect while using the headphones to speak on the phone are far below average. Overall, not worth the money

author: Stacey
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNot as great as you’d think
body: The Sony WH-CH720N headphones were a disappointment, especially considering the brand’s reputation. The sound quality is noticeably underwhelming—flat, lacking depth, and with very little clarity in the highs or punch in the bass. Even more frustrating is the volume limitation; they simply don’t get loud enough, even when paired with devices at full volume. For anyone who enjoys immersive audio or listens in noisier environments, these headphones fall short. While the noise canceling is decent and the design is lightweight and comfortable, those positives are overshadowed by the weak audio performance. At this price point, I expected much better from Sony.

author: Danny C.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThese Headphones Are My New ‘I Can’t Hear You’ Button
body: Okay, let me tell you something: I’ve owned headphones before, but none have made me feel like I’m living in the future quite like these Sony WH-CH720N’s. I threw them on, hit play, and suddenly the world went quiet—like really quiet. I’m talking about that kind of peace where you wonder if someone switched your life to airplane mode. It’s like they have a built-in “peace and quiet” button, and honestly, I didn’t know how much I needed it until I tried them. The sound quality? Chef’s kiss. I’m no audiophile, but when I say these things make your music feel like it’s floating around you, I mean it. I don’t know what kind of sorcery is going on inside these headphones, but the bass hits just right, the mids are crisp, and everything feels balanced. It’s like listening to your favorite tunes for the first time again. If I could marry a pair of headphones, this would be my soulmate. And let’s talk about that noise-canceling feature. I’ve tried noise-canceling before, but this? This is the real deal. The outside world? Gone. It’s like putting on a cozy, soundproof blanket around your ears. I could be in the middle of a crowded coffee shop, and it’d be just me and my playlist. It’s so good, I found myself laughing at how much I didn’t know about the noise around me until it vanished. Comfort-wise, I’m impressed. I’ve worn these for hours without feeling like I’m wearing a vice on my head. The ear cups are soft enough that it feels like they’re hugging my ears, but not too tight to give me a headache. Plus, the adjustable headband means they actually stay on my head without making me look like a bobblehead. Huge win. Battery life? Out of this world. I’m talking 35 hours of playtime, which means I can listen to music all day, every day, without having to charge them like I do with my other devices. This is exactly what I need when I’m on a long road trip or just getting lost in my favorite playlist. In short, if you’re looking for headphones that’ll make you forget the world exists (in the best way), these Sony headphones are the real deal. Comfort, sound, and noise-canceling? They’ve got it all. Seriously, you’ll wonder how you ever lived without them.

author: susanp
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsGood functionality, but not a flattering fit
body: OK. these were good headphones. all around decent noise cancelling and sound for the price, although i wish the bass was a little clearer. also beware these are not completely noise cancelling, as i could still hear around me sometimes. My reason for 3 stars though, is the fit. Maybe Im not picky but the way these sit on the head is NOT cute. i wanted a sleek, cute headphone set for the gym and work, but becuase the band comes out from the outside of the ear muffs, they go out weirdly and make your head look funny. Ended up switching these out for the WXM4s. However, if you are looking for a pair of cheap headphones that are very functional, and care less about aesthetic, these are a great option.

author: Reese Bryans
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe price, the quality >>
body: So I have been wanting headphones for a long time but I dont have the ability to drop 300 or more on the best recommendation. So I saw these were on sale for Prime day and purchased them. I am not an audio guru but I LOVE these headphones. They have long battery life, are lightweight, easy to use, and perfect for what I need them for. The noise cancelling component is great for when I am locking in on my studies and I like that you can turn on ambient sound to kinda hear whats going on around you.  Bluetooth is easy to connect. My favorite part of these might be the sony app. It allows you to configure your music based on what you like. So basically you can turn the base up or down based on your preferences. The size and functionality are perfect. I can't speak to their durability yet but after a semester in my backpack I will update. But as of now highly recommend!

body: These feel nice and do an ok job with sound and noice cancellation. However, they broke 8 months in where the headband meets the earmuff. I’m careful and take good care of my things. For this to happen less than a year after purchasing it’s definitely a quality issue. Thankfully I still have my old pair that these were supposed to be replacing for the time being. I use these for meditation and remote sessions with clients. My advice is find headphones with a nice wide attachment point for where the headband meets the earmuff.

author: Ruthless Reviews
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsIt’s pretty good, but….
body: So, I own a whole bunch of headphones, and I must say. These are great, but not at the level I thought they would be. The sound quality on these are pretty good but a bit muffled. It took some getting used to and some tweaks but I’m adjusting. I own a pair of Bose Quietcomfort 35’s that I’ve had for many years (and many ear pad replacements) and I can definitely tell the sound quality on those are more balanced. Another thing is, the build quality. It’s really light, which I enjoy but, it feels cheap and it does not fold. The connectivity is awesome, you can connect up to two devices at once but you will have to tinker a little bit in order the app to enable that option. Battery life is great and lasts a really long time so, kudos to Sony for that. The ANC is good but not the best. I don’t see these being able to block out plane noise. Overall a good product, but is it worth the price? Eh, not really.

author: Ashley Rheiner
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHeadphone snob who isn’t disappointed
body: Bought these before I realized there was a good amount of disappointed buyers, so I was ready to absolutely regret my life choices. Let me just say that so far I’m pleasantly surprised. My ears are on the small side and fit in the openings of the ear covers so the cushioning doesn’t push down like I saw many people saying happened. I will update if that turns out different over time. It charges very fast and the battery hasn’t moved despite my turning it on and off several times. My AirPod pros 2 aren’t even that good on battery life. Again I’ll update if that changes. I didn’t notice a terrible quality of sound even without the app. I did change it around in app and found everything easy- from the color being the beautiful light gray being when pictured, to the speed it connects with my phone when it turns on. It doesn’t sound tinny or overly sharp or low. I know what I want in a headphone and I’m not disappointed. There was a lot of people saying they had lag when watching YouTube- not a problem for me. The noise cancellation is on par with my AirPod pros 2. Doesn’t totally drown out every little sound but it’s enough to keep my being overwhelmed by noise when doing school work (I have adhd). All around I’m happy with the quality, color, sound, fit, just everything. And trust me when I say I’m picky af with headphones. I wish they folded and had a case but that isn’t a deal breaker for me at all. If I don’t update, I wasn’t proven wrong over time.

author: belowi
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent earbuds and a great value
body: Purchased these to replace older P3i earbuds that had started to have volume issues after a few years (stuck driver?).  For the money you are getting a great set of noise cancelling earbuds with these P30i’s. These are a slightly different form factor than the older ones but are approximately the same overall size.  Instead of physical buttons these respond to taps to change volume, skip tracks or change noise cancellation mode and this function works quite well and intuitively. The case is a little bigger than the P3i or Airpod cases but is really easy to use with the buds magnetically snapping into the case to charge. The sound quality is very good and I have used the various noise cancellation modes with good results.  In both cases these outperform the P3i. Active noise cancellation in airports and planes (or when someone has the TV on in the house and you need to focus) is quite effective at reducing or canceling almost all external sound, while transparent mode when walking on streets gives you awareness of your surroundings.  Connection with my iphone is consistent and stable. There are several different modes of active noise cancellation you can tweak to try to get the best results for your environment using the app on your phone as well as customizing the actions for the taps on the earbuds. So far both the earbuds and case have survived accidental falls and drops without any problems. Like all in ear buds how tightly pushed in the are has a big impact on how effective the noise cancellation works.

author: D. Hansberry
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsDecent Enough, But Not the Best at this Price Point
body: Let me just start off by saying that they are well worth the $30 I paid for them on sale. Full price of $80 I would give it 3 stars. The sound quality is pretty decent if you're listening in a quiet space. Noise cancellation is not great though for loud noises and makes it even sharper if it's on. I work in a factory making signs and it is good enough most of the time, but when it doesn't, it's even worse than without, also it's pretty bad in wind even just a light breeze.  I don't notice any adapting to environment going on.  Active aware works well enough, but again, not with things like wind. It is a bit weak and on the quiet side for being fully pass though. The battery last a good while, I use them about 6 hours a day and it lasts me about a week on a charge. That said, there is no real way to know how much charge is left in the case without guessing based on when you last charged it. It just has a single light that turns on during charging and when you put the earbuds back in the case. The touch buttons work well, and never have failed to respond, unfortunately you cannot use them to adjust volume. The bluetooth is not the best, seems weaker than other earbuds I've had in the same price range, good enough as long as you're in the same room as your transmitter, but once you leave even just to the other side of a wall it gets pretty spotty. The build quality of the earbuds themselves seems great, I've dropped them numerous times and they still work good as new, and fit quite well, I like their small size. Overall I think their well worth the discounted price, and had I paid the higher price I would not have returned them, but I would likely end up (and still will) with a different brand around the same price point. They are still plenty good for chill music time in a less noisy place though, and I'll keep them around.

author: Todd S.
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsBelow average earbuds
body: After owning this for several months and trying different brand of earbuds at different price ranges, I have to say these are not horrible at THIS price range. However, you do get what you pay for. The good: They work, charge fast, and have a decent battery capacity. The bad: sound quality is mediocre. There is no way to change call controls, only media/music controls. The low battery notification seems to be buggy and will give the sound notification that the earbuds have died while it will still have decent battery life. The sound quality is below average. The transparency mode on these are horrible, when you have tried better quality ear buds you almost feel like you aren't wearing anything, but with these earbuds it's like you are trying to hear outside sound through a muffled pillow. This is important when I'm on a call with someone and also need to hear sounds around me when I'm out. So in conclusion, these work, aren't horrible for the money, but for overall quality compared to other ear buds, they're pretty low ranked.

author: Kyle
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsGreat isolation, ok sound quality, too much lag
body: I bought these on sale for about 25 bucks, and for that price, they mostly get the job done! They come with 3 different ear pieces, so it’s easy to get a good seal and block out surrounding noise. I find that I rarely use the noise-canceling feature, though it’s helpful sometimes if I’m sitting in the office and want just a bit of extra quiet. The sound quality is pretty lacking. Though I guess it’s fitting for a set of cheap ear buds. The midrange actually sound a bit distorted, and the only thing that seems to help is using a custom EQ with 3-4dB of cuts in the 1K-4K range. Another issue is the lag between my MacBook Pro (2019) and the headphones. My old AirPods have near zero lag, but these are noticeably behind, meaning that I can’t use them to edit audio/video, which I was hoping to do with them.  None of the recommended tips and tricks from the manufacturer work, so it is what it is. I’ve used these while walking/exercising, and they’re good for those uses, as they seal well and most probably won’t have the same issue with sound quality that I have. These do have a place in my bag, but I can’t quite use them for everything I’d like.

Just make sure to download the Soundcore app, since you can make these sound way better with some EQ tweaking, and by updating them. Also make sure to enable the '3d surround sound' option, it makes a world of difference. I'd say its a no-brainer, they're so cheap, just go ahead and buy them, the price to performance ratio is insane, I have no complains about these earbuds.

author: Brandi
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsmediocre at best (yawn)
body: soooo when i listen to videos on social media, it sounds like im in an echo chamber 70% of the time, NOT for medium-small ears (at least the area that holds an earbud) makes my ears ache after an hour. they can only be turned on and off with the case (which is kindaaaaa a plus since its forced me to keep up with the case/buds) but,,,, water resistant? good LUCK using these even if youre sweating. one single degree of heat or moisture will make the earbuds think youre tapping them, and pause or skip your song. battery life is mid, ive had better for less for sure (and i think i only paid like 25$ for these, ive gotten better battery life for 10 dollars at 5 below) (BUT they charge quickly from the case) pretty loud but could be louder for sure, uhhhhhh what else.... oh theres no way to grab and adjust them back into your ear unless you wanna skip your song. the range of connectivity is far less than other earbuds ive had (once again, for cheaper) the ONLY upside to these is the audio crispness. its pretty crisp. good for asmr. not good for music, social media, calls (i think the app has hijacked my mic, even while my earbuds arent connected, and now people can only hear me clearly from my phone's mic sometimes) just,,,,,,,,,, if you're reading this, you can do better babe. it isnt a deal, it isnt worth the sale price.

author: Pranav
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsMy review of P30i
body: Battery life is not good, but the voice cancellation is superb. The fit is not good either, keeps falling out of my ears. The buttons and functionality are okay, just that when you're on a call and try voice cancellation by holding the bus for two seconds you get cut from the call. Connectivity wasn't an issue at all. Great value for money product, overall a good buy.

author: Lisa Colt
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPeaceful Silence
body: OMG These are perfect. I’m autistic and highly sensitive the sound and vibrations. Living with loud-ish roommates physically hurts my body. I put these in and I no longer hear TV through the wall. I no longer your conversations and other rooms. I don’t even have to play music/audio through them, the noise cancellation makes everything quiet. And I don’t hear my heartbeat on my breathing. These are better than the industrial earplugs I’ve been wearing. These are better than the noise canceling firing range, electronic earmuffs I’ve been wearing. I wish I had found these sooner. My soul feels at peace.

title: 4.0 out of 5 starsVery nice earbuds for the price
body: I have used Bose's $300 over-ear headphones for more than 4 years, so I am an audiophile. The Bose over-ear headphones I have are of superior quality and build across the board, but these are marketed towards a different segment. I'll list the PROs and CONs like other users. PROS: Very nice sound and bass. User friendly and does not need any adjustments. Set up is very intuitive Noise Cancellation is ok, but I wasn't expecting much for $30 Connects easily and does the job to keep me focused during work CONS: I haven't been able to make the MIC work yet using my work laptop, so that part needs tweaking The earbuds are sensitive to taps, so you might hear unwanted sounds just by touching them For $30, it's a steal and I didn't expect it to be this good.

author: Obtaining Bliss
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat Sound Quality Buds for the Price
body: These little buds are fabulous as noise cancelation as well as a mode that still allows you to hear others around you and reduce wind noise at the same time. The functionality of these is great and you can personalize how you want the buds to work. Fit is really good - I have small ears and these fit great. I do still find if I wear them for a long time my ears get sore - but I haven't found a set of earbuds that doesn't do this in some capacity with my small ears, but these are the least fatiguing. Charge holds pretty good, but I do find that I need to re-charge them within an 8 hour period. Also the connectivity is a bit wonky at times. I can connect to two devices, but sometimes it won't work on my phone if connected to my computer and sound is first heard through the headphones from my computer it won't play sound from my phone. These also don't seem to connect quite right when I get a phone call - so that is why I reduced my rating from 5-star to 4-star.

They last longer than I need them to on a single charge due to their good battery life. They  are noise cancelling which allow me to focus on what I’m listening to and not what’s going on around me.

author: M.Maxwell
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing Company, Amazing Product...
body: I purchased a second pair of these Magic Ear Buds from this company a few years ago, or rather my son did. I loved them so much I wanted an identical pair. So I ordered them, when they went on sale for $15!  I received them, paired them but  the volume seemed different. I emailed the Company and ask for trouble shooting ideas. They emailed me back within 10 hours. I was so impressed with this. They gave me ideas I tried each and then waited to see if my ears needed to adjust.  The design is stellar. They are comfortable beyond measure. They fit in and around my ear perfectly. They are lightweight, easy to use and awesome value for your money. Moving forward I responded to their email about the trouble shooting not making much of a difference in the volume. Now, I need you to know that I can hear out of them, it's just different. They emailed me  again within 10 hours, apologizing and asking me if I would like a full refund, or a second option of them sending me a new pair free of charge. I of course asked if I could get a replacement, and  asked them how to return the pair I have now back to them.  The Company responded that you don't have to return them at all!  They also informed me, that they had already mailed me a new pair, and to let them know how the new pair works out. I gotta say I'm so impressed with this company for standing behind their product, customer service and another human being caring about my experience is invaluable. I will always buy my ear buds from them. Oh and BTW, I have 2 pairs of brand new Apple Air that I hate! These blow them out of the water. The Apple Air can sit in the drawer. Thank you so much for reading this. I will update on the new pair. Also, don't be so quick to anger when things don't work for whatever reason. Try to work with these business and contact them to see if they can resolve the issue before reviewing products. We are all human and to be human is to err.... UPDATE: I received the replacement pair yesterday and they were perfect!  I emailed the company last night to let them know that everything was great. I woke up this morning to an email thanking me for my patience and kindness? It was the company and that customer representative , who was kind, patient and attentive. If you are thinking about these ear buds, rest assure this company stands behind their product and will have your back until you the customer is satisfied. 10 Stars all the way....

author: S. M.
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsOn/off switch seems defective and Bass deficient
body: I previously had a set of wireless earphones made by Mpow that looked almost identical to these, and I used them for six years. I really liked them. When the ear hook finally broke, I started looking for a similar replacement—specifically with ear hooks and a wire connecting both earpieces. That’s why I chose these Boean headphones, but unfortunately, I’ve run into a few issues. First, turning them on and off is surprisingly difficult. I have to press the button very hard to get it to respond and I’m concerned that repeated use might wear out or damage the switch over time. Another odd thing: the headphones turned on by themselves even after I shut them off. (which could drain the battery unnecessarily) As for the sound quality, the bass is almost nonexistent. What little bass there is sounds distorted, even at low to medium volume levels. But I did notice other reviews mentioning weak or distorted bass, so I am not the only one .experiencing this. Overall, I’m disappointed. I’m not sure if I received a defective pair or if this is just how they’re made.

I do a lot of long distance runs (half marathon prep & runs) and sweat a lot and these are the only headphones that just keep working.  All others have had one earpiece, or both, stop working. Overall, they are what I wanted: inexpensive, they worked well, and they don't try to engage Siri or pause when accidentally brush them. Goodbye power beats pro, there's a new set of headphones in town.

author: Amanda
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat headphones for working out.
body: Great headphones for working out. They are solid secure fit, with easy to manage controls. It comes with a convenient case and clip for travel, and a spare set of ear tips. The charge cord is short but it's standard USB-C so any compatible cord will do. The connecting wire between the two earbuds is a decent length, and while I don't find it annoying on my neck, I can easily tuck it into my ponytail or bun hair tie. I've done fairly rigorous workouts with these and have had no problems with them coming out at all - but you do need to ensure you fit them snugly in the ear. For the price, these are solid quality and the sound is good, blocking out most other sound nicely. It connects easily and seamlessly with my iphone and there's been no issues maintaining connection. I haven't worn out the charge yet, it seems to last a decent amount of time. For a cheap pair of earbuds, these are totally worth the price.

author: Haylee Miller
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGlynzak Wireless Headphones – Stylish, Comfortable, and Great Sound for the Price
body: I’ve been using these Glynzak wireless headphones for a while now, and overall, I’m genuinely impressed with how much they deliver for such an affordable pair. Design & Comfort: First off, the rose gold and white design is sleek and modern—definitely one of the more stylish options out there without breaking the bank. The ear cushions are super soft and comfortable even after a couple hours of wear. The headband has a nice amount of padding too, which adds to the comfort. Sound Quality: For casual listening, the sound quality is surprisingly good. It has a clean, balanced sound with decent bass, especially for music and podcasts. Don’t expect audiophile-level detail, but for day-to-day use—YouTube, Zoom calls, Spotify, etc.—it does more than enough. Volume gets plenty loud without distortion. Bluetooth & Battery: Pairing is quick and easy, and the Bluetooth connection stays stable. Battery life has been solid—I can get through multiple days of use on a single charge, depending on how long I’m using them each day. Charging is also fast, which is convenient when you’re in a rush. Extras & Features: It also has built-in controls on the ear, which are responsive and convenient for skipping tracks, adjusting volume, or answering calls. The microphone is decent enough for calls, though nothing fancy. Final Thoughts: If you’re looking for a budget-friendly pair of wireless headphones that are comfortable, cute, and reliable, these Glynzak headphones are a great buy. Perfect for students, casual users, or anyone who wants a stylish pair without spending a fortune.

The device and the 🎧 are fully charged but it keeps doing the disconnecting and reconnecting and the item will continue playing. As for the 🎧 the ear cushions fit great and are still intact. It's been a bit of time so maybe they just need to be replaced but connecting and reconnecting has been going on for over a year at most (had these for 2 years). They have become my backup 🎧 if I absolutely need something but it's very disappointing. Volume was decent and buttons were easy to use though.

author: Donnie
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsbest headphones i've owned
body: These headphones have lasted me longer than any other pair I've owned. I've had them for about two-three years now, and they still work just as great now as they did out of the box. The battery can last upwards of three days when kept on all day *and* all night, and the sound quality is amazing. They're incredibly comfortable, and extremely durable. The worst problem I've had is a slight crack in the plastic of the band- but the headphones have held great despite it- and I didn't even notice the crack for some time. They charge super fast, up to full within around 45 minutes- and I've only experienced slight connectivity issues (Though, I am almost certain this is my computer, and not the headphones!) 100% worth the purchase, would probably buy fifty more- if these ones ever even break!

author: Caitlin G
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCute, durable, and long battery life
body: I am so happy with this purchase, I had to post a review. I've had them for a few months now after throwing in the towel on my expensive Beats ear pods that just wouldn't stay in my ears. These were affordable, had decent reviews, and I love a rose gold situation. Let me tell you, these babies hold a charge for a LONG time. The last time I charged them was 2 weeks ago, and I use them at least 10 hours per week. They also cancel out quite a bit of noise. I can barely hear anything external when I'm using them, and even if there's no sound coming out, I have to take them off to hear what people are saying. My 6 y.o. kid uses them sometimes and there were a few times I thought he was going to snap them in half, but alas, they are going strong. So they're clearly quite durable. Lastly, I love that they can connect to two devices at once, so I can hear my phone or laptop without switching connections.

author: Jaimell Torres Gonzalez
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNo compre estos audífonos. No sirven
body: No entiendo de donde y cual es la razón de tantas opiniones. Este dispositivo no sirve. Es una porquería. Llevo una semana usándolo y verdaderamente lo voy a devolver. Verdad que lo barato sale caro. Empezando que al momento de emparejarlo con tu IPhone, por ejemplo, se conecta. Al recibir una llamada, se desconecta, se vuelve a conectar, se vuelve a desconectar, se vuelve a conectar. Y así hasta que tienes que colgar la llamada. Es un chiste. Continuando por la batería. Necesitas 2 horas para cargarlos. Imagínese que soy truck driver y siempre hablo por teléfono, estar por 2 horas con el teléfono en la mano hablando y manejando al mismo tiempo. No funciona. Los AirPods solamente con 30min cargan al 100%. Continuando que se escuchan muy bajito. Un poco más y para poder escuchar bien a otras personas en una llamada me lo meto en los oídos para adentro. Increíble. Para mí, personalmente no sirven. Vale más la pena gastar en unos AirPods y problema resuelto. Créanme. No lo compren. No lo recomiendo.

I pulled it out of the case, and the lights were already flashing like it was ready to pair. I turned the phone's Bluetooth on, and it was listed under available devices. Great value!

title: 3.0 out of 5 starsVolume and battery life not up to par
body: Purchase because of the good reviews. Nice packaging seems to be a great product 100% charged right out of the box. Description claims 72-hour talking time. Used it for 30 minutes battery life down to 75%. Going to give it a shot but I'll be surprised if it lasts more than a few hours. Before this I had a cheaper version G3 Not as flashy. volume is definitely not as loud on music and in calls. If you're in a quiet room it's not bad but if you're driving with some background noise it's not super loud. Maybe I am half-death from all of the loud music I listen to.

Also, it needs to not hurt my ears after an extended period.  I thought I'd never find one that met all those criteria, but then I found this headset, and it's changed my life! Buy this - you won't be disappointed!

author: Dan Peck
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsPeople say they cannot hear me well when using these!
body: I've wasted so much money in the search for a good hands-free headphone; seems impossible to find one.  I'm adding this to the list of yet another fail because people cannot hear me well when I use this (kinduv a major point of the device!).  In contrast, if I switch back to holding the phone, they hear me loud and clear.  The buttons are a little finnicky to use.  But, its little charging case and foldup design is neat and it is somewhat comfortable to use for an average call length of time, and power lasts a reasonable amount of time even when on standby.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat headset for the Trucking industry
body: I love this headset, it's very light weight and comfortable for all day wear. I drive truck for a living and the battery lasts all day and then some, the sound quality is great and the noise canceling works well. I have no issues with this headset and would recommend it to anyone. It sure beats using the bluepariot headset that's big and bulky/heavy.

author: Emojuju
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery nice!
body: After going through 5 - 6 different headsets, I've found the one that finally works!  Others can hear me clearly on this.  They say it is NOT muffled when I talk.  I ahd to make sure of this.  They also told me that it's very clear.  Glad I bought this at the last minute during prime day sale. It doesn't hurt my ear either. The last one I had, the part that goes behind the ear was very thick whiched messed with my piercing. This one is very thin behind the ear that I barely even notice it. I also have small ears which is annoying when it comes to the earpiece that goes in your ear.  The smallest earpiece works for me and I've had no issues so far today while using it.  Glad they give you the extra sizes.  I would highly recommend this if it's what your looking for.  Took me a while to finally find a great headset for work. The plus side is that you can use it for both your laptop and phone! You can also adjust to use on left or the right ear.

author: Grace Cook
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsLow Quality
body: This Bluetooth headset delivers clear, reliable audio and effortless connectivity for both calls and music. With lightweight, ergonomic ear cups and adjustable headband, it's comfortable for long wear and stays put during daily routines or workouts. The noise-cancelling microphone ensures crisp voice quality, while intuitive button controls let you manage volume, mute, or answer calls without fumbling for your phone. Battery life is impressive—typically lasting 8–12 hours on a single charge—making it dependable across busy workdays or travel. Sleek and modern in design, it’s a smart pick for professionals, commuters, and anyone seeking a fuss‑free wireless headset experience.

Cons: The left earbud on this headset by Boean produces a consistent, low volume, high pitch, buzzing sound that can be heard between music tracks, beneath podcast voices, and when no audio is playing. I returned the product and received a replacement, but the second headset had the same problem. Many brands make this style of headphones, so I will be trying a different manufacturer.
