author: Jennifer Oquinn
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWell worth the money!
body: I have been using these same headphones for running for years.  I don’t like the pod style headphone so the over the ear part is good for me.  The wire makes them easy to find in my gym bag or car.  Since the price is so reasonable, I have multiple!  I did have one pair that stopped charging after about year, but I’ve had the other pair for 3-4 years and they are working great so of course I replaced the broken ones with the same and have had no problems! My kids keep trying to talk me into “better” headphones, but I’m happy to keep using these for my runs!

author: Jay Afragola
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat customer service, solid product
body: I prefer these headphones to the in-ear only ones as they stay on my head better and I feel much more confident that I won't lose them.  I had an issue with the pair I purchased after owning them for about a year. The headphones would power down completely every so often. It happened irregularly and did not have any connection to the amount the headphones were charged.  I wrote to the company asking for help and I was treated with a free replacement pair the next day. I would buy them again.

author: Leigh Morton
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Value For My Usage
body: These are really great Bluetooth earbuds! I originally ordered these 27 months ago and they have held up great, until today sadly. They were at 100% battery and kept disconnecting and reconnecting so I knew their time was up. I was glad to see that they were still an option to buy because they are exactly what I need for my personal use, so I ordered another pair. I don't use them a ton, but when I do use them it's for days that I'm treadmill walking, or on my half hour work breaks when I'm eating alone. I'll also wear them at home occasionally when my family is around and I don't want to disturb them with what I'm listening to. They did make it through the warranty, though, even with my sort of lighter than average usage, so I'm happy about the value. I definitely want to continue to come back to this style and brand in the future so I hope they will continue to be produced!

The company also does not reply when I have reached out to share my issues with them.

author: Samy Sadek
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsworks very well for the price- backed by very responsive manufacturers
body: for the 20 dollar price tag these are totally fine. Audio is clear, and the bluetooth connection is strong.  I use these for phone calls too and my family seems to hear me more clearly on these earphones than my 100 dollar sony headphones. work fine for the gym. I recently tried to use these in the shower, what i have learned with these is not to get them direclty in the shower spray,  i.e. when wearing them to keep my head out from under the showerhead  and then taking them off when it is time to watch my hair. this generally works well.  I did have an issue where the volume buttons stopped working after one of my showers, i emailed the company and they issued me replacement earphones immediately with no fuss. Very easy company to work with and very responsive- then they emailed me to check how my replacement earphones were going.

author: NCDad
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsVery Good Headphones Just Not For My Personal Day to Day Work Environment
body: PROs:  Bluetooth headphones work well.  Well priced.  They have good sound quality.  Several interchangeable ear bud covers for individual ear comfort.  The controls are easy to feel.  The headphones charge quickly. CONs:  However, as one who works outside nearly all day, I found the cord to be cumbersome to deal with throughout the day.  The seatbelt will press against cord, making it taught, and pulls ear piece out when turning head to look over either shoulder.  Also, when carrying items with sling type attachment, the ear piece can get knocked out as sling goes up and over.  Also, if one side is not in my ear, the dangling earpiece will get caught up in my clothing, again creating tension on the cord, when in turns pulls on the earpiece in my ear. Also, the included charging cable is extremely short, less than ~4IN.  It's not long enough for anything useful in my opinion. NOTE:  Headphones were not used in an athletic environment.  Cannot comment on how these headphones will work for someone running or working out in a gym.

author: Liz
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBuena compra
body: He estado usando los auriculares Bluetooth inalámbricos Boean durante unos meses y hasta ahora todo ha ido muy bien. La conexión Bluetooth 5.3 es estable y la calidad del sonido es excelente. Además, me encanta que puedo saltar y moverme libremente sin que los auriculares se salgan, lo cual es perfecto para correr y hacer ejercicio. La resistencia al agua IPX7 es una gran característica, ya que no tengo que preocuparme por el sudor o la lluvia. La duración de la batería también es impresionante, con hasta 16 horas de tiempo de reproducción. En general, estoy muy satisfecho con estos auriculares y los recomendaría a cualquiera que busque unos auriculares deportivos confiables y de alta calidad.

author: Prasanta
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsFirst one worked - second one didn't
body: I bought this a couple of years ago because I wanted something that wouldn't fall out of my ears when working out and walking. These fit the bill perfectly and they paired well with my older phone (iPhone SE). However, the earplug broke not too long ago (earpiece somehow came off-I think it snagged on something) and so I needed to replace it. I bought it again, but this time, I had a different phone and the headphones didn't pair at all with my phone or my laptop so I am returning this item. It is a decent and inexpensive option if it pairs with your device - but it didn't work for a newer model iPhone.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsReally good value for the price
body: These are my go to cheap headphones. Battery lasts forever, keeps a charge, and can give you a few hrs if you plug them in for as little as like 5 min. Sound isn't anything to write home about, but the quality is good too. Throw them in your backpack, step on them whatever they'll be fine. Mine went through the wash and still work. For 20 bucks you'll get value.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsMissing charger cord
body: My first order was missing the charging cord. Support reached out to me right away and sent a new set. Very happy with their customer service and looking forward to using them!

author: gigabytes
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat sound, and they can be worn with hats and glasses
body: I ordered this pair of wireless headphones because my last pair (that came with my iPhone) kept strangling me and kept getting wrapped around things resulting in them getting PAINFULLY ripped out of my ears. I like that they came charged and ready for use, but it is reccommended by the manufacturer to fully charge them, which takes 2 hours, before the first use.  I tried the rubber earpieces that they came equipped with, the X-large I think, and then decided to switch to the smallest set that came with them, the smaller ones, at least for me, are the most comfortable to use so far. I haven't answered any phonecalls with them yet, so I don't know how easy/hard that will be.  But I did have them in for about an hour while walking my dog and listening to music, and they were very comfortable. I don't like that the included shirtclip, to keep from COMPLETELY losing them, didn't grab the headphone cord secure enough for the clip to stay on, but thankfully I was at home before it popped off. The feel of these is almost non-existant, if the headphone cord hadn't been bouncing against the back of my neck I wouldn't have known that I was wearing them

It sort of sounds like we’re in a tunnel. They’re a little bulky on the sides but it’s nothing I would return over. The sound proofing or reducing is probably my highest complaint as I can hear almost everything going on around me louder than it is without the headphones, even with metal music playing. I didn’t spend a lot on these, but I probably wouldn’t buy again.

author: Jessica
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat for the price!
body: Good for the price. Are they the most incredible headphones ever? No. But they're a great set foe the price! A little bit tinny sounding, but not in an unforgivable way, and overall sound quality is much better than I expected. Great volume, tunes out noise around you pretty well if that's what youre looking for. Controls on the right ear are a nice touch. Tap to pause works well. Range is pretty good. Worth 20 bucks for sure. And the purple color is lovely. Came with an 80% charge which is great bc I hate when ya gotta wait for a charge before you can test the product! I hope they hold up well over time.

author: Jaiissss
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsMeh, alright with loud sound
body: I got these after reading a mix of the positive and negative comments to just check them out for myself. Details follow... *Fit is very comfortable. *Ear pads are very soft. *Design is pretty cool but basic. *Touch is only on the outside of the right side, which is good and bad in my opinion. *Connected easily -booklet explains the process WITH the title to look for to connect to. *Battery seems like it may run down at a regular/reasonable pace, not sure, sorry. *Sound is not mind blowing but they are pretty loud. Downfall is that the sound DOES in fact leak A LOT. *EQ options are only alright. There are only three different EQs and they aren't too different. (This is the reason I may return them- not sure yet, but probable.) *Did not come with case. (Not sure but I think it was supposed to come with one.) *Storage isn't TINY of course, but if you have one side up all the way up and the other pulled down a bit, it seems to close/fold down better. *Booklet opens up quit a bit AND has the instructions in MULTIPLE languages. *Price is a tad too high for the quality.. It all comes down to the point that... they're alright but do some shopping around because I'm SURE there is probably a better pair on here lol Happy Shopping! ***Edit: definitely going back. I did in fact find a better pair with much better sound, ANC, for CHEAPER...  Dropped to 2 stars. **NOTE** ALWAYS READ THE ENTIRE PAGE FOR FURTHER DETAILS!!! Sellers don't use all of the photos or none of them and you'll be missing information that is possibly incorrect compared to the seller description. -THIS GOES FOR EVERYTHING.

Easy to connect with via Bluetooth and the connection distance is pretty far. I'm able to leave my phone on the side of a running track and stay connected to them for the entire distance of the track. They're also very comfortable on my head and don't fall off which is something I was concerned about because I need these for daily gym use. Bonus: they're pretty cute, love the color. That also presents the problem of charging because if they're on continuously that means I'm going to have to be charging them continuously. If not for that I would have given them five stars.

body: Good battery life and amazing sound. The only drawback I had with these headphones is that I only had them for a month and half but the charging port was already broken. I had only charged it once or twice while having it, and kept it under perfect conditions (room temp, away and clean from dust). The charging port somehow became loose and wouldn’t work with any charger (including the one that came with it). It had amazing quality, but it just doesn’t last that long. Personally, I wouldn’t buy this product again. It was fun while I had it, but definitely not sustainable.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAffordable Cute Headphones
body: Was looking for a pair of headphones that weren't too expensive, came in cute colors, good sound, and could drown out the outside noise. This checked all those boxes. It's not active noise cancelling, but noise isolation instead, so it won't have the same effects, but helps with drowning out noise. Size is bearable. I bought a case with it that can hold the aux cord, but otherwise I usually just wear it around my neck and it's pretty lightweight. Due to the light weight, it sits comfortable enough and doesn't weigh too much on the top of my head. I haven't tried the mic for calls yet, so can't speak too much on the quality.

author: Jake Jakubson
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsDidn't impress me for the price
body: These are ok. Not great, not terrible. They are kind of small for my average sized head, and the ear cups didn't quite fit over my ears well enough. The sound quality was a bit hollow and wasn't as deep or full as the pair it was going to replace. I acquired these to replace another pair I've had for two years that is starting to run through the battery more quickly. I thought I would try a different brand this time, as I hadn't strayed from another brand for years. The lack of noise cancelling was supposed to be covered by the design. It was pretty good at keeping ambient noise out, but I would not call it comparable to ANC. I ended up giving these to my young daughter to use. These headphones should come in as $49-$69 price range for what you get. Not as good as the other brand I normally purchase ($89) I have bought for me and my other children.

author: Claire
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNot noise cancelling...
body: I purchased these thinking they were noise cancelling, but they are not. I figured with the price that they would be. Otherwise, there is an app to go with the headphones to help program sound quality. JBL products have good sound quality. However, I have purchased less expensive headphones with extra features like noise cancelling that had equally great sound quality that actually seemed better because of the noise cancelling aspect. The size is what you would expect for headphones and they are not heavy. They connected to my phone easily.

author: ProFudge
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsLook At Other Brands
body: Good pair of headphones, only reason it's getting a one star is because they stopped working after only a month. How come a $90 pair of headphones break so fast, one moment they were working find, the next, the left side wasn't producing sound anymore. I love JBL brand but this honestly makes me want to look elsewhere. I didn't buy the warranty so it's as if I was given a faulty pair purposefully but thts how I feel, the fact is tht the left side stopped working after a month when they took not received any type of damage eternally or thr could leak internally so it's no reason for them to break. Probably a refurbished sold as a non refurbished if I had to guess.

author: Andrea
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsBatería duradera.
body: En general bien, sin embargo al rato tenerlos puestos suele molestar las orejas y la cabeza puesto que ejerce cierta presión y aunque traiga una pequeña almohadilla y ajustes bien el audífono la cabeza duele igual. El sonido se podría mejorar, hay una aplicación que te puedes descargar y ajustar el ecualizador sin embargo por más que se ajuste tienen un ligero sonido como a estar "dentro de un hueco" y eso al menos a mí no me gusta. Otro punto es que la gente a tu alrededor escucha todo, sobre todo si estás escuchando música con volumen alto y eso es incómodo. Las almohadillas de las orejas al rato de andarlo puestos generan mucho calor y suele incomodar un poco... yo los uso poco, pero creo que si alguien los pretende comprar para darles un uso continuo creo que son factores a tomar en consideración. Un punto a destacar es la batería, suele durar bastante tiempo.

He says they sound better than the old-school ones and the battery lasts for weeks. Six months later and he’s still happy. I can attest he gets the sound clarity he wants at lower volumes, which makes me feel better about him keeping his hearing intact.

I use them for workouts, as well as when i clean, reorganize, or just about anything else. I bring them with me WHENEVER i can.

author: C
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsLOW VOLUME
body: These headphones are just ok.  I was expecting the sound to be much higher. I should not hear someone else's conversation with the volume being at it's highest setting.  They fit over my ears ok and the sound is clear, I also like the bass level.  I had never tried JBL before and wanted to give them a try.  I really miss my Sony (not wireless) headphones, the sound was incredible. The older version of Soundcore headphones were good. Tozo headphones are Garbage, even with the app, where you can adjust the equalizer.  I'll keep these as a backup, but, definitely need to find some that are loud enough to drown out surrounding noise.  These are ok for casual use if you just want a low cost set of headphones and definitely not for an audiophile.

I was only taking them off, not running them over with car, so an $80 pair of so called high quality headphones should last longer than a year. So no, I can't recommend these headphones to anyone.... unless they enjoy wasting money on a poorly made product that'll last only a year.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat battery life and very comfortable

The color is beautiful as a purple girly and the battery life is insane. I think I've only charged them once since I got them many months ago. Some people say they don't get loud enough but I haven't had that issue at all. Great headphones for the office, working out, you name it. They are also very comfortable as someone who wears glasses. Love them!!!

title: 1.0 out of 5 starsConnection is terrible. Save yourself the money

author: John Vee
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNice headphones, failed bluetooth
body: These are comfy, sound good and had good battery life.  So why one star, and that's generous.  Mine came with firmware ver 1.0.8 which resulted in dropped bluetooth connection.  This happened repeatedly especially with a bluetooth sound transmitter  that worked perfect with other headphones and ear buds.  Seems the solution is update to firmware ver 1.0.9 which is supposed to fix this.  Except you need to download/install the Sony app on your phone, open account, log in and download the firmware update.  But, you guessed it, bluetooth will drop before the update can finish installing.  These phones are worthless and wound up in the trash.

author: Ariana
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsWhen I smile they fall
body: Pros: • The battery life is impressive and long-lasting. • As someone with smaller ears, I appreciated the variety of ear tip sizes provided, which helped ensure a more comfortable fit. Cons: • As an iPhone and Apple device user, the earbuds do not seamlessly integrate or connect automatically across my devices, which can be inconvenient. • Due to the shape of my ears and frequent smiling, the earbuds tend to loosen and eventually fall out. • To monitor battery levels, the Samsung app is required, which adds an extra step for users outside the Samsung ecosystem. While I’ve decided to return these earbuds in search of a product that better suits my personal needs, I still believe they are a great option and would recommend them to others depending on their preferences and device compatibility.

title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat Value on Sale – Comfortable and Good Quality

I came from using JBL, and you can feel the difference in quality—these sound much better, especially when paired with a Samsung device. It’s not that they lose quality on an iPhone, but they perform best with Samsung to take advantage of the software features. At the regular price of $100, I’m not sure I’d buy them, but if you find them on sale, they’re an excellent choice.

author: Michael M.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Product
body: I loved my old 1st gen Amazon Echo Buds, mainly because they fit great. The left side bud would die randomly, and a replacement was over $60 just for the one bud which was more than I spent for them when I bought them, so it was time to move on. I tried multiple other brands since then, and none would fit very good. I found a set that I liked, but they were small, and when I moved my head too much or too fast or if I was sweating at all, they would not stay in. Not sure if my ears are shaped weird or what, but I needed to find buds that came with wingtips. I was between these and JBL, chose these because they cost less at the time. No regrets at all. The wingtips provide a nice secure fit. The ear tips fit decent, although I guess I have large ear holes and the largest tips are still not QUITE big enough for optimal audio. I have some leftover tips from previous brands that fit, but they do not allow the charging case to close, and I don't want to have to take them off each time. Sound quality is great. Touch controls are good and some are customizable through the Samsung Wearable app. The active noise cancelling/ambient noise is pretty good, but not quite as good as the Echo buds were because those used Bose ANC technology. They connect quickly and effortlessly, even pairing them was a breeze. Overall, great product and would highly recommend. Glad I finally found buds that stay in my ears!

author: AP
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsThe only in-ear headphones with perfect fit
body: I have an unusual ear. I have purchased four headphones (Dime 3, Beats Solo Buds, Anker Soundcore P40i, and these Samsung Galaxy Buds FE), and this is the only one that fits my ear, even through intense workouts and when chewing or eating food or talking. The wingtips help significantly with stability, and the headphones are not clunky. They are not heavy. I also bought Spinfit custom eartips (Omni) to improve the fit / sound, which I recommend. The sound frequencies are really great and accurate. Bass is only slightly boosted. The active noise cancelling (ANC) seems selective. It blocks out lower frequencies but seems to ignore higher frequencies. Maybe this is so you can still hear voices, but things like wind or rumbling are muted. The touch control buttons are simple but not too sensitive; play, previous track, change ANC, etc. The headphones automatically pair when removing them from the charging case. The battery is pretty average. At medium volume with ANC on, it will last most of the work day, so you still need to briefly charge it in the middle of the day. Connectivity range is pretty average. If you move to an adjacent room, the connection should be stable, but even farther will likely have connectivity issues. There is an app you can install, but it is only available for Android or windows. If you only have iOS or Apple products, you're out of luck. You don't need the app to use the headphones though, just if you want change equalizer sound presets or customize touch controls.

The noise cancelling works really well, especially considering the price. I also love how easy the touch controls are to use, very intuitive and responsive. One of my favorite features is the Auto Switch between devices. It makes jumping from my phone to my tablet so much easier. I couldn’t be happier with my purchase. ✅ Comfortable and secure fit ✅ Great sound ✅ Noise cancelling works well ✅ Easy to use ✅ Auto switch is a game changer ❌ Honestly, no complaints so far!

title: 4.0 out of 5 starsPretty good, but wish there was just an app for them on iOS.
body: The earbuds are pretty good, was tricky here and there to connect and set up preferences because if you have an iPhone there is no app for them on the App Store. The only way to get around it is to have a Windows PC and download the Galaxy Buds app where you can then connect your earbuds to your computer and change the settings in the app, this works because I guess the earbuds save the settings from the app in themselves.

author: Johnny
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsTap button doesn't work
body: These are good buds but I am not able to skip any songs or answer calls. I also only got 1 of the small tips which is what I need so they keep falling out.

author: greenman
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent buds for the price
body: My Galaxy Pro 2 isn't keeping charge well anymore, so I tried all kinds of el-cheapo ear buds - a huge waste of time. None measures up to the Pro 2 (the only one that are even a tad better are the apple's buds, but those aren't cheap). So I managed to get a pair of these fe buds on black Friday on an excellent deal of about $54. I am glad I did. The fe buds are very close in sound quality to the Pro 2. The bass is rich but not overwhelming, noise cancelation is as good, and honestly the case is nice (I don't know what other negative reviews of the case are complaining about). Even for $60+ these would be a very good purchase (don't waste your time and money on el-cheapo buds - put that money towards the fe buds, you won't regret it).

author: karla kreiter
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsPoor quality
body: Did not like. Could hear fine but no one could hear me. I returned them today

author: James Bragg
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEffective
body: The best pair of earbuds I've ever had is worth the price

author: Amazon Customer
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSound Quality
body: These are the best ear buds I have owned, better than Bose.  I bought a pair for my husband too because he kept borrowing mine.

author: Madison G
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGet them over everything else
body: I love these. The way they fit in my ear is so perfect. I went on a run with them, and they didn't move or feel like they are slipping. They are so easy to use, and the sound quality is perfect. I have been using them fresh out of the box and I haven't had to charge them yet. 10/10 love these.

author: Melanie
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDefective
body: These Samsung ear buds Would not connect to my Samsung tv defective. I had to return them

author: darlenda  anderson
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat ear buds
body: These ear buds are really great  clear in sound and cancel out noise so that you are getting a quality sound clear of buds are great for me I'm  learning how the controls work but sure I can work buds

author: Leo
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsPoor design
body: Horrible stopped charging a few weeks after buying them. They fall out easily and they don’t charge very unhappy

author: MsPhancypants
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNice sporty addition to my Buds collection.
body: Great sound! I purchased these because my Galaxy Buds2 are too sensitive to the slightest external touch. These have a recessed touch point as the main control. No more accidental song skipping during a workout!

author: Illiana I Vasquez
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsFit
body: Best fit so far and the sound is great

author: Samuel
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat buy
body: They sound just as the bose $200dlls buds and have much better connectivity

author: Laron S.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing
body: Just as described, nice wonderful and comfortable design charges very quickly and efficient, marvelous range and quality and sublime noise cancelling

author: Jeff Higgins
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGREAT SOUND !
body: Really really good ear buds for my iphone.  Sound quality is just awesome!  I totally like these for in the gym.  So glad o purchased them

author: Christopher J Shea
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Value
body: I refuse to spend alot of money on earbuds since I know I'm going to lose them but I hope these stick around awhile. Great value for the performance level.

author: A man
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood shapes, Clear sounds
body: These fits into my ear very well and the sounds are much more clear and good than their previous version. I'm very satisfied with their quality and performance.

author: Blue Garcia
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorth it
body: I've had these Samsung Buds Fe for over 6 months and they still sound crisp and clear. Bass is heavy. I'm a bass head and they deliver on that front. Before this I had some Skull Candy and they don't compare. They're not in the same stratosphere the Samsung are way better. They connect to my Samsung phone flawlessly, they pick up the connection as soon as I remove them from the case they connect to Bluetooth. Battery life is not the greatest but I've found them to give me on average 4-5 hours of constant audio. Design is greatly executed they rarely come out of my ear, and the wingtip helps to keep it in place comfortably. Overall satisfied, I'd recommend these over any Cheaper earbuds. I got a case for mine and they still work brand new.

author: RJ Lan
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsA must for Samsung phones
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: I tried the JBL and Raython earbuds and these are by far my favorite. The jbls sound a little better but fall out my ears like constantly. These stay in for my entire workout, sound great on my end, no complaints on the microphone, and link to my Android phone better than the others, like automatically. If you have a Samsung phone I would definitely recommend these. Don't even bother with the others

author: Mike Weber
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsGarbage
body: These are absolute garbage!! DO NOT BUY!! the sound is horrible and the rubber tips come off inside your ear frequently. I ended up throwing them out the window. What a waste of money

author: Western Realm
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThey are really great. Buy them.
body: I've been using these for a long time now. They work great. This week I accidentally washed one ear bud, not once but twice, in the washing mmachine. I put it in rice overnight and it still works. I can't believe it. They hook up easily. They have helped me find my phone when I dropped it by the car. I can't say enough. If i can say anything negative and its not bad, but the fit is a little awkward, like putting a jelly bean in your ear.

author: GayleH
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsCheap is what you get
body: static in left ear bud unless they are 100% charged. Won't connect to my calls- I can hear the call but they can't hear me. In order to speak with Samsung, my wait is 6 hours and 26 minutes/306 customers in front of me. Don't buy these.

author: Satisfied
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDoes.not have a cordless charger
body: This came with a white charger that only charged with a cable and did not have cordless charging capability.

author: Walter Winstead
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBest earbuds Ive ever had
body: I rarely write reviews.  I have to be super impressed with product to feel compelled to do so.  This is one of those times.  These earbuds have clarity I havent experienced before.  The bass is excellent.  Its crazy how good the sound is on these.  Couple them with a prime day deals, and Im very very happy.

author: Stephanie
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEasy to connect
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: Nice. Good sound. Connect easy

author: Tunsy
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsCute
body: So far so good. I was sad samsung didn't have my rose gold samsung galaxy buds live one's anymore cause they match my rose gold samsung phone. One ear bud stopped working so it was time to get a new pair. I love the white  it's cute and little case. The sound is great I can pick if I want to cancel out the background mouses or just leave as is. I worked out with them the battery definitely lasts longer than my previous pair I workout for 2hrs. I haven't tested them at work yet 8hr shift we'll see. Great quality. Light and easy to keep in my purse.

author: Casablanca Kid
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIncredible headphones 🎧
body: I love my samsung headphones, they work so well. I'd highly recommend picking them up.

author: Jacinda Ruzicka
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Earbuds!
body: I bought the Samsung Galaxy Buds FE a few weeks ago, and overall, I’m really impressed for the price. The sound quality is surprisingly good—bass is punchy without drowning out vocals, and everything sounds clear whether I’m listening to music or taking calls. The active noise cancellation works well, especially in places like buses or coffee shops, and the earbuds fit securely thanks to the wingtip design, which I find more comfortable than other models I’ve tried. Battery life easily lasts me through the day, and I usually get around 5 to 6 hours per charge with ANC on, plus extra from the case. I do wish it had wireless charging and better water resistance, and the touch controls can be a little finicky at times. Also, the mic quality is just okay—it gets the job done but isn’t great in loud environments. Still, for under $100, I think these earbuds are a great value, especially if you’re already using a Samsung phone since they integrate really well with Galaxy features like Auto Switch and SmartThings Find.

author: Worth Page
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsMedical warning
body: Literally watch for inner ear infections.

author: Jay Gonzales
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGet yourself a pair they are great!
body: Way better than expected! especially for the price! def, rec. get yourself a pair they are great!

author: dadyj20
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsQuality ear buds
body: Quality ear buds from Samsung. Light wait and long battery life.

author: Emmayur
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDO NOT BUY...YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!
body: Wouldn't buy these again and wish I never bought them in the first place. After 4 months of use the right earbud became muffled. Customer service was a nightmare so I figured I'd just use the left one since I usually only use one at a time anyways. The left one now sounds muffled. Both earbuds now have to be full volume just to make out what is being said in videos and songs. I keep my ears clean and I cleaned the earbuds many times with an alcohol prep pad as well as a cotton swab soaked in alcohol. After doing some research, this seems to be a very common problem with this model. Reached out to samsung a 2nd time and got tossed around to different departments multiple times and then landed 15th in the queue with an hour ETA for help. Not worth it. Do yourself a favor and learn from my mistake.  Get a different pair of earbuds because these will fail you sooner or later. If I could give 0 stars I would.

author: CK
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNot reliable
body: Too smart for their own good. Need to map functions to the button-press commands, but there are more functions than there are commands. Left side broke down after two and a half months. Sound was good until breaking, so yay. I wouldn't even want a replacement pair. It will be more satisfying to grind it under my heel once a new brand arrives.

author: Strider
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsLeft ear bud stopped working
body: Had these for a about 6 months and use them a few times a week. Recently the left ear bud started having scratchy audio and no the left ear bud no longer player audio. I have tried every troubleshooting tip possible but it no longer works. What's worse is I'm in the middle of a deployment and rely on these to listen to music when I lift.

author: Jonathan Ellis
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBeen great since day one.
body: work well, I've had no issues whatsoever.

author: Paulo L.
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsNot seamless, app connectivity not working sound quality just OK
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: It took too long to connect these things to my iPhone; however, my Windows PC picked them up right away. Once I finally got them connected to my iPhone, I realized the bass was not very good. So I downloaded the app to try to adjust the settings.  After 20 minutes of trying to connect them to the app (even though they were already connected to the iPhone), I gave up. I'm sending them back. I would not recommend these, at least to iPhone users.

author: S. Slaughter
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsMusic to my ears
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: Love these! I hate things in my ears but these are comfortable, noise reducing, and they do not fall out of your ear.

author: Shawn Fultz
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsLosing sound quality
body: Just after a few months of use they already started to lose it's sound quality. These are pretty low quality headphones for the price.

author: TomiKlima
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNice price for the quality
body: For the price they are amazing! I have Samsung phone and watch, they integrate in a very easy way. The active noise cancellation is awesome and the battery is also very long lasting. Really recommended if you don’t want to spend 300 bucks in the regular buds.

author: anthony shaffer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNot worth it
body: If you are considering these, I would recommend spending a bit more for a nicer set. The driver in the right bud failed within 2 months. I had to send them to Samsung, who forgot to tell me to take my silicone covers off and did not return them. I was without the ear buds for over 2 weeks while they repaired them and refused to replace with a new set. Now it's been just about 12 months since the repair the driver has gone out again and I am outside of warranty and they are not willing repair them. Beyond that the ANC was kind of buggy and would switch on and off on its own and any sharp noises like weights dropped in the gym would cause a painful loud popping in your ear. I'm extremely disappointed in these ear buds

author: R.  G
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsChange the color of the case to match the color of the earbuds
body: Color: Samsung is a good company.. I was going to return the first set of earbuds because the case was white and I assume that the earbuds were also, which is not what I ordered, I ordered graphite a grayish black color .... so I ordered another pair and this time I looked Inside of the newer one and the case was white but the buds inside were graphite....so I decided to open the  first case and there was the dark graphite earbuds that I was going to send back and those were also graphite gray black earbuds... perhaps you can change the cover for the case matches what's inside....... just saying

author: theresa hammett
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsWasted money
body: I usually love this brand of earbuds but these are the worse.  I could have ever received.  The sound quality is bad.  People can barely hear me on a phone call.  Back ground noise is terrible.  My limited edition ear buds from BTS which was years ago is better then these in every way.  Don't waste your money.

author: S & H
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood!
body: The sound is good and comfortable to wear. I accidentally had one of them go through the washer and dryer, still work perfectly! Don't recommend cleaning them that way... but if it happens once they should still work!

author: Kathleen L.
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsstopped working after 1 month
body: I have only had these for a month and they stopped working.

author: Britt mathis
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsUncomfortable
body: Very uncomfortable. The hard plastic of the ear piece pressed on my ear so much it became sore and sensitive. I can't wear them for more then an a hour. If it was of a softer material would rate it higher

author: Dion S.
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsCrackling sound
body: Sound cuts out and crackles from time to time. Fits 'ok', but not great.

author: fernando
title: 2.0 out of 5 starssorry
body: Sorry, but the sound continues to break up while you listen to it. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5-star review

author: Ray
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLove them. Got 3 times.
body: Great for keeping around the neck or one ear. Got 3 times.

author: Leland Vaughan
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWorse Headphones for moving around and being active
body: That is not a solid band as it appears in all of the pictures. It's a shaped wire band wrapped in rubber that wants to snap closed, very uncomfortable on the back of your neck. It also causes the headphone to angle out and slip as you start to move around. I bought these specifically to wear with a hat while I was outside working and they get worse the more you move around. Terrible headphones.

author: Disappointed Customer
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAlmost Perfect
body: Getting close to being the perfect headphones. I have never had a pair that fits and doesn’t fall off like these. Buuuut, like others have said, they work poorly outside. And the LED flashing light is bright as the sun. Other than those two things, perfect.

author: Josh
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNot too shabby.
body: These headphones are probably one of my favorite. I would love to give it five stars, but unfortunately, they only last about six months because they break where the green meets the black…. I took a picture of a stock photo and made  blue circles around them to show you where they tend to separate… you have to be very fragile with them when putting them away.  The sound is probably the best I’ve heard and they even beat some of the most expensive ones that exceed $100. They are lightweight and I just like the quality of the sound. If they wouldn’t break, they would be a solid five stars. I have purchased them over the years and I’ve probably gone through five of them.

author: GC
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsterrible
body: Worked fine in my apartment but when I use these outside the audio constantly skips to the point that they're unusable. I'm guessing it's interference from other wireless and bluetooth frequencies I encounter out in the world.

author: Yesi
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Headphones!
body: Great sound quality. Easy to connect. Use them for work since we aren’t allowed to use ear buds.. charge lasts a good while too.

author: Kat
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat headphones
body: Great headphones, small, work well, and they can be stored easily.

author: Joe G
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent Headphones
body: I usually do not write reviews, but these headphones  work so well I had to. They have fantastic  sound and are very comfortable vs in the ear airpods, or ear buds. The functions  all work well, and the price is more than affordable! Again,  excellent  product!!

author: online shopperJL
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsLess volume .
body: Volume on max less than when using corded headphones.

author: WLB
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsCompatibility with eye glasses and behind the ear hearing aids
body: Does not stay in position well when wearing glasses and behind the ear hearing aids.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsFell apart less than one year after purchase
body: Sound quality is good and the earphone are confortable to wear all day. But the band between the two earpieces failed after 9 months, the plastic tubing cracked and split, exposing the very thin wire core. Even after taping it with electrical tape couldn't repair the band and the whole thing fell apart less than one year after purchase.

author: Eve in Decatur
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsWorks great but uncomfortable
body: These were simple to pair and to use with my audio books on my Google Pixel. I especially like the easy-to-use 4-way controls on the ear. However, the earpiece is uncomfortably thick and pinches the tops of my ears. The springy cord in the back makes this worse by pulling back and down on the ears.

author: Omar
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNot New! Very Misleading
body: I bought this headset thinking it was brand new, but unfortunately, it turned out to be old, broken, and honestly disgusting. It looks used and not in good condition at all. Very disappointed with this purchase — definitely not what was advertised. I don’t recommend it to anyone.

author: Ronald J. Ferriolo
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsLimited Volume
body: It works fine and the sound is good but the volume is very limited. Perhaps that is for hearing protection, which I cannot complain about...

author: Paul T.
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood value
body: These are good! Quite light, and quite durable (there's an older model with a mini-D USB and that didn't fare as well, but the USB-C seems fine). Sound quality is fine, they're pretty comfortable, and while the docs are not fabulous, I have been able to pair them with anything I need to. I wear mine about 8-9 hours a day with glasses and they're fine.

author: Lisa B
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsSuper comfortable!
body: I love these headphones! This is the second pair I’ve purchased. They fit easily over the ear without causing any discomfort even when worn all day long. The sound quality is good and the volume is adjustable. I especially like that they don’t block out all the surrounding noise so that you can wear them safely when you’re out walking easily hearing people or bikers coming up around you. I would recommend these to anybody who’s looking for headphones.

author: Maggie G
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsJust what I needed.
body: I love this headset. I have very small ears and ear buds do not stay in. These are the perfect answer. They're small, lightweight, and have great sound. I finally wore out my other set so immediately ordered a replacement.

author: Keith Le
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsSound quality not great
body: The sound quality was not great.  Bluetooth connection is spotty at times, even at close range, resulting in momentary gaps in the sound stream.

author: mary k. dennis
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNice Head phones but won't stay on my ears
body: I purchased back in September, 2024 to use at the gym but now (6/25) they won't stay on ears.  I don't what to do because I thought they would last longer.  I don't know what to do.

author: Philoponos
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsBright Flashing Light a constant annoyance
body: The speakers connect readily and work fine. They connect to my iPad readily, charge pretty quickly, are comfortable, and the sound is pretty good. They must be powered off after use, or the battery will drain even when not in use. However, the very bright "Bluetooth connected" light on the right earpiece blinks every four or five seconds and apparently cannot be disabled (no instructions came with them), making them unusable for reading in bed at night. The light is so bright that in a darkened room it intrudes into my peripheral vision and is very objectionable to my wife. The light even bleeds past Sharpie ink (first attempt at a fix) and electrical tape (second attempt). Without the light show, I would have given them four or five stars.

author: ANJELICA M DAPPIO
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsExcellent headphones
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: The first pair I ever bought, I still have (going on 4 years) they work amazing and I’ve yet to have any issues with them. The only thing I could say negative is over time, they become more loose and aren’t as snug to my ears, but they still function perfectly. The charge lasts FOR DAYS, I feel like I barely need to charge them, even after 4 years!! I struggle with “in-ear” headphones and NEED headphones that go over my ears, and these are great for that! Because I love this style so much, I was worried over time I’d eventually have to replace them so I wanted to have a back up pair. The second pair I received are terrible. The buttons on the headphones themselves don’t always work and I have to keep clicking to try to do volume up or down or to go to the next song or even pause while playing. And the charging port is faulty. I have to move the charger around til it starts charging then can’t move the headphones from that position or they won’t charge. I thought maybe it was just the cord itself that came with them, but I have tried other USB chargers that work for that style of headphone, and it’s not the chargers, it’s the headphones themselves. I would say 5 stars because of the first pair, but I am only giving 4 stars because of the second pair I purchased. I truly think these are a GREAT item, I’m hoping it was just a fluke with the second pair?

author: Justin D. Morris
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsGood headphones but no carry pouch
body: Item works well and provides excellent sound quality. I'm only giving 4 stars because there's no carry pouch included. Edit: I subtracted an additional star because they are not very secure compared to another model I used. I think it's because the connector strap is flimsy and not a hard plastic like some other models. This will cause it to fall off your ears when lying down so if you bought them for gym use like I did, you may find them limiting depending on the exercises you want to do. I'm now considering a return.

author: EllaKay
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsAfter 9 months of heavy usage, I have to recommend.
body: Love these. Bought them in Sept 2024. Outside of the shower and in bed, I wear them basically constantly. CONSTANTLY. I can do that bc they're super light and comfy. SO, not super surprising when the plastic by the earpiece where it meets the neck strap cracked in Feb 2025.  I reached out to the company, and they refunded me. Huge plus. The unit continued to work however, until now in June -- the neckstrap itself has cracked and only one side is audible. So even though they wear out under heavy usage, I am about to buy again. Worth it for me bc there aren't a lot of other headsets like this, esp with BT 5.0 and USB C charging.  I habitually charge every night but on the occasion I forget, that battery lasts! (Again, heavy usage!) Love that they can connect to multiple sources at once too, and connection is stable, sound is good. Plus I'm from the 20th century lol so I love dedicated buttons for volume up/down, track forward/back, pause/play. All in all, highly recommend!

author: Christine
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat!
body: Why did you pick this product vs others?: Great!

author: KD
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsCharge
body: These never charge anymore I’d barely have them a year

author: Amber Staab
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsLasted one year
body: Sound quality was meh (had to crank the volume usually), no issues with battery life, buttons, or range; was a little rough to wear for long periods (beware if your skull isn't small enough and the ear pieces can rub your ears uncomfortably regardless) My set only lasted a year; I used them about four times a week, maybe an hour or so at a time - finally the connector between an ear piece and the main band snapped in half

author: nancy
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWaste of money as it not rechargeable
body: Worked well until it needed the battery to be recharged. It was NOT rechargeable despite numerous attempts and the earphones are now totally worthless.

author: henry b. price
title: 5.0 out of 5 stars10/9
body: Works great at My job

author: Kevin A. Ward
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsFragile after design change
body: I use headphones almost constantly, so I need these over the ear types for comfort.  These were aptly named as the charge does last a long time. I usually have two on hand so one can be charging while I use the other.  If one would inevitably wear out or get a short, I would just buy another.  But lately the design has changed somewhat, and the last two I have bought fell apart in less than a month. I am unable to repair them.  Sadly I must seek a different replacement due to inferior quality.

author: Kevin Bemis
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsShort Lived
body: Works for a couple of months, then will not connect! Hard to turn off!

author: Amazon Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsNot good durability
body: The battery is fantastic. The plastic band held its form for 9 months, then broke.

author: borncountry
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThese headphones do what I need
body: These are NOT noise cancelling headphones.  That being said, they do deliver fine sound.  I use them to listen to books while crocheting and these fit all my criteria.  I have sensitive ears and cannot use earbuds or anything that goes into my ears.  These do not hug my ears, but I didn't want them to.  They do fold up nicely to fit in my purse or bag and all the control buttons are on the right ear. They are lightweight and I have no problems connecting to my phone.  For what I paid, these are a great value.  If they die, it's not expensive to replace them.

author: Tim R. Dagosta
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsThey stopped working, bought a new pair and they stopped working too.
body: The headphones are good until they simply stop turning on. I have gone through 2 pairs of these headphones. I like the quality of them for the price, but with both pairs they stopped powering on suddenly. They were working one day, then not working the next. Since this happened with 2 different pair, I cannot recommend this product.

author: Antonio Robinson
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Exercise headset
body: Great item fits comfortably and sounds great!

author: ANN D
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat lightweight headphones
body: My son got me these and they work great. I needed something lightweight and these fit great

author: Dave Norman
title: 3.0 out of 5 stars7 months and done
body: Great until they weren't.  Seven months and they no longer work.

author: uno123
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsLiteral Trash Unfortunately
body: These went straight into the trash.  They fit, but they are very uncomfortable.  The material is cheap and so is the design.  The part that goes above the ear is painful to wear, but I'm sensitive.

author: Amazon Customer
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsSTOPPED WORKING AFTER 6 months - don't buy them they are junk
body: This headset worked for 6 months and then stopped working.  it is junk.  which i guess is why it is so cheap.  don't buy it.  and the worst thing is there is zero customer support

author: Rickokc
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent quality, design and HD sound
body: For this very small style headset, the audio quality is excellent with EQ on my mobile player set to ROCK. The headset returns to coiled up when removed from my head. Very clever. Super long battery life. Too long to accurately measure. Paired with my phone and Windows PC quickly and streams true stereo from both. Headset controls are easy to use and click when pressed. The fitting is very tight. Maybe a little too tight for my fat man head. It certainly won't fall off. That is for sure. Shipping was very fast. --- The only negative that I have found on this product is the huge flashing blue light on the right speaker. I simply can't go around flashing lights in front of people. Some people are epileptic. Where I live, the waitress won't take my order if I am flashing blue lights all over the place. I don't understand why everything on this product is so perfect then they add a giant blue lighthouse beam on the device. Why?

author: steve sinofsky
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsIt's junk
body: Piece of junk,broke in 5 weeks and can't return 1 week past 30 day dead line ridiculous, don't buy this product.

author: Babs Gordon
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsToo tight around head
body: Too tight. Definitely won't be comfortable with these as there's no give for them.

author: I didn’t get what I ordered. I received 1 bottle of moisturizing gel in error
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for working out
body: Perfect for walking and workouts.

author: CherylP
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsHave to replace after 2 months!
body: I purchased these headphones March 8, 2025. By May 8, 2025 (so 2 months), the housing on the left side where the wires go from the earpiece to the neckpiece broke.  Now, the wire is exposed to sweat and the joint there will become limp and not stay put on my ear. I love these headphones, but I am giving them one star because there is no way to get product support.  Make sure when you buy products like this, there is some way to reach the seller.

author: tiramesu
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsbreaks quickly
body: This is 3-d and the last time I bought this and they all are braking after 5 months of usage.  The headphone is OK while it lasts, but do not expect it to work longer than 6 months

author: Robg
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsFavorite Pair for Exercise
body: These headphones are loud, comfortable, and great for running, weightlifting, and biking. Battery Life is also a huge plus these things last 2 weeks with constant use. Only one Con: The wire that holds them firm on the ear tends to break after a year and it starts flopping around. Still worth the price though.

author: Vanilla_Gorilla_8it
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood for cycling
body: Sound quality is pretty good, I use them when bicycling and motorcycling, been using them for several months they seem to be holding up well battery life has lasted longer than my longest rides, they connect quickly and easily, they won't fall out of your ear while riding a motorcycle, and they don't look bad

author: MSOJ
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsProduct description is completely false
body: Leaving this review to correct the product description: No, it does not have active noise cancelling (ANC). This is straight up false. No, it doesn't work with glasses No, it doesn't work for larger heads. A good cheap headset for gym activity for smaller heads without glasses, charges over USB-C, sounds ok

author: Anne Egbert
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsPerfect for side sleepers! & just about everything else
body: Needing help with sleep, I have tried about every kind of headphone that I could find, including individual buds which inevitably fell out.  I use these headphones as well as for podcast and books on tape in the day. These are perfect for those needs.  Furthermore, as a physician I noted many patients with ear wax or infections from earbuds—not a problem with these.  the battery last 36 hours easily. Sound quality is good.  Recently they have changed to C plugs, an advantage.  One does have to read the directions if more than one headphone is attached, but by following directions, I have several attached easily.  The main disadvantage I found is they are not loud enough to use in airplanes.  Plus, I forget that I have them on, as they are so comfortable.  PS At age 71 I’m no techno geek.

author: Lierre Keith
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsCheap Junk
body: Broke 6 weeks after purchase. Don't bother with these--cheap junk.

author: Miguel
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsExcellent
body: Excellent

author: John
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHeadset Bluetooth

author: Trent
title: 5.0 out of 5 stars5 star headphones
body: My fourth pair, I love them so much they work wonderful!

author: San Pedro Dude
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsGreat at first, but made of cheap material and falling apart
body: These worked great and I loved them: but after a year they have already fallen apart, as the plastic on the sides crumbled and the wires and adjustment mechanism stick out and poke my head. One year for $25.00 is not worth it.

author: Elenie
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood value
body: Good value for the cost. Flexible and comfortable.  Good sound quality, connectivity and range.

author: Jimmyb
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsVery comfortable. Forgot I had them on
body: These are very lightweight, yet very clear. Functionality is great. The color blends right in. The buttons are easy to use and display a wide range of sounds. Great value for your money

author: GREG
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsSTOPPED WORKING IN LESS THAN A YEAR
body: They lasted less than a year. I bought these headphones less than a year ago and after using them a few dozen times, they stopped charging and stopped connecting to my bluetooth phone.  Very disappointed.

author: cloudshade
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBasic & good for doing household chores
body: Perfect for doing housework. I don't have to worry about buds dropping out of my ears (I dont like things in my ears anyway)  or a headset slipping off my head. I can hear if my kid calls for me & any other environmental noise that I need to be aware of. I can answer a call if needed. They are decent basic headphones & the price is right. I wish they would make more wrap arounds.

author: Bob
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGood things come in a small package
body: Connected quickly to iPhone. Folds up very compactly. Good to listen and use to talk on phone.

author: V. DeLuca
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsYou get what you pay for
body: You get what you pay for. I've purchased similar style other brands, these are not useful. Although they are comfortable, you can hardly hear out of them. Disappointed.

author: Ricky
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHighly Recommend these Great Headphones
body: I've had these for awhile now and they've been exactly what I needed.  Very lightweight.  Always connect easily to Bluetooth.  I can wear them for hours and never notice.  I originally bought them for wearing while exercising but I ended up wearing them just around the house when listening to music or also while listening to my TV when my roommates are asleep.  Can't recommend them enough.

But I'll use them until I find something better. I don't hate them but I don't like them. Only bought them to wear under my skateboard helmet.

body: I love these! They are so comfortable, lightweight, and the sound quality is excellent. I mainly use them around my home and outside in the yard. I'm going to order another set to share ;)

If you only use them for running or walking you may be fine but if you lay back on a bench or do any other kind of bending they will fall off. Also, due to their small size, any movement makes the the sound go in and out as the speaker changes directions.

body: I have to wear safety glasses & the back band kept getting pushed up by uniform collar & causing the whole thing to slip off. So I cannot say anything about sound quality or other aspects of this product. Maybe good for recreational purposes.

author: daknapke
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsAverage OK
body: I'm a musician,  so my standard for sound is probly higher than most,  I give these headphone a average score for sound. The bass was not a solid as I hoped for and even with a  upgraded ea app used on my phone I couldn't dual in what I wanted.  For the period they are good,  but I'm a big guy and they fit a little tight.  Ear buds never fit me and I couldn't get a snug fit for bass. I am looking at a more expensive pair but these where ok, get what ya pay for.

author: Emma Foster
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsUncomfortable
body: These are terribly uncomfortable. I hate to say that, but they are just horrible.

author: LHop0901
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsNeed to constantly re-pair to my phone
body: These work so well when they work, but I have to constantly re-pair them to my phone, which is really annoying.

author: david harper
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsLight and portable
body: The product works as stated and is good value for the money.  Wired and wireless earbuds always seem to fall out of my ear while walking or just sitting still on a chair or on a plane. Big headphones usually are too bulky to travel with.  These behind-the-head earphones are a better solution for me.  They are light and foldable and can easily be carried in a pants or jacket pocket making it perfect for the traveler.  It charges with the provided USB cable.

author: AKR
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsBluetooth is weak
body: I’ve purchased this brand and a very similar brand multiple times. I’ve never had a problem with the Bluetooth connection in either brand, but the latest versions of both are bad. This one is better than the other brand’s latest version, but it still has issues sometimes. I think it’s mostly when I’m around my gf who also has a similar pair of headphones. The old version didn’t have this issue, but now it’s not only causing my audio to cut out, but does the same for my gf’s headphones. Edit. Went out for a run on my own and it still did it a lot. Might return.

author: Skipster
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsHard to put on, but they won't fall off
body: They are somewhat difficult to put on, due to the wire between them. The sound quality is good and they are very easy to use (forward, back volume up and down) while not looking at them. You can feel the arrows, etc. A con is that you can't opt to keep only one in your ear (in order to hear other's better and not look anti-social). I like the idea of earbuds not falling out and getting lost in the outdoors, but I've found that I don't like them being tethered together. The over the ear loops work well enough, without having to have them joined. I'm keeping them, bc you can never have too many, but I also got some that are over-the-ear and not conjoined. The sound quality is good

author: Sn_Gz
title: 2.0 out of 5 starsBad

There is no way to adjust the ear pieces or strap, so if your head and ears arent aligned perfectly to this design, its going to frustrate you too. I will have to give it away to someone that can use it. Very sad about not being able to use this.

I have a small head, in fact I buy hats in the children’s section, but these headphones were so snug that it felt torturous to wear them. When I attempted to adjust and stretch a wee bit, the earpiece plastic snapped apart.  Maybe nice for a child but I do not recommend for adults, even those of us who have small heads. Great sound….. extremely tight fit, not comfortable.

I love these headphones, but I can't afford another pair right now. I ordered my most recent pair of these on February 17, 2025 (the ones that won't connect to my laptop). It would be really helpful if I could get some advice or anything that will help me get my new pair to connect to my laptop, I'd really hate to have to find another pair that I actually like and work good. Thank you!

author: T. Allen
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsI've seen better...
body: Used to buy openfit by Shokz until I lost my case and learned there's zero way of recharging them, even when I bought a SECOND pair of those, the old headphones would not charge/sync with the new case.  Stupid design. So I bought these figuring I'd save a ton of money on the same basic design... They're kind of a pain to put back into the case: I know the adjustability of them is supposed to be a feature, but more than making them more comfortable to wear, it makes them more a pain to put back into the case for charging. The bluetooth connectivity is iffy: Been disconnected during calls with my boss...then reconnected...then disconnected... Paring was easy enough with setup, but when all is said and done, I feel more a mild sense of dread pulling these out for use than thoughtless ease.

author: Dan Hoang
title: 3.0 out of 5 starsGood decent headphones, not reliable for calls.
body: Keeps losing microphone connection to iphone during calls. This has happened when the phone was nearby. Otherwise I would give this set of headphones a solid 5 stars due to low sale price and decent sound quality. The comfort level is a solid four stars for me, I do feel the weight of the headphone on one of my sensitive ears after a couple hours of wearing during walking. In order to use the Soundcore app to aid with pairing, and to setup sound profile you must register by giving your email address. In conclusion, this pair of headphones are good for listening to music or podcasts while working out , and still be able to hear the world around you.

author: Rosemarie
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWOW! Amazing sound!!!!

Powerful, crisp sound with great base tone. No distortion to speak of. I am not a sponsored reviewer, just one ultra-satisfied customer with this product!

The sound is very boxy, even with EQ adjustments. Bass is almost nonexistent but that’s kinda expected. Honestly, even if I wanted to listen to podcasts, I won’t prefer using these I read a review about the microphone not being good, I tested it while I was in a quiet room, and I was told that there was a lot of echos, and I sounded far, I could imagine it being much worse when I’m outside I have a pair of open earbuds that were half the price, and I had a much better sound experience, that it was actually good!

author: Public and Honest
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsV20 - High quality sound with solid BT connection
body: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Incredible Open-Ear Headphones – A Game-Changer! I am absolutely blown away by the Soundcore V20i by Anker! These open-ear headphones deliver an unbeatable combination of comfort, sound quality, and functionality. The adjustable ear hooks ensure a snug, ultra-comfortable fit that stays secure no matter how active I am—perfect for workouts, commuting, or just relaxing. The sound quality is phenomenal—crisp, powerful, and immersive, without the discomfort of in-ear buds. Calls are crystal clear, thanks to the advanced mic technology, and the IP55 rating means I don’t have to worry about sweat or light rain. With 36 hours of playtime, I rarely need to charge them, and Bluetooth 5.4 ensures a rock-solid connection. The multipoint connection is a huge plus, allowing me to switch seamlessly between my phone and laptop. Anker has truly outdone itself with the V20i—these are hands-down the best open-ear earbuds I’ve ever used. Highly recommend! 🎧🔥

author: Dennis-Sari
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsBitchin!
body: These are the best earbuds I've used. I've used Galaxy buds, pixel buds, air pods, bose, etc. I'm not saying the sound quality is superior by any means, but the comfort, the open ear design, and the app is just chef's kiss. I'll keep coming back to these when I need a new pair of earbuds.

body: Stopped pairing after 6 weeks. Really liked them up to now. Tried usual troubleshooting.  Reached out to Soundcore and they responded right away. Hopefully can get it fixed.

author: Tatyanna Robinson
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsOverall good earphones
body: It works pretty good and the fit is comfortable. I recommend downloading the app that way you can adjust the quality of the sounds.

author: BW
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat Sounding Earbuds
body: These are probably the best sounding earbuds for the money that I have ever owned. They have a very rich full sound with great bass response for earbuds. The EQ in the app is easy to use and gives decent variety in sound customization. ONE IMPORTANT NOTE: These have a built-in overheat killswitch, so if you use them in the sauna, they will shut down after about 10 minutes. Its inconvenient, but then again its not a true fitness earbud, so can't fault it.

author: David Thornton
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreat pair of headphones
body: For the price, these have been great. They are very comfortable. The sound quality is good.

title: 5.0 out of 5 starsHead phones
body: i would buy these again.

author: Nick B
title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat sound, comfortable fit, excellent features -- but with a few minor issues.
body: PROS: + "Full" sounding audio with lots of volume and EQ ranges to hear different parts of music clearly. Doesn't sound tinny or overly compressed like budget headphones often do. For me, they're more than adequate, and punch well above their weight for the price you pay. + Lots of EQ settings in the app to fine-tune the sound to what you want. Wasn't overly impressed with the sound quality at first but with the right settings, they sound great. + Open-ear design allows you to hear your surroundings, doesn't muffle your own voice, and makes the sound feel more "natural" without the added pressure of an in-ear fit. + IP55 rating is supposed to be sweat and dust resistant, making these safe to use outdoors and during exercise where those elements might ordinarily cause issues on other devices. + Adjustable ear piece with four click-positions helps to find a preferred position for best sound, and the ear hook stays in place well even during outdoor exercise, so long as nothing directly snags on it to yank it off. + Microphone quality seems to be pretty good for answering calls; haven't had any issues with people struggling to hear me, and when asked they said it sounded fine. + Multi-point connection to two simultaneous devices. It's always paired to my phone, but then I can also connect to my Steam Deck to hear game sound, and it'll switch based on audio input for each device when necessary. + Low-latency "gaming mode" eliminates sound delay almost entirely, allowing for a seamless bluetooth gaming experience. + Excellent warranty support. I had an issue with one bud after a drop, and Anker sent a replacement (refurbished, I believe) immediately. + Charging case is relatively compact; I like how slim it is, making it fit into various pockets on my pants or shirt without creating an uncomfortable bulge that strains the fabric. + Battery life seems to be reasonable. Not sure if these would last playing continuous sound at high volume for a full eight hour work day, but I've had them "on" for up to 12 hours at time while sporadically listening to podcasts for hours at a time, and they usually last long enough to get through the day. + Comfortable fit that I can wear all day. I wear glasses, and will often wear a second pair of sun glasses or safety glasses over my prescriptions, and even with all that I don't experience any discomfort around my ears when adding these earbuds to the mix. + Multicolor LED lights on the earbuds that can sync to the music. You can't see them yourself during use unless you look in the mirror, and I prefer them to stay off for better battery and a more incognito look, so to me this is a complete non-factor, but could be a "pro" if you care about that. CONS: - Unhelpful charge indicator on the case, and on the buds themselves. On the case, it's a single tiny light that's either solid to show >45%, or blinking to show <45%. It's not the most intuitive thing in the world, and the included manual doesn't even tell you this in the first place; I had to look it up on their website after realizing I had no idea what the light actually meant. It only shows when you put a bud back in, so it might be >45% when you finish using them, then be 15% or whatever by the time it finishes charging the earbuds. I've had times when I've just run out of charge unexpectedly because the light wasn't informative enough, and with it being such a tiny inconspicuous light it takes conscious effort to think to check it so I would sometimes just miss the fact that the case charge was low. The buds themselves also don't show their charge level on the device itself, only in the app -- seems like the colored LED lights could show the charge level with colors so you know what level they're at when you remove them from the case. Would also be nice if the case could have more than one light to show more granular charge levels, and if they were in a more prominent, visible spot. - The touch controls are slightly awkward to use. The earbuds have a very large outer surface area, and yet seemingly only the center portion of it is touch-sensitive, which leads to a lot of missed inputs where I tap slightly off-center and get nothing, or accidentally trigger a single-tap when I was trying to do a double-tap, or accidentally trigger a double-tap when repeatedly missing a single-tap, and other such issues. I use sun hoodies and caped hats to protect my ears and neck when exercising outdoors, and when they start to get soaked with sweat they trigger the touch controls on each earbud. So I often find myself disabling the touch controls altogether, and then have to adjust volume and whatever else on my smart watch or phone. - Potential durability issues with moving parts on the adjustable earpiece. One time recently I was removing my bike helmet and a strap caught on the earpiece, making it fall to the asphalt. Afterward it got stuck in one position and couldn't switch to other positions without a concerning amount of force, which was necessary to put it back in the case and again afterward to get a good fit for my ear. I used silicone grease on the plastic housing hoping to get it moving again, which worked for a while, but then a week later the speaker shorted out and stopped working altogether. Not sure if that was from my lubricant, or delayed damage from the drop, or both. Anker was quick to replace it under warranty, and the warranty itself is generous at 18 months, so it should be good for a while longer, but may mean a more limited lifespan if the moving earpiece is an actual weakspot in the construction. - As an open-ear speaker, it doesn't allow for any noise cancelling or decibel reduction, so these are not ideal to use in all situations where you might want to drown-out unwanted sounds. Not necessarily a "con" considering the open-ear is also a "pro," but just something you have to be aware of.

author: Trey
title: 5.0 out of 5 starsComfortable and stay in place
body: Great for people who are bothered by the in-ear buds.

author: Bubbles

author: france family
title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDo not order!
body: Do not order these.  I am currently returning to company as the right ear bud does not charge.  They lasted about 5 months.

author: Raquel
